The event status code, as reported by the event source.

For example, in a Windows Failed Authentication event, this would be the value of 'Failure Code', e.g. 0x18.

Should be set to true if disposition_id = Alert among other dispositions, and/or risk_level_id or severity_id of the event is elevated. Not all control events will be alertable, for example if disposition_id = Exonerated or disposition_id = Allowed.

message.description: The description of the event/finding, as defined by the source.

authorizations.caption: Authorization Information
authorizations.description: Provides details about an authorization, such as authorization outcome, and any associated policies related to the activity/event.

folder.caption: Folder
folder.description: The folder that is the target of the query.

status_code.caption: Status Code
status_code.description:
The event status code, as reported by the event source.

For example, in a Windows Failed Authentication event, this would be the value of 'Failure Code', e.g. 0x18.

query_info.caption: Query Info
query_info.description: The search details associated with the query request.

risk_level.caption: Risk Level
risk_level.description: The risk level, normalized to the caption of the risk_level_id value.

malware.caption: Malware
malware.description: A list of Malware objects, describing details about the identified malware.

malware_scan_info.caption: Malware Scan Info
malware_scan_info.description: Describes details about the scan job that identified malware on the target system.

status_detail.caption: Status Detail
status_detail.description: The status detail contains additional information about the event/finding outcome.

is_alert.caption: Alert
is_alert.description: Indicates that the event is considered to be an alertable signal. Should be set to true if disposition_id = Alert among other dispositions, and/or risk_level_id or severity_id of the event is elevated. Not all control events will be alertable, for example if disposition_id = Exonerated or disposition_id = Allowed.

cloud.caption: Cloud
cloud.description: Describes details about the Cloud environment where the event was originally created or logged.

policy.caption: Policy
policy.description: The policy that pertains to the control that triggered the event, if applicable. For example the name of an anti-malware policy or an access control policy.

action_id.caption: Action ID
action_id.description: The action taken by a control or other policy-based system leading to an outcome or disposition. An unknown action may still correspond to a known disposition. Refer to disposition_id for the outcome of the action.

3.caption: Observed
3.description: The activity was observed, but neither explicitly allowed nor denied. This is common with IDS and EDR controls that report additional information on observed behavior such as TTPs. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Logged', 'Alert', 'Detected', 'Count', etc.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The action was unknown. The disposition_id attribute may still be set to a non-unknown value, for example 'Custom Action', 'Challenge'.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: The activity was allowed. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Allowed', 'Approved', 'Delayed', 'No Action', 'Count' etc.

2.caption: Denied
2.description: The attempted activity was denied. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Blocked', 'Rejected', 'Quarantined', 'Isolated', 'Dropped', 'Access Revoked, etc.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The action is not mapped. See the action attribute which contains a data source specific value.

4.caption: Modified
4.description: The activity was modified, adjusted, or corrected. The disposition_id attribute should be set appropriately, for example 'Restored', 'Corrected', 'Delayed', 'Captcha', 'Tagged'.

metadata.caption: Metadata
metadata.description: The metadata associated with the event or a finding.

status.caption: Status
status.description: The event status, normalized to the caption of the status_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

time.caption: Event Time
time.description: The normalized event occurrence time or the finding creation time.

class_name.caption: Class
class_name.description: The event class name, as defined by class_uid value: Folder Query.

time_dt.caption: Event Time
time_dt.description: The normalized event occurrence time or the finding creation time.

query_result_id.caption: Query Result ID
query_result_id.description: The normalized identifier of the query result.

3.caption: Does not exist
3.description: The target was not found.

1.caption: Exists
1.description: The target was found.

2.caption: Partial
2.description: The target was partially found.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The query result is not mapped. See the query_result attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

4.caption: Error
4.description: The discovery attempt failed.

5.caption: Unsupported
5.description: Discovery of the target was not supported.

severity_id.caption: Severity ID
severity_id.description:
The normalized identifier of the event/finding severity.

The normalized severity is a measurement the effort and expense required to manage and resolve an event or incident. Smaller numerical values represent lower impact events, and larger numerical values represent higher impact events.

3.caption: Medium
3.description: Action is required but the situation is not serious at this time.

6.caption: Fatal
6.description: An error occurred but it is too late to take remedial action.

1.caption: Informational
1.description: Informational message. No action required.

2.caption: Low
2.description: The user decides if action is needed.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event/finding severity is not mapped. See the severity attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

4.caption: High
4.description: Action is required immediately.

5.caption: Critical
5.description: Action is required immediately and the scope is broad.

start_time.caption: Start Time
start_time.description: The start time of a time period, or the time of the least recent event included in the aggregate event.

confidence_score.caption: Confidence Score
confidence_score.description: The confidence score as reported by the event source.

disposition.caption: Disposition
disposition.description: The disposition name, normalized to the caption of the disposition_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

type_uid.caption: Type ID
type_uid.description: The event/finding type ID. It identifies the event's semantics and structure. The value is calculated by the logging system as: class_uid * 100 + activity_id.

500801.caption: Folder Query: Query
500801.description: The discovered results are via a query request.

end_time.caption: End Time
end_time.description: The end time of a time period, or the time of the most recent event included in the aggregate event.

category_name.caption: Category
category_name.description: The event category name, as defined by category_uid value: Discovery.

count.caption: Count
count.description: The number of times that events in the same logical group occurred during the event Start Time to End Time period.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

start_time_dt.caption: Start Time
start_time_dt.description: The start time of a time period, or the time of the least recent event included in the aggregate event.

raw_data_size.caption: Raw Data Size
raw_data_size.description: The size of the raw data which was transformed into an OCSF event, in bytes.

status_id.caption: Status ID
status_id.description: The normalized identifier of the event status.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event status is not mapped. See the status attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

api.caption: API Details
api.description: Describes details about a typical API (Application Programming Interface) call.

category_uid.caption: Category ID
category_uid.description: The category unique identifier of the event.

5.caption: Discovery
5.description: Discovery events report the existence and state of devices, files, configurations, processes, registry keys, and other objects.

timezone_offset.caption: Timezone Offset
timezone_offset.description: The number of minutes that the reported event time is ahead or behind UTC, in the range -1,080 to +1,080.

activity_id.caption: Activity ID
activity_id.description: The normalized identifier of the activity that triggered the event.

1.caption: Query
1.description: The discovered results are via a query request.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event activity is not mapped. See the activity_name attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

type_name.caption: Type Name
type_name.description: The event/finding type name, as defined by the type_uid.

disposition_id.caption: Disposition ID
disposition_id.description: Describes the outcome or action taken by a security control, such as access control checks, malware detections or various types of policy violations.

3.caption: Quarantined
3.description: A suspicious file or other content was moved to a benign location.

6.caption: Dropped
6.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being dropped.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: Granted access or allowed the action to the protected resource.

2.caption: Blocked
2.description: Denied access or blocked the action to the protected resource.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The disposition is not mapped. See the disposition attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

4.caption: Isolated
4.description: A session was isolated on the network or within a browser.

5.caption: Deleted
5.description: A file or other content was deleted.

7.caption: Custom Action
7.description: A custom action was executed such as running of a command script. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

8.caption: Approved
8.description: A request or submission was approved. For example, when a form was properly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 1 'Allowed'.

9.caption: Restored
9.description: A quarantined file or other content was restored to its original location.

10.caption: Exonerated
10.description: A suspicious or risky entity was deemed to no longer be suspicious (re-scored).

11.caption: Corrected
11.description: A corrupt file or configuration was corrected.

12.caption: Partially Corrected
12.description: A corrupt file or configuration was partially corrected.

14.caption: Delayed
14.description: An operation was delayed, for example if a restart was required to finish the operation.

15.caption: Detected
15.description: Suspicious activity or a policy violation was detected without further action.

16.caption: No Action
16.description: The outcome of an operation had no action taken.

17.caption: Logged
17.description: The operation or action was logged without further action.

18.caption: Tagged
18.description: A file or other entity was marked with extended attributes.

20.caption: Count
20.description: Counted the request or activity but did not determine whether to allow it or block it.

21.caption: Reset
21.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being reset.

22.caption: Captcha
22.description: Required the end user to solve a CAPTCHA puzzle to prove that a human being is sending the request.

23.caption: Challenge
23.description: Ran a silent challenge that required the client session to verify that it's a browser, and not a bot.

24.caption: Access Revoked
24.description: The requestor's access has been revoked due to security policy enforcements. Note: use the Host profile if the User or Actor requestor is not present in the event class.

25.caption: Rejected
25.description: A request or submission was rejected. For example, when a form was improperly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 2 'Blocked'.

26.caption: Unauthorized
26.description: An attempt to access a resource was denied due to an authorization check that failed. This is a more specific disposition than 2 'Blocked' and can be complemented with the authorizations attribute for more detail.

27.caption: Error
27.description: An error occurred during the processing of the activity or request. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

13.caption: Uncorrected
13.description: A corrupt file or configuration was not corrected.

19.caption: Alert
19.description: The request or activity was detected as a threat and resulted in a notification but request was not blocked.

duration.caption: Duration Milliseconds
duration.description: The event duration or aggregate time, the amount of time the event covers from start_time to end_time in milliseconds.

osint.caption: OSINT
osint.description: The OSINT (Open Source Intelligence) object contains details related to an indicator such as the indicator itself, related indicators, geolocation, registrar information, subdomains, analyst commentary, and other contextual information. This information can be used to further enrich a detection or finding by providing decisioning support to other analysts and engineers.

confidence_id.caption: Confidence ID
confidence_id.description: The normalized confidence refers to the accuracy of the rule that created the finding. A rule with a low confidence means that the finding scope is wide and may create finding reports that may not be malicious in nature.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The confidence is not mapped to the defined enum values. See the confidence attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

risk_details.caption: Risk Details
risk_details.description: Describes the risk associated with the finding.

folder_query.description: Folder Query events report information about folders that are present on the system.

peripheral_device_query.caption: Peripheral Device Query
peripheral_device_query.name: peripheral_device_query

peripheral_device.caption: Peripheral Device
peripheral_device.description: The peripheral device that triggered the event.

class_uid.caption: Class ID
class_uid.description: The unique identifier of a class. A class describes the attributes available in an event.

5014.caption: Peripheral Device Query
5014.description: Peripheral Device Query events report information about peripheral devices.

enrichments.caption: Enrichments
enrichments.description:
The additional information from an external data source, which is associated with the event or a finding. For example add location information for the IP address in the DNS answers:

[{"name": "answers.ip", "value": "92.24.47.250", "type": "location", "data": {"city": "Socotra", "continent": "Asia", "coordinates": [-25.4153, 17.0743], "country": "YE", "desc": "Yemen"}}]

risk_score.caption: Risk Score

activity_name.description: The event activity name, as defined by the activity_id.

device.caption: Device
device.description: An addressable device, computer system or host.

observables.caption: Observables
observables.description: The observables associated with the event or a finding.

attacks.caption: MITRE ATT&CK® and ATLAS™ Details

attacks.caption: MITRE ATT&CK® and ATLAS™ Details
attacks.description: An array of MITRE ATT&CK® objects describing identified tactics, techniques & sub-techniques. The objects are compatible with MITRE ATLAS™ tactics, techniques & sub-techniques.

actor.caption: Actor
actor.description: The actor object describes details about the user/role/process that was the source of the activity. Note that this is not the threat actor of a campaign but may be part of a campaign.

message.caption: Message
message.description: The description of the event/finding, as defined by the source.

authorizations.caption: Authorization Information
authorizations.description: Provides details about an authorization, such as authorization outcome, and any associated policies related to the activity/event.

status_code.caption: Status Code
status_code.description:
The event status code, as reported by the event source.

For example, in a Windows Failed Authentication event, this would be the value of 'Failure Code', e.g. 0x18.

proxy_http_response.caption: Proxy HTTP Response
proxy_http_response.description: The HTTP Response from the remote server to the proxy server.

proxy.caption: Proxy
proxy.description: Details about the proxy service, if available.

risk_level.caption: Risk Level
risk_level.description: The risk level, normalized to the caption of the risk_level_id value.

proxy_tls.caption: Proxy TLS
proxy_tls.description: The TLS protocol negotiated between the proxy server and the remote server.

malware.caption: Malware
malware.description: A list of Malware objects, describing details about the identified malware.

malware_scan_info.caption: Malware Scan Info
malware_scan_info.description: Describes details about the scan job that identified malware on the target system.

http_request.caption: HTTP Request
http_request.description: Details about the underlying HTTP request.

status_detail.caption: Status Detail
status_detail.description: The status detail contains additional information about the event/finding outcome.

is_alert.caption: Alert
is_alert.description: Indicates that the event is considered to be an alertable signal. Should be set to true if disposition_id = Alert among other dispositions, and/or risk_level_id or severity_id of the event is elevated. Not all control events will be alertable, for example if disposition_id = Exonerated or disposition_id = Allowed.

cloud.caption: Cloud
cloud.description: Describes details about the Cloud environment where the event was originally created or logged.

tls.caption: TLS
tls.description: The Transport Layer Security (TLS) attributes, if available.

policy.caption: Policy
policy.description: The policy that pertains to the control that triggered the event, if applicable. For example the name of an anti-malware policy or an access control policy.

action_id.caption: Action ID
action_id.description: The action taken by a control or other policy-based system leading to an outcome or disposition. An unknown action may still correspond to a known disposition. Refer to disposition_id for the outcome of the action.

3.caption: Observed
3.description: The activity was observed, but neither explicitly allowed nor denied. This is common with IDS and EDR controls that report additional information on observed behavior such as TTPs. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Logged', 'Alert', 'Detected', 'Count', etc.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The action was unknown. The disposition_id attribute may still be set to a non-unknown value, for example 'Custom Action', 'Challenge'.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: The activity was allowed. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Allowed', 'Approved', 'Delayed', 'No Action', 'Count' etc.

2.caption: Denied
2.description: The attempted activity was denied. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Blocked', 'Rejected', 'Quarantined', 'Isolated', 'Dropped', 'Access Revoked, etc.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The action is not mapped. See the action attribute which contains a data source specific value.

4.caption: Modified
4.description: The activity was modified, adjusted, or corrected. The disposition_id attribute should be set appropriately, for example 'Restored', 'Corrected', 'Delayed', 'Captcha', 'Tagged'.

metadata.caption: Metadata
metadata.description: The metadata associated with the event or a finding.

status.caption: Status
status.description: The event status, normalized to the caption of the status_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

time.caption: Event Time
time.description: The normalized event occurrence time or the finding creation time.

class_name.caption: Class
class_name.description: The event class name, as defined by class_uid value: Web Resource Access Activity.

time_dt.caption: Event Time
time_dt.description: The normalized event occurrence time or the finding creation time.

severity_id.caption: Severity ID
severity_id.description:
The normalized identifier of the event/finding severity.

The normalized severity is a measurement the effort and expense required to manage and resolve an event or incident. Smaller numerical values represent lower impact events, and larger numerical values represent higher impact events.

3.caption: Medium
3.description: Action is required but the situation is not serious at this time.

6.caption: Fatal
6.description: An error occurred but it is too late to take remedial action.

1.caption: Informational
1.description: Informational message. No action required.

2.caption: Low
2.description: The user decides if action is needed.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event/finding severity is not mapped. See the severity attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

4.caption: High
4.description: Action is required immediately.

5.caption: Critical
5.description: Action is required immediately and the scope is broad.

start_time.caption: Start Time
start_time.description: The start time of a time period, or the time of the least recent event included in the aggregate event.

confidence_score.caption: Confidence Score
confidence_score.description: The confidence score as reported by the event source.

disposition.caption: Disposition
disposition.description: The disposition name, normalized to the caption of the disposition_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

type_uid.caption: Type ID
type_uid.description: The event/finding type ID. It identifies the event's semantics and structure. The value is calculated by the logging system as: class_uid * 100 + activity_id.

600403.caption: Web Resource Access Activity: Access Revoke
600403.description: The incoming request's access has been revoked due to security policy enforcements.

600401.caption: Web Resource Access Activity: Access Grant
600401.description: The incoming request has permission to the web resource.

600402.caption: Web Resource Access Activity: Access Deny
600402.description: The incoming request does not have permission to the web resource.

600404.caption: Web Resource Access Activity: Access Error
600404.description: An error occurred during processing the request.

end_time.caption: End Time
end_time.description: The end time of a time period, or the time of the most recent event included in the aggregate event.

category_name.caption: Category
category_name.description: The event category name, as defined by category_uid value: Application Activity.

count.caption: Count
count.description: The number of times that events in the same logical group occurred during the event Start Time to End Time period.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

start_time_dt.caption: Start Time
start_time_dt.description: The start time of a time period, or the time of the least recent event included in the aggregate event.

raw_data_size.caption: Raw Data Size
raw_data_size.description: The size of the raw data which was transformed into an OCSF event, in bytes.

status_id.caption: Status ID
status_id.description: The normalized identifier of the event status.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event status is not mapped. See the status attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

api.caption: API Details
api.description: Describes details about a typical API (Application Programming Interface) call.

category_uid.caption: Category ID
category_uid.description: The category unique identifier of the event.

6.caption: Application Activity
6.description: Application Activity events report detailed information about the behavior of applications and services.

proxy_endpoint.caption: Proxy Endpoint
proxy_endpoint.description: The proxy (server) in a network connection.

timezone_offset.caption: Timezone Offset
timezone_offset.description: The number of minutes that the reported event time is ahead or behind UTC, in the range -1,080 to +1,080.

activity_id.caption: Activity ID
activity_id.description: The normalized identifier of the activity that triggered the event.

3.caption: Access Revoke
3.description: The incoming request's access has been revoked due to security policy enforcements.

1.caption: Access Grant
1.description: The incoming request has permission to the web resource.

2.caption: Access Deny
2.description: The incoming request does not have permission to the web resource.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event activity is not mapped. See the activity_name attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

4.caption: Access Error
4.description: An error occurred during processing the request.

type_name.caption: Type Name
type_name.description: The event/finding type name, as defined by the type_uid.

disposition_id.caption: Disposition ID
disposition_id.description: Describes the outcome or action taken by a security control, such as access control checks, malware detections or various types of policy violations.

3.caption: Quarantined
3.description: A suspicious file or other content was moved to a benign location.

6.caption: Dropped
6.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being dropped.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: Granted access or allowed the action to the protected resource.

2.caption: Blocked
2.description: Denied access or blocked the action to the protected resource.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The disposition is not mapped. See the disposition attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

4.caption: Isolated
4.description: A session was isolated on the network or within a browser.

5.caption: Deleted
5.description: A file or other content was deleted.

7.caption: Custom Action
7.description: A custom action was executed such as running of a command script. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

8.caption: Approved
8.description: A request or submission was approved. For example, when a form was properly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 1 'Allowed'.

9.caption: Restored
9.description: A quarantined file or other content was restored to its original location.

10.caption: Exonerated
10.description: A suspicious or risky entity was deemed to no longer be suspicious (re-scored).

11.caption: Corrected
11.description: A corrupt file or configuration was corrected.

12.caption: Partially Corrected
12.description: A corrupt file or configuration was partially corrected.

14.caption: Delayed
14.description: An operation was delayed, for example if a restart was required to finish the operation.

15.caption: Detected
15.description: Suspicious activity or a policy violation was detected without further action.

16.caption: No Action
16.description: The outcome of an operation had no action taken.

17.caption: Logged
17.description: The operation or action was logged without further action.

18.caption: Tagged
18.description: A file or other entity was marked with extended attributes.

20.caption: Count
20.description: Counted the request or activity but did not determine whether to allow it or block it.

21.caption: Reset
21.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being reset.

22.caption: Captcha
22.description: Required the end user to solve a CAPTCHA puzzle to prove that a human being is sending the request.

23.caption: Challenge
23.description: Ran a silent challenge that required the client session to verify that it's a browser, and not a bot.

24.caption: Access Revoked
24.description: The requestor's access has been revoked due to security policy enforcements. Note: use the Host profile if the User or Actor requestor is not present in the event class.

25.caption: Rejected
25.description: A request or submission was rejected. For example, when a form was improperly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 2 'Blocked'.

26.caption: Unauthorized
26.description: An attempt to access a resource was denied due to an authorization check that failed. This is a more specific disposition than 2 'Blocked' and can be complemented with the authorizations attribute for more detail.

27.caption: Error
27.description: An error occurred during the processing of the activity or request. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

13.caption: Uncorrected
13.description: A corrupt file or configuration was not corrected.

19.caption: Alert
19.description: The request or activity was detected as a threat and resulted in a notification but request was not blocked.

duration.caption: Duration Milliseconds
duration.description: The event duration or aggregate time, the amount of time the event covers from start_time to end_time in milliseconds.

osint.caption: OSINT
osint.description: The OSINT (Open Source Intelligence) object contains details related to an indicator such as the indicator itself, related indicators, geolocation, registrar information, subdomains, analyst commentary, and other contextual information. This information can be used to further enrich a detection or finding by providing decisioning support to other analysts and engineers.

confidence_id.caption: Confidence ID
confidence_id.description: The normalized confidence refers to the accuracy of the rule that created the finding. A rule with a low confidence means that the finding scope is wide and may create finding reports that may not be malicious in nature.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The confidence is not mapped to the defined enum values. See the confidence attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

proxy_connection_info.caption: Proxy Connection Info
proxy_connection_info.description: The connection information from the proxy server to the remote server.

proxy_http_request.caption: Proxy HTTP Request
proxy_http_request.description: The HTTP Request from the proxy server to the remote server.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

proxy_traffic.caption: Proxy Traffic
proxy_traffic.description: The network traffic refers to the amount of data moving across a network, from proxy to remote server at a given point of time.

src_endpoint.caption: Source Endpoint
src_endpoint.description: Details about the source endpoint of the request.

risk_details.caption: Risk Details
risk_details.description: Describes the risk associated with the finding.

web_resource_access_activity.description: Web Resource Access Activity events describe successful/failed attempts to access a web resource over HTTP.

@deprecated.message: Use the Web Resources Activity class with the Security Control and/or Network Proxy profile instead.

email_file_activity.caption: Email File Activity
email_file_activity.name: email_file_activity

class_uid.caption: Class ID
class_uid.description: The unique identifier of a class. A class describes the attributes available in an event.

4011.caption: Email File Activity
4011.description: Email File Activity events report files within emails.

enrichments.caption: Enrichments
enrichments.description:
The additional information from an external data source, which is associated with the event or a finding. For example add location information for the IP address in the DNS answers:

[{"name": "answers.ip", "value": "92.24.47.250", "type": "location", "data": {"city": "Socotra", "continent": "Asia", "coordinates": [-25.4153, 17.0743], "country": "YE", "desc": "Yemen"}}]

firewall_rule.caption: Firewall Rule
firewall_rule.description: The firewall rule that pertains to the control that triggered the event, if applicable.

confidence.description: The confidence, normalized to the caption of the confidence_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

end_time_dt.caption: End Time
end_time_dt.description: The end time of a time period, or the time of the most recent event included in the aggregate event.

severity.caption: Severity
severity.description: The event/finding severity, normalized to the caption of the severity_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source.

risk_score.caption: Risk Score
risk_score.description: The risk score as reported by the event source.

activity_name.caption: Activity
activity_name.description: The event activity name, as defined by the activity_id.

device.caption: Device
device.description: An addressable device, computer system or host.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The risk level is not mapped. See the risk_level attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

observables.caption: Observables
observables.description: The observables associated with the event or a finding.

end_time_dt.description: The end time of a time period, or the time of the most recent event included in the aggregate event.

severity.caption: Severity
severity.description: The event/finding severity, normalized to the caption of the severity_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source.

risk_score.caption: Risk Score
risk_score.description: The risk score as reported by the event source.

activity_name.caption: Activity
activity_name.description: The event activity name, as defined by the activity_id.

device.caption: Device
device.description: An addressable device, computer system or host.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The risk level is not mapped. See the risk_level attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

observables.caption: Observables
observables.description: The observables associated with the event or a finding.

process.caption: Process
process.description: The process that had memory allocated, read/written, or had other manipulation activities performed on it.

attacks.caption: MITRE ATT&CK® and ATLAS™ Details
attacks.description: An array of MITRE ATT&CK® objects describing identified tactics, techniques & sub-techniques. The objects are compatible with MITRE ATLAS™ tactics, techniques & sub-techniques.

actor.caption: Actor
actor.description: The actor object describes details about the user/role/process that was the source of the activity. Note that this is not the threat actor of a campaign but may be part of a campaign.

message.caption: Message
message.description: The description of the event/finding, as defined by the source.

size.caption: Size
size.description: The memory size that was access or requested.

authorizations.caption: Authorization Information
authorizations.description: Provides details about an authorization, such as authorization outcome, and any associated policies related to the activity/event.

status_code.caption: Status Code
status_code.description:
The event status code, as reported by the event source.

For example, in a Windows Failed Authentication event, this would be the value of 'Failure Code', e.g. 0x18.

risk_level.caption: Risk Level
risk_level.description: The risk level, normalized to the caption of the risk_level_id value.

malware.caption: Malware
malware.description: A list of Malware objects, describing details about the identified malware.

malware_scan_info.caption: Malware Scan Info
malware_scan_info.description: Describes details about the scan job that identified malware on the target system.

status_detail.caption: Status Detail
status_detail.description: The status detail contains additional information about the event/finding outcome.

is_alert.caption: Alert
is_alert.description: Indicates that the event is considered to be an alertable signal. Should be set to true if disposition_id = Alert among other dispositions, and/or risk_level_id or severity_id of the event is elevated. Not all control events will be alertable, for example if disposition_id = Exonerated or disposition_id = Allowed.

cloud.caption: Cloud
cloud.description: Describes details about the Cloud environment where the event was originally created or logged.

policy.caption: Policy
policy.description: The policy that pertains to the control that triggered the event, if applicable. For example the name of an anti-malware policy or an access control policy.

action_id.caption: Action ID
action_id.description: The action taken by a control or other policy-based system leading to an outcome or disposition. An unknown action may still correspond to a known disposition. Refer to disposition_id for the outcome of the action.

3.caption: Observed
3.description: The activity was observed, but neither explicitly allowed nor denied. This is common with IDS and EDR controls that report additional information on observed behavior such as TTPs. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Logged', 'Alert', 'Detected', 'Count', etc.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The action was unknown. The disposition_id attribute may still be set to a non-unknown value, for example 'Custom Action', 'Challenge'.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: The activity was allowed. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Allowed', 'Approved', 'Delayed', 'No Action', 'Count' etc.

2.caption: Denied
2.description: The attempted activity was denied. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Blocked', 'Rejected', 'Quarantined', 'Isolated', 'Dropped', 'Access Revoked, etc.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The action is not mapped. See the action attribute which contains a data source specific value.

4.caption: Modified
4.description: The activity was modified, adjusted, or corrected. The disposition_id attribute should be set appropriately, for example 'Restored', 'Corrected', 'Delayed', 'Captcha', 'Tagged'.

metadata.caption: Metadata
metadata.description: The metadata associated with the event or a finding.

status.caption: Status
status.description: The event status, normalized to the caption of the status_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

time.caption: Event Time
time.description: The normalized event occurrence time or the finding creation time.

actual_permissions.caption: Actual Permissions
actual_permissions.description: The permissions that were granted to access memory.

class_name.caption: Class
class_name.description: The event class name, as defined by class_uid value: Memory Activity.

time_dt.caption: Event Time
time_dt.description: The normalized event occurrence time or the finding creation time.

severity_id.caption: Severity ID
severity_id.description:
The normalized identifier of the event/finding severity.

The normalized severity is a measurement the effort and expense required to manage and resolve an event or incident. Smaller numerical values represent lower impact events, and larger numerical values represent higher impact events.

3.caption: Medium
3.description: Action is required but the situation is not serious at this time.

6.caption: Fatal
6.description: An error occurred but it is too late to take remedial action.

1.caption: Informational
1.description: Informational message. No action required.

2.caption: Low
2.description: The user decides if action is needed.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event/finding severity is not mapped. See the severity attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

4.caption: High
4.description: Action is required immediately.

5.caption: Critical
5.description: Action is required immediately and the scope is broad.

start_time.caption: Start Time
start_time.description: The start time of a time period, or the time of the least recent event included in the aggregate event.

confidence_score.caption: Confidence Score
confidence_score.description: The confidence score as reported by the event source.

disposition.caption: Disposition
disposition.description: The disposition name, normalized to the caption of the disposition_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

type_uid.description: The event/finding type ID. It identifies the event's semantics and structure. The value is calculated by the logging system as: class_uid * 100 + activity_id.

end_time.caption: End Time
end_time.description: The end time of a time period, or the time of the most recent event included in the aggregate event.

category_name.caption: Category
category_name.description: The event category name, as defined by category_uid value: System Activity.

count.caption: Count
count.description: The number of times that events in the same logical group occurred during the event Start Time to End Time period.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

start_time_dt.caption: Start Time
start_time_dt.description: The start time of a time period, or the time of the least recent event included in the aggregate event.

base_address.caption: Base Address
base_address.description: The memory address that was access or requested.

raw_data_size.caption: Raw Data Size
raw_data_size.description: The size of the raw data which was transformed into an OCSF event, in bytes.

status_id.caption: Status ID
status_id.description: The normalized identifier of the event status.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event status is not mapped. See the status attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

api.caption: API Details
api.description: Describes details about a typical API (Application Programming Interface) call.

category_uid.caption: Category ID
category_uid.description: The category unique identifier of the event.

1.caption: System Activity
1.description: System Activity events.

timezone_offset.caption: Timezone Offset
timezone_offset.description: The number of minutes that the reported event time is ahead or behind UTC, in the range -1,080 to +1,080.

activity_id.caption: Activity ID
activity_id.description: The normalized identifier of the activity that triggered the event.

6.caption: Enable DEP
6.description: Data Execution Permission

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event activity is not mapped. See the activity_name attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

5.caption: Disable DEP
5.description: Data Execution Permission

7.caption: Read
7.description: Read (Example: ReadProcessMemory)

8.caption: Write
8.description: Write (Example: WriteProcessMemory)

9.caption: Map View
9.description: Map View (Example: MapViewOfFile2)

type_name.caption: Type Name
type_name.description: The event/finding type name, as defined by the type_uid.

requested_permissions.caption: Requested Permissions
requested_permissions.description: The permissions mask that was requested to access memory.

disposition_id.caption: Disposition ID
disposition_id.description: Describes the outcome or action taken by a security control, such as access control checks, malware detections or various types of policy violations.

3.caption: Quarantined
3.description: A suspicious file or other content was moved to a benign location.

6.caption: Dropped
6.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being dropped.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: Granted access or allowed the action to the protected resource.

2.caption: Blocked
2.description: Denied access or blocked the action to the protected resource.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The disposition is not mapped. See the disposition attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

4.caption: Isolated
4.description: A session was isolated on the network or within a browser.

5.caption: Deleted
5.description: A file or other content was deleted.

7.caption: Custom Action
7.description: A custom action was executed such as running of a command script. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

8.caption: Approved
8.description: A request or submission was approved. For example, when a form was properly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 1 'Allowed'.

9.caption: Restored
9.description: A quarantined file or other content was restored to its original location.

10.caption: Exonerated
10.description: A suspicious or risky entity was deemed to no longer be suspicious (re-scored).

11.caption: Corrected
11.description: A corrupt file or configuration was corrected.

12.caption: Partially Corrected
12.description: A corrupt file or configuration was partially corrected.

14.caption: Delayed
14.description: An operation was delayed, for example if a restart was required to finish the operation.

15.caption: Detected
15.description: Suspicious activity or a policy violation was detected without further action.

16.caption: No Action
16.description: The outcome of an operation had no action taken.

17.caption: Logged
17.description: The operation or action was logged without further action.

18.caption: Tagged
18.description: A file or other entity was marked with extended attributes.

20.caption: Count
20.description: Counted the request or activity but did not determine whether to allow it or block it.

21.caption: Reset
21.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being reset.

22.caption: Captcha
22.description: Required the end user to solve a CAPTCHA puzzle to prove that a human being is sending the request.

23.caption: Challenge
23.description: Ran a silent challenge that required the client session to verify that it's a browser, and not a bot.

24.caption: Access Revoked
24.description: The requestor's access has been revoked due to security policy enforcements. Note: use the Host profile if the User or Actor requestor is not present in the event class.

25.caption: Rejected
25.description: A request or submission was rejected. For example, when a form was improperly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 2 'Blocked'.

26.caption: Unauthorized
26.description: An attempt to access a resource was denied due to an authorization check that failed. This is a more specific disposition than 2 'Blocked' and can be complemented with the authorizations attribute for more detail.

27.caption: Error
27.description: An error occurred during the processing of the activity or request. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

13.caption: Uncorrected
13.description: A corrupt file or configuration was not corrected.

19.caption: Alert
19.description: The request or activity was detected as a threat and resulted in a notification but request was not blocked.

duration.caption: Duration Milliseconds
duration.description: The event duration or aggregate time, the amount of time the event covers from start_time to end_time in milliseconds.

osint.caption: OSINT
osint.description: The OSINT (Open Source Intelligence) object contains details related to an indicator such as the indicator itself, related indicators, geolocation, registrar information, subdomains, analyst commentary, and other contextual information. This information can be used to further enrich a detection or finding by providing decisioning support to other analysts and engineers.

confidence_id.caption: Confidence ID
confidence_id.description: The normalized confidence refers to the accuracy of the rule that created the finding. A rule with a low confidence means that the finding scope is wide and may create finding reports that may not be malicious in nature.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The confidence is not mapped to the defined enum values. See the confidence attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

risk_details.caption: Risk Details

memory_activity.description: Memory Activity events report when a process has memory allocated, read/modified, or other manipulation activities - such as a buffer overflow or turning off data execution protection (DEP).

airborne_broadcast_activity.name: airborne_broadcast_activity

class_uid.caption: Class ID

8002.caption: Airborne Broadcast Activity
8002.description: Airborne Broadcast Activity events report the activity of any aircraft or unmanned system as reported and tracked by Automatic Dependent Surveillance - Broadcast (ADS-B) receivers. Based on the ADS-B standards described in Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) Title 14 Chapter I Subchapter F Part 91 and in other general Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) supplemental orders and guidance described here.

enrichments.description:
The additional information from an external data source, which is associated with the event or a finding. For example add location information for the IP address in the DNS answers:

[{"name": "answers.ip", "value": "92.24.47.250", "type": "location", "data": {"city": "Socotra", "continent": "Asia", "coordinates": [-25.4153, 17.0743], "country": "YE", "desc": "Yemen"}}]

confidence_id.description: The normalized confidence refers to the accuracy of the rule that created the finding. A rule with a low confidence means that the finding scope is wide and may create finding reports that may not be malicious in nature.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The confidence is not mapped to the defined enum values. See the confidence attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

rssi.caption: RSSI
rssi.description: Recent average RSSI (signal power) measured in dbFS. This value will always be negative, e.g., -87.13.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

src_endpoint.caption: Source Endpoint
src_endpoint.description: The source network endpoint for the ADS-B system.

risk_details.caption: Risk Details
risk_details.description: Describes the risk associated with the finding.

airborne_broadcast_activity.description: Airborne Broadcast Activity events report the activity of any aircraft or unmanned system as reported and tracked by Automatic Dependent Surveillance - Broadcast (ADS-B) receivers. Based on the ADS-B standards described in Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) Title 14 Chapter I Subchapter F Part 91 and in other general Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) supplemental orders and guidance described here.

email_activity.caption: Email Activity
email_activity.name: email_activity

class_uid.caption: Class ID
class_uid.description: The unique identifier of a class. A class describes the attributes available in an event.

4009.caption: Email Activity
4009.description: Email Activity events report SMTP protocol and email activities including those with embedded URLs and files. See the Email object for details.

enrichments.caption: Enrichments
enrichments.description:
The additional information from an external data source, which is associated with the event or a finding. For example add location information for the IP address in the DNS answers:

[{"name": "answers.ip", "value": "92.24.47.250", "type": "location", "data": {"city": "Socotra", "continent": "Asia", "coordinates": [-25.4153, 17.0743], "country": "YE", "desc": "Yemen"}}]

firewall_rule.caption: Firewall Rule
firewall_rule.description: The firewall rule that pertains to the control that triggered the event, if applicable.

confidence.caption: Confidence
confidence.description: The confidence, normalized to the caption of the confidence_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

end_time_dt.caption: End Time
end_time_dt.description: The end time of a time period, or the time of the most recent event included in the aggregate event.

severity.caption: Severity
severity.description: The event/finding severity, normalized to the caption of the severity_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source.

risk_score.caption: Risk Score
risk_score.description: The risk score as reported by the event source.

activity_name.caption: Activity
activity_name.description: The event activity name, as defined by the activity_id.

device.caption: Device
device.description: An addressable device, computer system or host.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The risk level is not mapped. See the risk_level attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

observables.caption: Observables
observables.description: The observables associated with the event or a finding.

attacks.caption: MITRE ATT&CK® and ATLAS™ Details
attacks.description: An array of MITRE ATT&CK® objects describing identified tactics, techniques & sub-techniques. The objects are compatible with MITRE ATLAS™ tactics, techniques & sub-techniques.

actor.caption: Actor
actor.description: The actor object describes details about the user/role/process that was the source of the activity. Note that this is not the threat actor of a campaign but may be part of a campaign.

message.caption: Message
message.description: The description of the event/finding, as defined by the source.

authorizations.caption: Authorization Information
authorizations.description: Provides details about an authorization, such as authorization outcome, and any associated policies related to the activity/event.

status_code.caption: Status Code
status_code.description:
The event status code, as reported by the event source.

For example, in a Windows Failed Authentication event, this would be the value of 'Failure Code', e.g. 0x18.

attempt.caption: Attempt
attempt.description: The attempt number for attempting to deliver the email.

risk_level.caption: Risk Level
risk_level.description: The risk level, normalized to the caption of the risk_level_id value.

malware.caption: Malware
malware.description: A list of Malware objects, describing details about the identified malware.

smtp_hello.caption: SMTP Hello
smtp_hello.description: The value of the SMTP HELO or EHLO command sent by the initiator (client).

malware_scan_info.caption: Malware Scan Info
malware_scan_info.description: Describes details about the scan job that identified malware on the target system.

status_detail.caption: Status Detail
status_detail.description: The status detail contains additional information about the event/finding outcome.

is_alert.caption: Alert
is_alert.description: Indicates that the event is considered to be an alertable signal. Should be set to true if disposition_id = Alert among other dispositions, and/or risk_level_id or severity_id of the event is elevated. Not all control events will be alertable, for example if disposition_id = Exonerated or disposition_id = Allowed.

cloud.caption: Cloud
cloud.description: Describes details about the Cloud environment where the event was originally created or logged.

policy.caption: Policy
policy.description: The policy that pertains to the control that triggered the event, if applicable. For example the name of an anti-malware policy or an access control policy.

action_id.caption: Action ID
action_id.description: The action taken by a control or other policy-based system leading to an outcome or disposition. An unknown action may still correspond to a known disposition. Refer to disposition_id for the outcome of the action.

3.caption: Observed
3.description: The activity was observed, but neither explicitly allowed nor denied. This is common with IDS and EDR controls that report additional information on observed behavior such as TTPs. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Logged', 'Alert', 'Detected', 'Count', etc.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The action was unknown. The disposition_id attribute may still be set to a non-unknown value, for example 'Custom Action', 'Challenge'.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: The activity was allowed. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Allowed', 'Approved', 'Delayed', 'No Action', 'Count' etc.

2.caption: Denied
2.description: The attempted activity was denied. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Blocked', 'Rejected', 'Quarantined', 'Isolated', 'Dropped', 'Access Revoked, etc.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The action is not mapped. See the action attribute which contains a data source specific value.

4.caption: Modified
4.description: The activity was modified, adjusted, or corrected. The disposition_id attribute should be set appropriately, for example 'Restored', 'Corrected', 'Delayed', 'Captcha', 'Tagged'.

metadata.caption: Metadata
metadata.description: The metadata associated with the event or a finding.

status.caption: Status
status.description: The event status, normalized to the caption of the status_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

time.caption: Event Time
time.description: The normalized event occurrence time or the finding creation time.

class_name.caption: Class
class_name.description: The event class name, as defined by class_uid value: Email Activity.

banner.caption: Protocol Banner
banner.description: The initial connection response that a messaging server receives after it connects to an email server.

time_dt.caption: Event Time
time_dt.description: The normalized event occurrence time or the finding creation time.

direction.caption: Direction
direction.description: The direction of the email, as defined by the direction_id value.

command.caption: Command
command.description: The command issued by the initiator (client), such as SMTP HELO or EHLO.

severity_id.caption: Severity ID
severity_id.description:
The normalized identifier of the event/finding severity.

The normalized severity is a measurement the effort and expense required to manage and resolve an event or incident. Smaller numerical values represent lower impact events, and larger numerical values represent higher impact events.

3.caption: Medium
3.description: Action is required but the situation is not serious at this time.

6.caption: Fatal
6.description: An error occurred but it is too late to take remedial action.

1.caption: Informational
1.description: Informational message. No action required.

2.caption: Low
2.description: The user decides if action is needed.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event/finding severity is not mapped. See the severity attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

4.caption: High
4.description: Action is required immediately.

5.caption: Critical
5.description: Action is required immediately and the scope is broad.

start_time.caption: Start Time
start_time.description: The start time of a time period, or the time of the least recent event included in the aggregate event.

confidence_score.caption: Confidence Score
confidence_score.description: The confidence score as reported by the event source.

disposition.caption: Disposition
disposition.description: The disposition name, normalized to the caption of the disposition_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

type_uid.caption: Type ID
type_uid.description: The event/finding type ID. It identifies the event's semantics and structure. The value is calculated by the logging system as: class_uid * 100 + activity_id.

400904.caption: Email Activity: Trace
400904.description: Follow an email message as it travels through an organization. The message_trace_uid should be populated when selected.

end_time.caption: End Time
end_time.description: The end time of a time period, or the time of the most recent event included in the aggregate event.

category_name.caption: Category
category_name.description: The event category name, as defined by category_uid value: Network Activity.

count.caption: Count
count.description: The number of times that events in the same logical group occurred during the event Start Time to End Time period.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

start_time_dt.caption: Start Time
start_time_dt.description: The start time of a time period, or the time of the least recent event included in the aggregate event.

raw_data_size.caption: Raw Data Size
raw_data_size.description: The size of the raw data which was transformed into an OCSF event, in bytes.

direction_id.caption: Direction ID
direction_id.description:
The direction of the email relative to the scanning host or organization.

Email scanned at an internet gateway might be characterized as inbound to the organization from the Internet, outbound from the organization to the Internet, or internal within the organization. Email scanned at a workstation might be characterized as inbound to, or outbound from the workstation.

3.caption: Internal
3.description: Email Internal, from inside the network destined for an entity inside network.

1.caption: Inbound
1.description: Email Inbound, from the Internet or outside network destined for an entity inside network.

2.caption: Outbound
2.description: Email Outbound, from inside the network destined for an entity outside network.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The direction is not mapped. See the direction attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

protocol_name.caption: Protocol Name
protocol_name.description: The Protocol Name specifies the email communication protocol, such as SMTP, IMAP, or POP3.

status_id.caption: Status ID
status_id.description: The normalized identifier of the event status.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event status is not mapped. See the status attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

api.caption: API Details
api.description: Describes details about a typical API (Application Programming Interface) call.

message_trace_uid.caption: Message Trace UID
message_trace_uid.description: The identifier that tracks a message that travels through multiple points of a messaging service.

category_uid.caption: Category ID
category_uid.description: The category unique identifier of the event.

4.caption: Network Activity
4.description: Network Activity events.

email_auth.caption: Email Authentication
email_auth.description: The SPF, DKIM and DMARC attributes of an email.

timezone_offset.caption: Timezone Offset
timezone_offset.description: The number of minutes that the reported event time is ahead or behind UTC, in the range -1,080 to +1,080.

activity_id.caption: Activity ID
activity_id.description: The normalized identifier of the activity that triggered the event.

3.caption: Scan
3.description: Email being scanned (example: security scanning)

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event activity is not mapped. See the activity_name attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

4.caption: Trace
4.description: Follow an email message as it travels through an organization. The message_trace_uid should be populated when selected.

type_name.caption: Type Name
type_name.description: The event/finding type name, as defined by the type_uid.

dst_endpoint.caption: Destination Endpoint
dst_endpoint.description: The responder (server) receiving the email.

disposition_id.caption: Disposition ID
disposition_id.description: Describes the outcome or action taken by a security control, such as access control checks, malware detections or various types of policy violations.

3.caption: Quarantined
3.description: A suspicious file or other content was moved to a benign location.

6.caption: Dropped
6.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being dropped.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: Granted access or allowed the action to the protected resource.

2.caption: Blocked
2.description: Denied access or blocked the action to the protected resource.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The disposition is not mapped. See the disposition attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

4.caption: Isolated
4.description: A session was isolated on the network or within a browser.

5.caption: Deleted
5.description: A file or other content was deleted.

7.caption: Custom Action
7.description: A custom action was executed such as running of a command script. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

8.caption: Approved
8.description: A request or submission was approved. For example, when a form was properly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 1 'Allowed'.

9.caption: Restored
9.description: A quarantined file or other content was restored to its original location.

10.caption: Exonerated
10.description: A suspicious or risky entity was deemed to no longer be suspicious (re-scored).

11.caption: Corrected
11.description: A corrupt file or configuration was corrected.

12.caption: Partially Corrected
12.description: A corrupt file or configuration was partially corrected.

14.caption: Delayed
14.description: An operation was delayed, for example if a restart was required to finish the operation.

15.caption: Detected
15.description: Suspicious activity or a policy violation was detected without further action.

16.caption: No Action
16.description: The outcome of an operation had no action taken.

17.caption: Logged
17.description: The operation or action was logged without further action.

18.caption: Tagged
18.description: A file or other entity was marked with extended attributes.

20.caption: Count
20.description: Counted the request or activity but did not determine whether to allow it or block it.

21.caption: Reset
21.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being reset.

22.caption: Captcha
22.description: Required the end user to solve a CAPTCHA puzzle to prove that a human being is sending the request.

23.caption: Challenge
23.description: Ran a silent challenge that required the client session to verify that it's a browser, and not a bot.

24.caption: Access Revoked
24.description: The requestor's access has been revoked due to security policy enforcements. Note: use the Host profile if the User or Actor requestor is not present in the event class.

25.caption: Rejected
25.description: A request or submission was rejected. For example, when a form was improperly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 2 'Blocked'.

26.caption: Unauthorized
26.description: An attempt to access a resource was denied due to an authorization check that failed. This is a more specific disposition than 2 'Blocked' and can be complemented with the authorizations attribute for more detail.

27.caption: Error
27.description: An error occurred during the processing of the activity or request. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

13.caption: Uncorrected
13.description: A corrupt file or configuration was not corrected.

19.caption: Alert
19.description: The request or activity was detected as a threat and resulted in a notification but request was not blocked.

duration.caption: Duration Milliseconds
duration.description: The event duration or aggregate time, the amount of time the event covers from start_time to end_time in milliseconds.

osint.caption: OSINT
osint.description: The OSINT (Open Source Intelligence) object contains details related to an indicator such as the indicator itself, related indicators, geolocation, registrar information, subdomains, analyst commentary, and other contextual information. This information can be used to further enrich a detection or finding by providing decisioning support to other analysts and engineers.

6008.description: Application Error events describe issues with an applications. The error message should be put in the event's message attribute. The metadata.product attribute can be used to capture the originating application information. The host profile can used to include the generating device information. This class is helpful (and originally intended for) applications that generate and/or handle OCSF events. This class can also be used for errors in upstream products and services.

17.description: The operation or action was logged without further action.

18.caption: Tagged
18.description: A file or other entity was marked with extended attributes.

20.caption: Count
20.description: Counted the request or activity but did not determine whether to allow it or block it.

21.caption: Reset
21.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being reset.

22.caption: Captcha
22.description: Required the end user to solve a CAPTCHA puzzle to prove that a human being is sending the request.

23.caption: Challenge
23.description: Ran a silent challenge that required the client session to verify that it's a browser, and not a bot.

24.caption: Access Revoked
24.description: The requestor's access has been revoked due to security policy enforcements. Note: use the Host profile if the User or Actor requestor is not present in the event class.

25.caption: Rejected
25.description: A request or submission was rejected. For example, when a form was improperly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 2 'Blocked'.

26.caption: Unauthorized
26.description: An attempt to access a resource was denied due to an authorization check that failed. This is a more specific disposition than 2 'Blocked' and can be complemented with the authorizations attribute for more detail.

27.caption: Error
27.description: An error occurred during the processing of the activity or request. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

13.caption: Uncorrected
13.description: A corrupt file or configuration was not corrected.

19.caption: Alert
19.description: The request or activity was detected as a threat and resulted in a notification but request was not blocked.

duration.caption: Duration Milliseconds
duration.description: The event duration or aggregate time, the amount of time the event covers from start_time to end_time in milliseconds.

osint.caption: OSINT
osint.description: The OSINT (Open Source Intelligence) object contains details related to an indicator such as the indicator itself, related indicators, geolocation, registrar information, subdomains, analyst commentary, and other contextual information. This information can be used to further enrich a detection or finding by providing decisioning support to other analysts and engineers.

confidence_id.caption: Confidence ID
confidence_id.description: The normalized confidence refers to the accuracy of the rule that created the finding. A rule with a low confidence means that the finding scope is wide and may create finding reports that may not be malicious in nature.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The confidence is not mapped to the defined enum values. See the confidence attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

risk_details.caption: Risk Details
risk_details.description: Describes the risk associated with the finding.

application_error.description: Application Error events describe issues with an applications. The error message should be put in the event's message attribute. The metadata.product attribute can be used to capture the originating application information. The host profile can used to include the generating device information. This class is helpful (and originally intended for) applications that generate and/or handle OCSF events. This class can also be used for errors in upstream products and services.

analytic.caption: Analytic
analytic.name: analytic
analytic.description: The Analytic object contains details about the analytic technique used to analyze and derive insights from the data or information that led to the creation of a finding or conclusion.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the analytic that generated the finding.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The analytic type.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The analytic version. For example: 1.1.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the analytic that generated the finding.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the analytic that generated the finding.

algorithm.caption: Algorithm
algorithm.description: The algorithm used by the underlying analytic to generate the finding.

3.caption: Statistical
3.description: Statistical analytics pertains to analyzing data patterns and anomalies using statistical models to predict, detect, and respond to potential threats, enhancing overall security posture through informed decision-making.

6.caption: Tagging
6.description: Tagging refers to the practice of assigning labels or identifiers to data, users, assets, or activities to monitor, control access, and facilitate incident response across various security domains such as DLP and EDR.

1.caption: Rule
1.description: A Rule in security analytics refers to predefined criteria or conditions set to monitor, alert, or enforce policies, playing a crucial role in access control, threat detection, and regulatory compliance across security systems.

2.caption: Behavioral
2.description: Behavioral analytics focus on monitoring and analyzing user or system actions to identify deviations from established patterns, aiding in the detection of insider threats, fraud, and advanced persistent threats (APTs).

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

4.caption: Learning (ML/DL)
4.description: Learning (ML/DL) encompasses techniques that can "learn" from known data to create analytics that generalize to new data. There may be a statistical component to these techniques, but it is not a requirement.

5.caption: Fingerprinting
5.description: Fingerprinting is the technique of collecting detailed system data, including software versions and configurations, to enhance threat detection, data loss prevention (DLP), and endpoint detection and response (EDR) capabilities.

7.caption: Keyword Match
7.description: Keyword Match involves scanning content for specific terms to identify sensitive information, potential threats, or policy violations, aiding in DLP and compliance monitoring.

8.caption: Regular Expressions
8.description: Regular Expressions are used to define complex search patterns for identifying, validating, and extracting specific data sets or threats within digital content, enhancing DLP, EDR, and threat detection mechanisms.

9.caption: Exact Data Match
9.description: Exact Data Match is a precise comparison technique used to detect the unauthorized use or exposure of specific, sensitive information, crucial for enforcing DLP policies and protecting against data breaches.

10.caption: Partial Data Match
10.description: Partial Data Match involves identifying instances where segments of sensitive information or patterns match, facilitating nuanced DLP and threat detection without requiring complete data conformity.

11.caption: Indexed Data Match
11.description: Indexed Data Match refers to comparing content against a pre-compiled index of sensitive information to efficiently detect and prevent unauthorized access or breaches, streamlining DLP and compliance efforts.

related_analytics.caption: Related Analytics
related_analytics.description: Other analytics related to this analytic.

@deprecated.message: Related Analytics has been decoupled from this object, instead use finding_info.related_analytics.

finding.caption: Finding
finding.name: finding
finding.description: The Finding object describes metadata related to a security finding generated by a security tool or system.

title.caption: Title
title.description: A title or a brief phrase summarizing the reported finding.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the reported finding.

product.caption: Product
product.description: Details about the product that reported the finding.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the reported finding.

types.caption: Types
types.description: One or more types of the reported finding.

remediation.caption: Remediation Guidance
remediation.description: Describes the recommended remediation steps to address identified issue(s).

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the finding was created.

first_seen_time.caption: First Seen
first_seen_time.description: The time when the finding was first observed.

last_seen_time.caption: Last Seen
last_seen_time.description: The time when the finding was most recently observed.

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The time when the finding was last modified.

product_uid.caption: Product Identifier
product_uid.description: The unique identifier of the product that reported the finding.

@deprecated.message: Use the uid attribute in the product object instead. See specific usage.

related_events.caption: Related Events/Findings
related_events.description: Describes events and/or other findings related to the finding as identified by the security product. Note that these events may or may not be in OCSF.

src_url.caption: Source URL
src_url.description: The URL pointing to the source of the finding.

supporting_data.caption: Supporting Data
supporting_data.description: Additional data supporting a finding as provided by security tool

modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time
modified_time_dt.description: The time when the finding was last modified.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The time when the finding was created.

first_seen_time_dt.caption: First Seen
first_seen_time_dt.description: The time when the finding was first observed.

last_seen_time_dt.caption: Last Seen
last_seen_time_dt.description: The time when the finding was most recently observed.

evidences.caption: Evidence Artifacts
evidences.name: evidences
evidences.description: A collection of evidence artifacts associated to the activity/activities that triggered a security detection.

data.caption: Data
data.description: Additional evidence data that is not accounted for in the specific evidence attributes. Use only when absolutely necessary.

http_response.caption: HTTP Response
http_response.description: Describes details about the http response associated to the activity that triggered the detection.

http_request.caption: HTTP Request
http_request.description: Describes details about the http request associated to the activity that triggered the detection.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The naming convention or type identifier of the evidence associated with the security detection. For example, the @odata.type from Microsoft Graph Alerts V2 or display_name from CrowdStrike Falcon Incident Behaviors.

process.caption: Process
process.description: Describes details about the process associated to the activity that triggered the detection.

file.caption: File
