is_public.caption: Public
is_public.description: Indicates if the file is publicly accessible. For example in an object's public access in AWS S3

confidentiality.caption: Confidentiality
confidentiality.description: The file content confidentiality, normalized to the confidentiality_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

drive_type.caption: Drive Type
drive_type.description: The drive type, normalized to the caption of the drive_type_id value. In the case of Other, it is defined by the source.

internal_name.caption: Internal Name
internal_name.description: The name of the file as identified within the file itself. This contrasts with the name by which the file is known on disk. Where available, the internal name is widely used by security practitioners and detection content because the on-disk file name is not reliable. On the Windows OS, most PE files contain a VERSIONINFO resource from which the internal name can be obtained. On macOS, binaries can optionally embed a copy of the application's Info.plist file which in turn contains the name of the executable.

path.caption: Path
path.description: The full path to the file. For example: c:\windows\system32\svchost.exe.

ext.caption: File Extension
ext.description: The extension of the file, excluding the leading dot. For example: exe from svchost.exe, or gz from export.tar.gz.

accessed_time.caption: Accessed Time
accessed_time.description: The time when the file was last accessed.

modifier.caption: Modifier
modifier.description: The user that last modified the file.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

confidentiality_id.caption: Confidentiality ID
confidentiality_id.description: The normalized identifier of the file content confidentiality indicator.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The confidentiality is not mapped. See the confidentiality attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

storage_class.caption: Storage Class
storage_class.description: The storage class of the file. For example in AWS S3: STANDARD, STANDARD_IA, GLACIER.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the file as defined by the storage system, such the file system file ID.

uri.caption: File URI
uri.description: The file URI, such as those reporting by static analysis tools. E.g., file:///C:/dev/sarif/sarif-tutorials/samples/Introduction/simple-example.js

volume.caption: Volume
volume.description: The volume on the storage device where the file is located.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The file version. For example: 8.0.7601.17514.

is_encrypted.caption: Encrypted
is_encrypted.description: Indicates if the file is encrypted.

signature.caption: Digital Signature
signature.description: The digital signature of the file.

product.caption: Product
product.description: The product that created or installed the file.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the file. For example: svchost.exe

modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time
modified_time_dt.description: The time when the file was last modified.

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The time when the file was last modified.

drive_type_id.caption: Drive Type ID
drive_type_id.description: Identifies the type of a disk drive, i.e. fixed, removable, etc.

3.caption: Remote
3.description: The drive is a remote (network) drive.

1.caption: Removable
1.description: The drive has removable media; for example, a floppy drive, thumb drive, or flash card reader.

2.caption: Fixed
2.description: The drive has fixed media; for example, a hard disk drive or flash drive.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The drive type is not mapped. See the drive_type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

4.caption: CD-ROM
4.description: The drive is a CD-ROM drive.

5.caption: RAM Disk
5.description: The drive is a RAM disk.

data_classifications.caption: Data Classification
data_classifications.description: A list of Data Classification objects, that include information about data classification levels and data category types, indentified by a classifier.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The file type.

parent_folder.caption: Parent Folder
parent_folder.description: The parent folder in which the file resides. For example: c:\windows\system32

accessed_time_dt.caption: Accessed Time
accessed_time_dt.description: The time when the file was last accessed.

data_classification.caption: Data Classification
data_classification.name: data_classification
data_classification.description: The Data Classification object includes information about data classification levels and data category types.

status.caption: Status
status.description: The resultant status of the classification job normalized to the caption of the status_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

total.caption: Total
total.description: The total count of discovered entities, by the classification job.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the classification job.

category.caption: Category
category.description: The name of the data classification category that data matched into, e.g. Financial, Personal, Governmental, etc.

category_id.caption: Category ID
category_id.description: The normalized identifier of the data classification category.

3.caption: Financial
3.description: Any financially-related sensitive information or Cardholder Data (CHD). E.g., banking account numbers, credit card numbers, International Banking Account Numbers (IBAN), SWIFT codes, etc.

6.caption: Security
6.description: Any sensitive security-related data such as passwords, passkeys, IP addresses, API keys, credentials and similar secrets. E.g., AWS Access Secret Key, SaaS API Keys, user passwords, database credentials, etc.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The type is not mapped. See the data_type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

1.caption: Personal
1.description: Any Personally Identifiable Information (PII), Electronic Personal Health Information (ePHI), or similarly personal information. E.g., full name, home address, date of birth, etc.

2.caption: Governmental
2.description: Any sensitive government identification number related to a person or other classified material. E.g., Passport numbers, driver license numbers, business identification, taxation identifiers, etc.

99.caption: Other
99.description: Any other type of data classification or a multi-variate classification made up of several other classification categories.

4.caption: Business
4.description: Any business-specific sensitive data such as intellectual property, trademarks, copyrights, human resource data, Board of Directors meeting minutes, and similar.

5.caption: Military and Law Enforcement
5.description: Any mission-specific sensitive data for military, law enforcement, or other government agencies such as specifically classified data, weapon systems information, or other planning data.

classifier_details.caption: Classifier Details
classifier_details.description: Describes details about the classifier used for data classification.

confidentiality.caption: Confidentiality
confidentiality.description: The file content confidentiality, normalized to the confidentiality_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

confidentiality_id.caption: Confidentiality ID
confidentiality_id.description: The normalized identifier of the file content confidentiality indicator.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The confidentiality is not mapped. See the confidentiality attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

discovery_details.caption: Discovery Details
discovery_details.description: Details about the data discovered by classification job.

policy.caption: Policy
policy.description: Details about the data policy that governs data handling and security measures related to classification.

src_url.caption: Source URL
src_url.description: The source URL pointing towards the full classifcation job details.

status_details.caption: Status Details
status_details.description: The contextual description of the status, status_id value.

status_id.caption: Status ID
status_id.description: The normalized status identifier of the classification job.

3.caption: Fail
3.description: The classification job failed for the evaluated resource.

1.caption: Complete
1.description: The classification job completed for the evaluated resource.

2.caption: Partial
2.description: The classification job partially completed for the evaluated resource.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The classification job type id is not mapped.

malware.caption: Malware
malware.name: malware
malware.description: The Malware object describes the classification of known malicious software, which is intentionally designed to cause damage to a computer, server, client, or computer network.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The malware name, as reported by the detection engine.

path.caption: Path
path.description: The filesystem path of the malware that was observed.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: A unique identifier for the specific malware instance, as assigned by the detection engine (e.g., virus signature ID or IPS rule ID).

files.caption: Files
files.description: The list of file objects representing files that were identified as infected by the malware.

severity.caption: Severity
severity.description: The severity of the malware, normalized to the captions of the severity_id values. In the case of 'Other', they are defined by the event source.

classification_ids.caption: Classification IDs
classification_ids.description: The list of normalized identifiers of the malware classifications.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The classification is not mapped. See the classifications attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

classifications.caption: Classifications
classifications.description: The list of malware classifications, normalized to the captions of the classification_ids values. In the case of 'Other', they are defined by the event source.

cves.caption: CVE List
cves.description: The list of Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) identifiers associated with the malware. Reference: CVE

num_infected.caption: Number of Infected Entities
num_infected.description: The number of files that were identified to be infected by the malware.

provider.caption: Provider
provider.description: The name or identifier of the security solution or service that provided the malware detection information.

severity_id.caption: Severity ID
severity_id.description: The normalized identifier of the malware severity.

3.caption: Medium
3.description: Action is required but the situation is not serious at this time.

6.caption: Fatal
6.description: An error occurred but it is too late to take remedial action.

1.caption: Informational
1.description: Informational message. No action required.

2.caption: Low
2.description: The user decides if action is needed.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event/finding severity is not mapped. See the severity attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

4.caption: High
4.description: Action is required immediately.

5.caption: Critical
5.description: Action is required immediately and the scope is broad.

malware_scan_info.caption: Malware Scan Info
malware_scan_info.name: malware_scan_info
malware_scan_info.description: The malware scan information object describes characteristics, metadata of a malware scanning job.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The administrator-supplied or application-generated name of the scan. For example: "Home office weekly user database scan", "Scan folders for viruses", "Full system virus scan"

size.caption: Size
size.description: The total size in bytes of all files that were scanned.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The type of scan.

uid.caption: Scan UID
uid.description: The application-defined unique identifier assigned to an instance of a scan.

start_time.caption: Start Time
start_time.description: The timestamp indicating when the scan job began execution.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The type id of the scan.

3.caption: Updated Content
3.description: The scan was triggered by a content update.

6.caption: User Logon
6.description: The scan was started due to a user logon.

1.caption: Manual
1.description: The scan was manually initiated by the user or administrator.

2.caption: Scheduled
2.description: The scan was started based on scheduler.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The scan type id is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

4.caption: Quarantined Items
4.description: The scan was triggered by newly quarantined items.

5.caption: Attached Media
5.description: The scan was triggered by the attachment of removable media.

7.caption: ELAM
7.description: The scan was triggered by an Early Launch Anti-Malware (ELAM) detection.

end_time.caption: End Time
end_time.description: The timestamp indicating when the scan job completed execution.

start_time_dt.caption: Start Time
start_time_dt.description: The timestamp indicating when the scan job began execution.

end_time_dt.caption: End Time
end_time_dt.description: The timestamp indicating when the scan job completed execution.

num_volumes.caption: Number of Volumes
num_volumes.description: The total number of storage volumes examined during the malware scan.

num_infected.caption: Number of Infected Entities
num_infected.description: The total number of files identified as infected with malware during the scan.

unique_malware_count.caption: Unique Malware Count
unique_malware_count.description: The number of unique malware detected across all infected files.

num_files.caption: Scanned Files
num_files.description: The total number of files analyzed during the scan.

observable.caption: Observable
observable.name: observable
observable.description: The observable object is a pivot element that contains related information found in many places in the event.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The full name of the observable attribute. The name is a pointer/reference to an attribute within the OCSF event data. For example: file.name.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The observable value type name.

value.caption: Value
value.description:
The value associated with the observable attribute. The meaning of the value depends on the observable type.
If the name refers to a scalar attribute, then the value is the value of the attribute.
If the name refers to an object attribute, then the value is not populated.

46.caption: Registry Key Path
46.description:
Observable by Dictionary Type.
Full path of registry key.

16.caption: HTTP User-Agent
16.description:
Observable by Dictionary Attribute.
The request header that identifies the operating system and web browser.

30.caption: Fingerprint
30.description:
Observable by Object.
The Fingerprint object provides detailed information about a digital fingerprint, which is a compact representation of data used to identify a longer piece of information, such as a public key or file content. It contains the algorithm and value of the fingerprint, enabling efficient and reliable identification of the associated data.

3.caption: MAC Address
3.description:
Observable by Dictionary Type.
Media Access Control (MAC) address. For example:
18:36:F3:98:4F:9A.

42.caption: Message UID
42.description:
Observable by Dictionary Attribute.
The email header Message-ID value, as defined by RFC 5322.

6.caption: URL String
6.description:
Observable by Dictionary Type.
Uniform Resource Locator (URL) string. For example:
http://www.example.com/download/trouble.exe.

21.caption: User
21.description:
Observable by Object.
The User object describes the characteristics of a user/person or a security principal.

9.caption: Process Name
9.description:
Observable by Dictionary Type.
Process name. For example:
Notepad.

10.caption: Resource UID
10.description:
Observable by Dictionary Type.
Resource unique identifier. For example, S3 Bucket name or EC2 Instance ID.

26.caption: Geo Location
26.description:
Observable by Object.
The Geo Location object describes a geographical location, usually associated with an IP address.

31.caption: User Object: uid
31.description:
Observable by Object-Specific Attribute.
Object-specific attribute "uid" for the User Object.

38.caption: Resource Details Object: name
38.description:
Observable by Object-Specific Attribute.
Object-specific attribute "name" for the Resource Details Object.

37.caption: Serial Number
37.description:
Observable by Dictionary Attribute.
The serial number that pertains to the object. See specific usage.

45.caption: File Path
45.description:
Observable by Dictionary Type.
The full path to the file. For example: For example:
c:\windows\system32\svchost.exe.

17.caption: CWE Object: uid
17.description:
Observable by Object-Specific Attribute.
Object-specific attribute "uid" for the CWE Object.

22.caption: Email
22.description:
Observable by Object.
The Email object describes the email metadata such as sender, recipients, and direction, and can include embedded URLs and files.

41.caption: Email Object: uid
41.description:
Observable by Object-Specific Attribute.
Object-specific attribute "uid" for the Email Object.

1.caption: Hostname
1.description:
Observable by Dictionary Type.
Unique name assigned to a device connected to a computer network. It may be a fully qualified domain name (FQDN). For example:
r2-d2.example.com.,
mx.example.com

35.caption: Account Object: uid
35.description:
Observable by Object-Specific Attribute.
Object-specific attribute "uid" for the Account Object.

14.caption: Country
14.description:
Observable by Dictionary Attribute.
The ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2 country code.

Note: The two letter country code should be capitalized. For example: US or CA.

29.caption: Registry Value
29.description:
Observable by Object.
The registry value object describes a Windows registry value.

32.caption: Group Object: name
32.description:
Observable by Object-Specific Attribute.
Object-specific attribute "name" for the Group Object.

12.caption: Subnet
12.description:
Observable by Dictionary Type.
The subnet represented in a CIDR notation, using the format network_address/prefix_length. The network_address can be in either IPv4 or IPv6 format. The prefix length indicates the number of bits used for the network portion, and the remaining bits are available for host addresses within that subnet. For example:
192.168.1.0/24,
2001:0db8:85a3:0000::/64

43.caption: Registry Value Object: name
43.description:
Observable by Object-Specific Attribute.
Object-specific attribute "name" for the Registry Value Object.

7.caption: File Name
7.description:
Observable by Dictionary Type.
File name. For example:
text-file.txt.

8.caption: Hash
8.description:
Observable by Dictionary Type.
Hash. A unique value that corresponds to the content of the file, image, ja3_hash or hassh found in the schema. For example:
MD5: 3172ac7e2b55cbb81f04a6e65855a628.

20.caption: Endpoint
20.description:
Observable by Object.
The Endpoint object describes a physical or virtual device that connects to and exchanges information with a computer network. Some examples of endpoints are mobile devices, desktop computers, virtual machines, embedded devices, and servers. Internet-of-Things devices—like cameras, lighting, refrigerators, security systems, smart speakers, and thermostats—are also endpoints.

4.caption: User Name
4.description:
Observable by Dictionary Type.
User name. For example:
john_doe.

24.caption: File
24.description:
Observable by Object.
The File object represents the metadata associated with a file stored in a computer system. It encompasses information about the file itself, including its attributes, properties, and organizational details.

39.caption: Process Entity Object: uid
39.description:
Observable by Object-Specific Attribute.
Object-specific attribute "uid" for the Process Entity Object.

19.caption: User Credential ID
19.description:
Observable by Dictionary Attribute.
The unique identifier of the user's credential. For example, AWS Access Key ID.

25.caption: Process
25.description:
Observable by Object.
The Process object describes a running instance of a launched program.

27.caption: Container
27.description:
Observable by Object.
The Container object describes an instance of a specific container. A container is a prepackaged, portable system image that runs isolated on an existing system using a container runtime like containerd.

5.caption: Email Address
5.description:
Observable by Dictionary Type.
Email address. For example:
john_doe@example.com.

23.caption: Uniform Resource Locator
23.description:
Observable by Object.
The Uniform Resource Locator (URL) object describes the characteristics of a URL.

34.caption: Account Object: name
34.description:
Observable by Object-Specific Attribute.
Object-specific attribute "name" for the Account Object.

18.caption: CVE Object: uid
18.description:
Observable by Object-Specific Attribute.
Object-specific attribute "uid" for the CVE Object.

40.caption: Email Object: subject
40.description:
Observable by Object-Specific Attribute.
Object-specific attribute "subject" for the Email Object.

13.caption: Command Line
13.description:
Observable by Dictionary Attribute.
The full command line used to launch an application, service, process, or job. For example: ssh user@10.0.0.10. If the command line is unavailable or missing, the empty string '' is to be used.

11.caption: Port
11.description:
Observable by Dictionary Type.
The TCP/UDP port number. For example:
80,
22.

28.caption: Registry Key
28.description:
Observable by Object.
The registry key object describes a Windows registry key.

44.caption: Advisory Object: uid
44.description:
Observable by Object-Specific Attribute.
Object-specific attribute "uid" for the Advisory Object.

2.caption: IP Address
2.description:
Observable by Dictionary Type.
Internet Protocol address (IP address), in either IPv4 or IPv6 format. For example:
192.168.200.24,
2001:0db8:85a3:0000:0000:8a2e:0370:7334.

36.caption: Script Content
36.description:
Observable by Dictionary Attribute.
The script content, normalized to UTF-8 encoding irrespective of its original encoding. When emitting this attribute, it may be appropriate to truncate large scripts. When consuming this attribute, large scripts should be anticipated.

33.caption: Group Object: uid
33.description:
Observable by Object-Specific Attribute.
Object-specific attribute "uid" for the Group Object.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The observable data type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which may contain data source specific value.

15.caption: Process ID
15.description:
Observable by Dictionary Attribute.
The process identifier, as reported by the operating system. Process ID (PID) is a number used by the operating system to uniquely identify an active process.

reputation.caption: Reputation Scores
reputation.description: Contains the original and normalized reputation scores.

sbom.caption: Software Bill of Materials
sbom.name: sbom
sbom.description: The Software Bill of Materials object describes characteristics of a generated SBOM.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The type of SBOM, normalized to the caption of the type_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The specification (spec) version of the particular SBOM, e.g., 1.6.

product.caption: Product
product.description: Details about the upstream product that generated the SBOM e.g. cdxgen or Syft.

uid.caption: SBOM ID
uid.description: A unique identifier for the SBOM or the SBOM generation by a source tool, such as the SPDX metadata.component.bom-ref.

3.caption: SWID
3.description: The International Organization for Standardization (ISO) and the International Electrotechnical Commission (IEC) publishes, ISO/IEC 19770-2, a standard for software identification (SWID) tags that defines a structured metadata format for describing a software product. A SWID tag document is composed of a structured set of data elements that identify the software product

1.caption: SPDX
1.description: System Package Data Exchange (SPDX®) is an open standard capable of representing systems with software components in as SBOMs (Software Bill of Materials) and other AI, data and security references supporting a range of risk management use cases. The SPDX specification is a freely available international open standard (ISO/IEC 5692:2021).

2.caption: CycloneDX
2.description: CycloneDX is an International Standard for Bill of Materials (ECMA-424).

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the SBOM was created.

package.caption: Software Package
package.description: The software package or library that is being discovered or inventoried by an SBOM.

software_components.caption: Software Components
software_components.description: The list of software components used in the software package.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The time when the SBOM was created.

module.caption: Module
module.name: module
module.description: The Module object describes the load attributes of a module.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The module type.

file.caption: File
file.description: The module file object.

base_address.caption: Base Address
base_address.description: The memory address where the module was loaded.

function_name.caption: Function Name
function_name.description: The entry-point function of the module. The system calls the entry-point function whenever a process or thread loads or unloads the module.

load_type.caption: Load Type
load_type.description: The load type, normalized to the caption of the load_type_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

load_type_id.caption: Load Type ID
load_type_id.description: The normalized identifier for how the module was loaded in memory.

3.caption: ShellCode
3.description: A raw module in process memory that is READWRITE_EXECUTE and had a thread started in its range.

1.caption: Standard
1.description: A normal module loaded by the normal windows loading mechanism i.e. LoadLibrary.

2.caption: Non Standard
2.description: A module loaded in a way avoidant of normal windows procedures. i.e. Bootstrapped Loading/Manual Dll Loading.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The load type is not mapped. See the load_type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

4.caption: Mapped
4.description: A memory mapped file, typically created with CreatefileMapping/MapViewOfFile.

5.caption: NonStandard Backed
5.description: A module loaded in a non standard way. However, GetModuleFileName succeeds on this allocation.

start_address.caption: Start Address
start_address.description: The start address of the execution.

web_resource.caption: Web Resource
web_resource.name: web_resource
web_resource.description: The Web Resource object describes characteristics of a web resource that was affected by the activity/event.

data.caption: Data
data.description: Details of the web resource, e.g, file details, search results or application-defined resource.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the web resource.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The web resource type as defined by the event source.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: Description of the web resource.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the web resource.

labels.caption: Labels
labels.description: The list of labels associated to the resource.

tags.caption: Tags
tags.description: The list of tags; {key:value} pairs associated to the resource.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the resource was created.

data_classification.caption: Data Classification
data_classification.description: The Data Classification object includes information about data classification levels and data category types.

data_classifications.caption: Data Classification
data_classifications.description: A list of Data Classification objects, that include information about data classification levels and data category types, indentified by a classifier.

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The time when the resource was last modified.

uid_alt.caption: Alternate ID
uid_alt.description: The alternative unique identifier of the resource.

url_string.caption: URL String
url_string.description: The URL pointing towards the source of the web resource.

modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time
modified_time_dt.description: The time when the resource was last modified.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The time when the resource was created.

http_request.caption: HTTP Request
http_request.name: http_request
http_request.description: The HTTP Request object represents the attributes of a request made to a web server. It encapsulates the details and metadata associated with an HTTP request, including the request method, headers, URL, query parameters, body content, and other relevant information.

args.caption: HTTP Arguments
args.description: The arguments sent along with the HTTP request.

version.caption: HTTP Version
version.description: The Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) version.

length.caption: Request Length
length.description: The length of the entire HTTP request, in number of bytes.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the http request.

url.caption: URL
url.description: The URL object that pertains to the request.

x_forwarded_for.caption: X-Forwarded-For
x_forwarded_for.description: The X-Forwarded-For header identifying the originating IP address(es) of a client connecting to a web server through an HTTP proxy or a load balancer.

body_length.caption: Request Body Length
body_length.description: The actual length of the HTTP request body, in number of bytes, independent of a potentially existing Content-Length header.

user_agent.caption: HTTP User-Agent
user_agent.description: The request header that identifies the operating system and web browser.

http_headers.caption: HTTP Headers
http_headers.description: Additional HTTP headers of an HTTP request or response.

http_method.caption: HTTP Method
http_method.description: The HTTP request method indicates the desired action to be performed for a given resource.

OPTIONS.caption: Options
OPTIONS.description: The OPTIONS method describes the communication options for the target resource.

GET.caption: Get
GET.description: The GET method requests a representation of the specified resource. Requests using GET should only retrieve data.

HEAD.caption: Head
HEAD.description: The HEAD method asks for a response identical to a GET request, but without the response body.

POST.caption: Post
POST.description: The POST method submits an entity to the specified resource, often causing a change in state or side effects on the server.

PUT.caption: Put
PUT.description: The PUT method replaces all current representations of the target resource with the request payload.

DELETE.caption: Delete
DELETE.description: The DELETE method deletes the specified resource.

TRACE.caption: Trace
TRACE.description: The TRACE method performs a message loop-back test along the path to the target resource.

CONNECT.caption: Connect
CONNECT.description: The CONNECT method establishes a tunnel to the server identified by the target resource.

referrer.caption: HTTP Referrer
referrer.description: The request header that identifies the address of the previous web page, which is linked to the current web page or resource being requested.

finding_info.caption: Finding Information
finding_info.name: finding_info
finding_info.description: The Finding Information object describes metadata related to a security finding generated by a security tool or system.

title.caption: Title
title.description: A title or a brief phrase summarizing the reported finding.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the reported finding.

product.caption: Product
product.description: Details about the product that reported the finding.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the reported finding.

types.caption: Types
types.description: One or more types of the reported finding.

tags.caption: Tags
tags.description: The list of tags; {key:value} pairs associated with the finding.

attacks.caption: MITRE ATT&CK® and ATLAS™ Details
attacks.description: The MITRE ATT&CK® technique and associated tactics related to the finding.

analytic.caption: Analytic
analytic.description: The analytic technique used to analyze and derive insights from the data or information that led to the finding or conclusion.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the finding was created.

data_sources.caption: Data Sources
data_sources.description: A list of data sources utilized in generation of the finding.

first_seen_time.caption: First Seen
first_seen_time.description:
The time when the finding was first observed. e.g. The time when a vulnerability was first observed.

It can differ from the created_time timestamp, which reflects the time this finding was created.

kill_chain.caption: Kill Chain
kill_chain.description: The Cyber Kill Chain® provides a detailed description of each phase and its associated activities within the broader context of a cyber attack.

last_seen_time.caption: Last Seen
last_seen_time.description:
The time when the finding was most recently observed. e.g. The time when a vulnerability was most recently observed.

It can differ from the modified_time timestamp, which reflects the time this finding was last modified.

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The time when the finding was last modified.

product_uid.caption: Product Identifier
product_uid.description: The unique identifier of the product that reported the finding.

@deprecated.message: Use the uid attribute in the product object instead. See specific usage.

related_analytics.caption: Related Analytics
related_analytics.description: Other analytics related to this finding.

related_events.caption: Related Events/Findings
related_events.description: Describes events and/or other findings related to the finding as identified by the security product. Note that these events may or may not be in OCSF.

related_events_count.caption: Related Events/Findings Count
related_events_count.description: Number of related events or findings.

src_url.caption: Source URL
src_url.description: The URL pointing to the source of the finding.

uid_alt.caption: Alternate ID
uid_alt.description: The alternative unique identifier of the reported finding.

traits.caption: Traits
traits.description: The list of key traits or characteristics extracted from the finding.

modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time
modified_time_dt.description: The time when the finding was last modified.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The time when the finding was created.

first_seen_time_dt.caption: First Seen
first_seen_time_dt.description:
The time when the finding was first observed. e.g. The time when a vulnerability was first observed.

It can differ from the created_time timestamp, which reflects the time this finding was created.

last_seen_time_dt.caption: Last Seen
last_seen_time_dt.description:
The time when the finding was most recently observed. e.g. The time when a vulnerability was most recently observed.

It can differ from the modified_time timestamp, which reflects the time this finding was last modified.

check.caption: Check
check.name: check
check.description: The check object defines a specific, testable compliance verification point that evaluates a target device against a standard, framework, or custom requirement. While checks are typically associated with formal standards (like CIS, NIST, or ISO), they can also represent custom or organizational requirements. When mapped to controls, checks can evaluate specific control_parameters to determine compliance status, but neither the control mapping nor control_parameters are required for a valid check.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name or title of the compliance check. For example, CIS: Ensure mounting of cramfs filesystems is disabled or DISA STIG: The Ubuntu operating system must implement DoD-approved encryption to protect the confidentiality of remote access sessions.

status.caption: Status
status.description: The resultant status of the compliance check normalized to the caption of the status_id value. For example, CIS Benchmark: Pass when all requirements are met, Fail when requirements are not met, or DISA STIG: NotAFinding (maps to status_id 1/Pass), Open (maps to status_id 3/Fail).

version.caption: Version
version.description: The check version. For example, CIS Benchmark: 1.1.0 for Amazon Linux 2 or DISA STIG: V2R1 for Windows 10.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The detailed description of the compliance check, explaining the security requirement, vulnerability, or configuration being assessed. For example, CIS: The cramfs filesystem type is a compressed read-only Linux filesystem. Removing support for unneeded filesystem types reduces the local attack surface. or DISA STIG: Unauthorized access to the information system by foreign entities may result in loss or compromise of data.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the compliance check within its standard or framework. For example, CIS Benchmark identifier 1.1.1.1, DISA STIG identifier V-230234, or NIST control identifier AC-17(2).

severity.caption: Severity
severity.description: The severity level as defined in the source document. For example CIS Benchmarks, valid values are: Level 1 (security-forward, essential settings), Level 2 (security-focused environment, more restrictive), or Scored/Not Scored (whether compliance can be automatically checked). For DISA STIG, valid values are: CAT I (maps to severity_id 5/Critical), CAT II (maps to severity_id 4/High), or CAT III (maps to severity_id 3/Medium).

severity_id.caption: Severity ID
severity_id.description: The normalized severity identifier that maps severity levels to standard severity levels. For example CIS Benchmark: Level 2 maps to 4 (High), Level 1 maps to 3 (Medium). For DISA STIG: CAT I maps to 5 (Critical), CAT II maps to 4 (High), and CAT III maps to 3 (Medium).

3.caption: Medium
3.description: Maps to CIS Benchmark Level 1 - Essential security settings recommended for all systems, or DISA STIG CAT III - Action is required but the situation is not serious at this time.

6.caption: Fatal
6.description: An error occurred but it is too late to take remedial action.

1.caption: Informational
1.description: Informational message. No action required.

2.caption: Low
2.description: The user decides if action is needed.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The severity is not mapped. See the severity attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

4.caption: High
4.description: Maps to CIS Benchmark Level 2 - More restrictive and security-focused settings for sensitive environments, or DISA STIG CAT II - Action is required immediately.

5.caption: Critical
5.description: Maps to DISA STIG CAT I - Action is required immediately and the scope is broad.

standards.caption: Compliance Standards: List
standards.description: The regulatory or industry standard this check is associated with. E.g., PCI DSS 3.2.1, HIPAA Security Rule, NIST SP 800-53 Rev. 5, or ISO/IEC 27001:2013.

status_id.caption: Status ID
status_id.description: The normalized status identifier of the compliance check.

3.caption: Fail
3.description: The compliance check failed for at least one of the evaluated resources.

1.caption: Pass
1.description: The compliance check passed for all the evaluated resources.

2.caption: Warning
2.description: The compliance check did not yield a result due to missing information.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event status is not mapped. See the status attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

os.caption: Operating System (OS)
os.name: os
os.description: The Operating System (OS) object describes characteristics of an OS, such as Linux or Windows.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The operating system name.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The type of the operating system.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The version of the OS running on the device that originated the event. For example: "Windows 10", "OS X 10.7", or "iOS 9".

country.caption: Country
country.description:
The operating system country code, as defined by the ISO 3166-1 standard (Alpha-2 code).

Note: The two letter country code should be capitalized. For example: US or CA.

lang.caption: Language
lang.description: The two letter lower case language codes, as defined by ISO 639-1. For example: en (English), de (German), or fr (French).

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The type identifier of the operating system.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

cpe_name.caption: The product CPE identifier
cpe_name.description: The Common Platform Enumeration (CPE) name as described by (NIST) For example: cpe:/a:apple:safari:16.2.

cpu_bits.caption: CPU Bits
cpu_bits.description: The cpu architecture, the number of bits used for addressing in memory. For example: 32 or 64.

edition.caption: OS Edition
edition.description: The operating system edition. For example: Professional.

kernel_release.caption: Kernel Release
kernel_release.description: The kernel release of the operating system. On Unix-based systems, this is determined from the uname -r command output, for example "5.15.0-122-generic".

sp_name.caption: OS Service Pack
sp_name.description: The name of the latest Service Pack.

sp_ver.caption: OS Service Pack Version
sp_ver.description: The version number of the latest Service Pack.

scim.caption: SCIM
scim.name: scim
scim.description: The System for Cross-domain Identity Management (SCIM) Configuration object provides a structured set of attributes related to SCIM protocols used for identity provisioning and management across cloud-based platforms. It standardizes user and group provisioning details, enabling identity synchronization and lifecycle management with compatible Identity Providers (IdPs) and applications. SCIM is defined in RFC-7634

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the SCIM resource.

version.caption: SCIM Version
version.description: SCIM protocol version supported e.g., SCIM 2.0.

state.caption: State
state.description: The provisioning state of the SCIM resource, normalized to the caption of the state_id value. In the case of Other, it is defined by the event source.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: A unique identifier for a SCIM resource as defined by the service provider.

protocol_name.caption: Supported Protocol
protocol_name.description: The supported protocol for the SCIM resource. E.g., SAML, OIDC, or OAuth2.

auth_protocol.caption: Auth Protocol
auth_protocol.description: The authorization protocol as defined by the caption of auth_protocol_id. In the case of Other, it is defined by the event source.

auth_protocol_id.caption: Auth Protocol ID
auth_protocol_id.description: The normalized identifier of the authorization protocol used by the SCIM resource.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The authentication protocol is not mapped. See the auth_protocol attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: When the SCIM resource was added to the service provider.

error_message.caption: Last Error Message
error_message.description: Message or code associated with the last encountered error.

is_group_provisioning_enabled.caption: SCIM Group Provisioning Enabled
is_group_provisioning_enabled.description: Indicates whether the SCIM resource is configured to provision groups, automatically or otherwise.

is_user_provisioning_enabled.caption: SCIM User Provisioning Enabled
is_user_provisioning_enabled.description: Indicates whether the SCIM resource is configured to provision users, automatically or otherwise.

last_run_time.caption: Last Sync Time
last_run_time.description: Timestamp of the most recent successful synchronization.

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The most recent time when the SCIM resource was updated at the service provider.

rate_limit.caption: Rate Limit
rate_limit.description: Maximum number of requests allowed by the SCIM resource within a specified time frame to avoid throttling.

scim_group_schema.caption: SCIM Group Schema
scim_group_schema.description: SCIM provides a schema for representing groups, identified using the following schema URI: urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:core:2.0:Group as defined in RFC-7634. This attribute will capture key-value pairs for the scheme implemented in a SCIM resource.

scim_user_schema.caption: SCIM User Schema
scim_user_schema.description: SCIM provides a resource type for user resources. The core schema for user is identified using the following schema URI: urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:core:2.0:User as defined in RFC-7634. his attribute will capture key-value pairs for the scheme implemented in a SCIM resource. This object is inclusive of both the basic and Enterprise User Schema Extension.

state_id.caption: State ID
state_id.description: The normalized state ID of the SCIM resource to reflect its activation status.

3.caption: Failed
3.description: The SCIM resource is in a Failed state.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The provisioning state of the SCIM resource is unknown.

1.caption: Pending
1.description: The SCIM resource is Pending activation or creation.

2.caption: Active
2.description: The SCIM resource is in an Active state, or otherwise enabled.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The provisioning state of the SCIM resource is not mapped. See the state attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

4.caption: Deleted
4.description: The SCIM resource is in a Deleted state, or otherwise disabled.

uid_alt.caption: External ID
uid_alt.description: A String that is an identifier for the resource as defined by the provisioning client. The externalId may simplify identification of a resource between the provisioning client and the service provider by allowing the client to use a filter to locate the resource with an identifier from the provisioning domain, obviating the need to store a local mapping between the provisioning domain's identifier of the resource and the identifier used by the service provider.

url_string.caption: SCIM Endpoint URL
url_string.description: The primary URL for SCIM API requests.

vendor_name.caption: Service Provider
vendor_name.description: Name of the vendor or service provider implementing SCIM. E.g., Okta, Auth0, Microsoft.

last_run_time_dt.caption: Last Sync Time
last_run_time_dt.description: Timestamp of the most recent successful synchronization.

modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time
modified_time_dt.description: The most recent time when the SCIM resource was updated at the service provider.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: When the SCIM resource was added to the service provider.

key_value_object.caption: Key:Value object
key_value_object.name: key_value_object
key_value_object.description: A generic object allowing to define a {key:value} pair.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the key.

value.caption: Value
value.description: The value associated to the key.

values.caption: Values
values.description: Optional, the values associated to the key. You can populate this attribute, when you have multiple values for the same key.

cloud.caption: Cloud
cloud.name: cloud
cloud.description: The Cloud object contains information about a cloud or Software-as-a-Service account or similar construct, such as AWS Account ID, regions, organizations, folders, compartments, tenants, etc.

org.caption: Organization
org.description: Organization and org unit relevant to the event or object.

account.caption: Account
account.description: The account object describes details about the account that was the source or target of the activity.

cloud_partition.caption: Cloud Partition
cloud_partition.description: The canonical cloud partition name to which the region is assigned (e.g. AWS Partitions: aws, aws-cn, aws-us-gov).

project_uid.caption: Project ID
project_uid.description: The unique identifier of a Cloud project.

provider.caption: Provider
provider.description: The unique name of the Cloud services provider, such as AWS, MS Azure, GCP, etc.

region.caption: Region
region.description: The name of the cloud region, as defined by the cloud provider.

zone.caption: Cloud Availability Zone
zone.description: The availability zone in the cloud region, as defined by the cloud provider.

tls.caption: Transport Layer Security (TLS)
tls.name: tls
tls.description: The Transport Layer Security (TLS) object describes the negotiated TLS protocol used for secure communications over an establish network connection.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The TLS protocol version.

alert.caption: Client TLS Alert
alert.description: The integer value of TLS alert if present. The alerts are defined in the TLS specification in RFC-2246.

key_length.caption: Key Length
key_length.description: The length of the encryption key.

certificate.caption: Certificate
certificate.description: The certificate object containing information about the digital certificate.

sni.caption: Server Name Indication
sni.description: The Server Name Indication (SNI) extension sent by the client.

certificate_chain.caption: Certificate Chain
certificate_chain.description: The Chain of Certificate Serial Numbers field provides a chain of Certificate Issuer Serial Numbers leading to the Root Certificate Issuer.

client_ciphers.caption: Client Cipher Suites
client_ciphers.description: The client cipher suites that were exchanged during the TLS handshake negotiation.

handshake_dur.caption: Handshake Duration
handshake_dur.description: The amount of total time for the TLS handshake to complete after the TCP connection is established, including client-side delays, in milliseconds.

ja3_hash.caption: JA3 Hash
ja3_hash.description: The MD5 hash of a JA3 string.

ja3s_hash.caption: JA3S Hash
ja3s_hash.description: The MD5 hash of a JA3S string.

sans.caption: Subject Alternative Names
sans.description: The list of subject alternative names that are secured by a specific certificate.

server_ciphers.caption: Server Cipher Suites
server_ciphers.description: The server cipher suites that were exchanged during the TLS handshake negotiation.

resource_details.caption: Resource Details
resource_details.name: resource_details
resource_details.description: The Resource Details object describes details about resources that were affected by the activity/event.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the resource.

owner.caption: Owner
owner.description: The identity of the service or user account that owns the resource.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The resource type as defined by the event source.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The version of the resource. For example 1.2.3.

ip.caption: IP Address
ip.description: The IP address of the resource, in either IPv4 or IPv6 format.

group.caption: Group
group.description: The name of the related resource group.

hostname.caption: Hostname
hostname.description: The fully qualified name of the resource.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the resource.

labels.caption: Labels
labels.description: The list of labels associated to the resource.

namespace.caption: Namespace
namespace.description: The namespace is useful when similar entities exist that you need to keep separate.

tags.caption: Tags
tags.description: The list of tags; {key:value} pairs associated to the resource.

agent_list.caption: Agent List
agent_list.description: A list of agent objects associated with a device, endpoint, or resource.

cloud_partition.caption: Cloud Partition
cloud_partition.description: The canonical cloud partition name to which the region is assigned (e.g. AWS Partitions: aws, aws-cn, aws-us-gov).

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the resource was created.

criticality.caption: Criticality
criticality.description: The criticality of the resource as defined by the event source.

data_classification.caption: Data Classification
data_classification.description: The Data Classification object includes information about data classification levels and data category types.

data_classifications.caption: Data Classification
data_classifications.description: A list of Data Classification objects, that include information about data classification levels and data category types, indentified by a classifier.

is_backed_up.caption: Back Ups Configured
is_backed_up.description: Indicates whether the device or resource has a backup enabled, such as an automated snapshot or a cloud backup. For example, this is indicated by the cloudBackupEnabled value within JAMF Pro mobile devices or the registration of an AWS ARN with the AWS Backup service.

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The time when the resource was last modified.

region.caption: Region
region.description: The cloud region of the resource.

resource_relationship.caption: Resource Relationship
resource_relationship.description: A graph representation showing how this resource relates to and interacts with other entities in the environment. This can include parent/child relationships, dependencies, or other connections.

uid_alt.caption: Alternate ID
uid_alt.description: The alternative unique identifier of the resource.

zone.caption: Cloud Availability Zone
zone.description: The specific availability zone within a cloud region where the resource is located.

modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time
modified_time_dt.description: The time when the resource was last modified.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The time when the resource was created.

cve.caption: CVE
cve.name: cve
cve.description: The Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) object represents publicly disclosed cybersecurity vulnerabilities defined in CVE Program catalog (CVE). There is one CVE Record for each vulnerability in the catalog.

type.caption: Vulnerability Type
type.description:
The vulnerability type as selected from a large dropdown menu during CVE refinement.

Most frequently used vulnerability types are: DoS, Code Execution, Overflow, Memory Corruption, Sql Injection, XSS, Directory Traversal, Http Response Splitting, Bypass something, Gain Information, Gain Privileges, CSRF, File Inclusion. For more information see Vulnerabilities By Type distributions.

title.caption: Title
title.description: A title or a brief phrase summarizing the CVE record.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: A brief description of the CVE Record.

product.caption: Product
product.description: The product where the vulnerability was discovered.

uid.caption: CVE ID
uid.description: The Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures unique number assigned to a specific computer vulnerability. A CVE Identifier begins with 4 digits representing the year followed by a sequence of digits that acts as a unique identifier. For example: CVE-2021-12345.

references.caption: References
references.description: A list of reference URLs with additional information about the CVE Record.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The Record Creation Date identifies when the CVE ID was issued to a CVE Numbering Authority (CNA) or the CVE Record was published on the CVE List. Note that the Record Creation Date does not necessarily indicate when this vulnerability was discovered, shared with the affected vendor, publicly disclosed, or updated in CVE.

cvss.caption: CVSS Score
cvss.description: The CVSS object details Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) scores from the advisory that are related to the vulnerability.

cwe.caption: CWE
cwe.description: The CWE object represents a weakness in a software system that can be exploited by a threat actor to perform an attack. The CWE object is based on the Common Weakness Enumeration (CWE) catalog.

cwe_uid.caption: CWE UID
cwe_uid.description: The Common Weakness Enumeration (CWE) unique identifier. For example: CWE-787.

cwe_url.caption: CWE URL
cwe_url.description: Common Weakness Enumeration (CWE) definition URL. For example: https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/787.html.

epss.caption: EPSS
epss.description: The Exploit Prediction Scoring System (EPSS) object describes the estimated probability a vulnerability will be exploited. EPSS is a community-driven effort to combine descriptive information about vulnerabilities (CVEs) with evidence of actual exploitation in-the-wild. (EPSS).

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The Record Modified Date identifies when the CVE record was last updated.

related_cwes.caption: Related CWEs
related_cwes.description: Describes the Common Weakness Enumeration (CWE) details related to the CVE Record.

modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time
modified_time_dt.description: The Record Modified Date identifies when the CVE record was last updated.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The Record Creation Date identifies when the CVE ID was issued to a CVE Numbering Authority (CNA) or the CVE Record was published on the CVE List. Note that the Record Creation Date does not necessarily indicate when this vulnerability was discovered, shared with the affected vendor, publicly disclosed, or updated in CVE.

policy.caption: Policy
policy.name: policy
policy.description:
The Policy object describes the policies that are applicable.

Policy attributes provide traceability to the operational state of the security product at the time that the event was captured, facilitating forensics, troubleshooting, and policy tuning/adjustments.

data.caption: Data
data.description: Additional data about the policy such as the underlying JSON policy itself or other details.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The policy name. For example: IAM Policy.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The policy version number.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the policy.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: A unique identifier of the policy instance.

is_applied.caption: Applied
is_applied.description: A determination if the content of a policy was applied to a target or request, or not.

rpc_interface.caption: RPC Interface
rpc_interface.name: rpc_interface
rpc_interface.description: The RPC Interface represents the remote procedure call interface used in the DCE/RPC session.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The version of the DCE/RPC protocol being used in the session.

uuid.caption: UUID
uuid.description: The unique identifier of the particular remote procedure or service.

ack_reason.caption: Acknowledgement Reason
ack_reason.description: An integer that provides a reason code or additional information about the acknowledgment result.

ack_result.caption: Acknowledgement Result
ack_result.description: An integer that denotes the acknowledgment result of the DCE/RPC call.

anomaly.caption: Anomaly
anomaly.name: anomaly
anomaly.description: Describes an anomaly or deviation detected in a system. Anomalies are unexpected activity patterns that could indicate potential issues needing attention.

observation_parameter.caption: Observation Parameter
observation_parameter.description: The specific parameter, metric or property where the anomaly was observed. Examples include: CPU usage percentage, API response time in milliseconds, HTTP error rate, memory utilization, network latency, transaction volume, etc. This helps identify the exact aspect of the system exhibiting anomalous behavior.

observations.caption: Observations
observations.description: Details about the observed anomaly or observations that were flagged as anomalous compared to expected baseline behavior.

observation_type.caption: Observation Type
observation_type.description: The type of analysis methodology used to detect the anomaly. This indicates how the anomaly was identified through different analytical approaches. Common types include: Frequency Analysis, Time Pattern Analysis, Volume Analysis, Sequence Analysis, Distribution Analysis, etc.

observed_pattern.caption: Observed Pattern
observed_pattern.description: The specific pattern identified within the observation type. For Frequency Analysis, this could be 'FREQUENT', 'INFREQUENT', 'RARE', or 'UNSEEN'. For Time Pattern Analysis, this could be 'BUSINESS_HOURS', 'OFF_HOURS', or 'UNUSUAL_TIME'. For Volume Analysis, this could be 'NORMAL_VOLUME', 'HIGH_VOLUME', or 'SURGE'. The pattern values are specific to each observation type and indicate how the observed behavior relates to the baseline.

group.caption: Group
group.name: group
group.description: The Group object represents a collection or association of entities, such as users, policies, or devices. It serves as a logical grouping mechanism to organize and manage entities with similar characteristics or permissions within a system or organization, including but not limited to purposes of access control.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The group name.

type.caption: Account Type
type.description: The type of the group or account.

domain.caption: Domain
domain.description: The domain where the group is defined. For example: the LDAP or Active Directory domain.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The group description.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the group. For example, for Windows events this is the security identifier (SID) of the group.

account.caption: Account
account.name: account
account.description: The Account object contains details about the account that initiated or performed a specific activity within a system or application. Additionally, the Account object refers to logical Cloud and Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) based containers such as AWS Accounts, Azure Subscriptions, Oracle Cloud Compartments, Google Cloud Projects, and otherwise.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the account (e.g. GCP Project name , Linux Account name or AWS Account name).

type.caption: Type
type.description: The account type, normalized to the caption of 'account_type_id'. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the account (e.g. AWS Account ID , OCID , GCP Project ID , Azure Subscription ID , Google Workspace Customer ID , or M365 Tenant UID).

labels.caption: Labels
labels.description: The list of labels associated to the account.

tags.caption: Tags
tags.description: The list of tags; {key:value} pairs associated to the account.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The account type is not mapped.

cis_benchmark.caption: CIS Benchmark
cis_benchmark.name: cis_benchmark
cis_benchmark.description: The CIS Benchmark object describes best practices for securely configuring IT systems, software, networks, and cloud infrastructure as defined by the Center for Internet Security. See also Getting to Know the CIS Benchmarks.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The CIS Benchmark name. For example: Ensure mounting of cramfs filesystems is disabled.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The CIS Benchmark description. For example: The cramfs filesystem type is a compressed read-only Linux filesystem embedded in small footprint systems. A cramfs image can be used without having to first decompress the image.

cis_controls.caption: CIS Controls
cis_controls.description: The CIS Critical Security Controls is a prioritized set of actions to protect your organization and data from cyber-attack vectors.

@deprecated.message: Use the Compliance object with Checks object instead.

metadata.caption: Metadata
metadata.name: metadata
metadata.description: The Metadata object describes the metadata associated with the event.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The version of the OCSF schema, using Semantic Versioning Specification (SemVer). For example: 1.0.0. Event consumers use the version to determine the available event attributes.

debug.caption: Debug Information
debug.description: Debug information about non-fatal issues with this OCSF event. Each issue is a line in this string array.

extension.caption: Schema Extension
extension.description: The schema extension used to create the event.

product.caption: Product
product.description: The product that reported the event.

uid.caption: Event UID
uid.description: The logging system-assigned unique identifier of an event instance.

extensions.caption: Schema Extensions
extensions.description: The schema extensions used to create the event.

labels.caption: Labels
labels.description: The list of labels attached to the event. For example: ["sample", "dev"]

log_level.caption: Log Level
log_level.description: The audit level at which an event was generated.

sequence.caption: Sequence Number
sequence.description: Sequence number of the event. The sequence number is a value available in some events, to make the exact ordering of events unambiguous, regardless of the event time precision.

tags.caption: Tags
tags.description: The list of tags; {key:value} pairs associated to the event.

profiles.caption: Profiles
profiles.description: The list of profiles used to create the event. Profiles should be referenced by their name attribute for core profiles, or extension/name for profiles from extensions.

correlation_uid.caption: Correlation UID
correlation_uid.description: The unique identifier used to correlate events.

data_classification.caption: Data Classification
data_classification.description: The Data Classification object includes information about data classification levels and data category types.

data_classifications.caption: Data Classification
data_classifications.description: A list of Data Classification objects, that include information about data classification levels and data category types, indentified by a classifier.

event_code.caption: Event Code
event_code.description: The Event ID, Code, or Name that the product uses to primarily identify the event.

log_name.caption: Log Name
log_name.description: The event log name. For example, syslog file name or Windows logging subsystem: Security.

log_provider.caption: Log Provider
log_provider.description: The logging provider or logging service that logged the event. For example, Microsoft-Windows-Security-Auditing.

log_version.caption: Log Version
log_version.description: The event log schema version that specifies the format of the original event. For example syslog version or Cisco Log Schema Version.

logged_time.caption: Logged Time
logged_time.description:
The time when the logging system collected and logged the event.

This attribute is distinct from the event time in that event time typically contain the time extracted from the original event. Most of the time, these two times will be different.

loggers.caption: Loggers
loggers.description: An array of Logger objects that describe the devices and logging products between the event source and its eventual destination. Note, this attribute can be used when there is a complex end-to-end path of event flow.

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The time when the event was last modified or enriched.

original_time.caption: Original Time
original_time.description: The original event time as reported by the event source. For example, the time in the original format from system event log such as Syslog on Unix/Linux and the System event file on Windows. Omit if event is generated instead of collected via logs.

processed_time.caption: Processed Time
processed_time.description: The event processed time, such as an ETL operation.

transformation_info_list.caption: Transformation Info
transformation_info_list.description: An array of transformation info that describes the mappings or transforms applied to the data.

modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time
modified_time_dt.description: The time when the event was last modified or enriched.

logged_time_dt.caption: Logged Time
logged_time_dt.description:
The time when the logging system collected and logged the event.

This attribute is distinct from the event time in that event time typically contain the time extracted from the original event. Most of the time, these two times will be different.

processed_time_dt.caption: Processed Time
processed_time_dt.description: The event processed time, such as an ETL operation.

ticket.caption: Ticket
ticket.name: ticket
ticket.description: The Ticket object represents ticket in the customer's IT Service Management (ITSM) systems like ServiceNow, Jira, etc.

status.caption: Ticket Status
status.description: The status of the ticket normalized to the caption of the status_id value. In the case of 99, this value should as defined by the source.

type.caption: Ticket Type
type.description: The linked ticket type determines whether the ticket is internal or in an external ticketing system.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: Unique identifier of the ticket.

type_id.caption: Ticket Type ID
type_id.description: The normalized identifier for the ticket type.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

src_url.caption: Source URL
src_url.description: The url of a ticket in the ticket system.

status_details.caption: Status Details
status_details.description: A list of contextual descriptions of the status, status_id values.

status_id.caption: Ticket Status ID
status_id.description: The normalized identifier for the ticket status.

3.caption: Notified
3.description: Relevant parties have been notified about the ticket.

6.caption: Closed
6.description: The ticket has been completed and closed.

1.caption: New
1.description: The ticket is new and yet to be reviewed.

2.caption: In Progress
2.description: The ticket is actively being worked on.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event status is not mapped. See the status attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

4.caption: On Hold
4.description: Work on the ticket is temporarily suspended.

5.caption: Resolved
5.description: The ticket is resolved and a solution is implemented, pending confirmation or verification from the requestor.

7.caption: Canceled
7.description: The ticket has been canceled and will not be processed.

8.caption: Reopened
8.description: The ticket was previously closed, but has been reopened.

win/win_service.caption: Windows Service
win/win_service.name: win_service
win/win_service.description: The Windows Service object describes a Windows service.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The unique name of the service.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The version of the service.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the service.

labels.caption: Labels
labels.description: The list of labels associated with the service.

tags.caption: Tags
tags.description: The list of tags; {key:value} pairs associated to the service.

cmd_line.caption: Command Line
cmd_line.description: The full command line used to launch the service.

load_order_group.caption: Load Order Group
load_order_group.description: The name of the load ordering group of which this service is a member.

service_category.caption: Service Category
service_category.description: The service category, normalized to the caption of the service_category_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

service_category_id.caption: Service Category ID
service_category_id.description: The normalized identifier of the service category.

1.caption: Kernel Mode
1.description: A kernel mode driver.

2.caption: User Mode
2.description: A user mode service.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The service category is not mapped. See the service_category attribute, which contains an event source specific value.

service_dependencies.caption: Service Dependencies
service_dependencies.description: The names of other services upon which this service has a dependency.

service_error_control.caption: Service Error Control
service_error_control.description: The service error control, normalized to the caption of the service_error_control_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

service_error_control_id.caption: Service Error Control ID
service_error_control_id.description: The normalized identifier of the service error control.

3.caption: Severe
3.description: The startup program logs the error in the event log. If the last-known-good configuration is being started, the startup operation continues. Otherwise, the system is restarted with the last-known-good configuration.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The service error control is unknown.

1.caption: Ignore
1.description: The startup program ignores the error and continues the startup operation.

2.caption: Normal
2.description: The startup program logs the error in the event log but continues the startup operation.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The service error control is not mapped. See the service_error_control attribute, which contains an event source specific value.

4.caption: Critical
4.description: The startup program logs the error in the event log, if possible. If the last-known-good configuration is being started, the startup operation fails. Otherwise, the system is restarted with the last-known good configuration.

service_start_name.caption: Service Start Name
service_start_name.description: For a user mode service, this attribute represents the name of the account under which the service is run. For a kernel mode driver, this attribute represents the object name used to load the driver.

service_start_type.caption: Service Start Type
service_start_type.description: The service start type, normalized to the caption of the service_start_type_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

service_start_type_id.caption: Service Start Type ID
service_start_type_id.description: The normalized identifier of the service start type.

3.caption: Auto
3.description: A user mode service started automatically during system startup.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The service start type is unknown.

1.caption: Boot
1.description: A kernel mode driver loaded at boot.

2.caption: System
2.description: A kernel mode driver loaded during system startup.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The service start type is not mapped. See the service_start_type attribute, which contains an event source specific value.

4.caption: Demand
4.description: A user mode service started on demand when a process calls StartService.

5.caption: Disabled
5.description: A driver or service that cannot be started.

service_type.caption: Service Type
service_type.description: The service type, normalized to the caption of the service_type_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

service_type_id.caption: Service Type ID
service_type_id.description: The normalized identifier of the service type.

3.caption: Own Process
3.description: A user mode service that runs in its own process.

1.caption: Kernel Driver
1.description: A kernel mode driver.

2.caption: File System Driver
2.description: A kernel mode file system minifilter.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The service type is not mapped. See the service_type attribute, which contains an event source specific value.

4.caption: Share Process
4.description: A user mode service that shares a process with other services.

security_state.caption: Security State
security_state.name: security_state
security_state.description: The Security State object describes the security related state of a managed entity.

state.caption: Security State
state.description: The security state, normalized to the caption of the state_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source.

state_id.caption: Security State ID
state_id.description: The security state of the managed entity.

3.caption: In network quarantine
3.description: Isolated from the network.

6.caption: Protection not licensed
6.description: The security solution does not have a valid license.

1.caption: Missing or outdated content
1.description: The content is missing or outdated.

2.caption: Policy mismatch
2.description: Not in compliance with the expected security policy.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The security state is not mapped. See the state attribute, which contains data source specific values.

4.caption: Protection off
4.description: Not protected by a security solution.

5.caption: Protection malfunction
5.description: The security solution is not functioning properly.

7.caption: Unremediated threat
7.description: A detected threat has not been remediated.

8.caption: Suspicious reputation
8.description: Reputation of the entity is suspicious.

9.caption: Reboot pending
9.description: A reboot is required for one or more pending actions.

10.caption: Content is locked
10.description: The content is locked to a specific version.

11.caption: Not installed
11.description: The entity is not installed.

12.caption: Writable system partition
12.description: The system partition is writeable.

14.caption: Failed boot verify
14.description: The device has failed the boot verification process.

15.caption: Modified execution environment
15.description: The execution environment has been modified.

16.caption: SELinux disabled
16.description: The SELinux security feature has been disabled.

17.caption: Elevated privilege shell
17.description: An elevated privilege shell has been detected.

18.caption: iOS file system altered
18.description: The file system has been altered on an iOS device.

20.caption: OTA updates disabled
20.description: Mobile OTA (Over The Air) updates have been disabled.

21.caption: Rooted
21.description: The device has been modified to allow root access.

22.caption: Android partition modified
22.description: The Android partition has been modified.

23.caption: Compliance failure
23.description: The entity is not compliant with the associated security policy.

13.caption: SafetyNet failure
13.description: The device has failed the SafetyNet check.

19.caption: Open remote access
19.description: Remote access is enabled.

remediation.caption: Remediation
remediation.name: remediation
remediation.description: The Remediation object describes the recommended remediation steps to address identified issue(s).

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the remediation strategy.

references.caption: References
