references.description: A list of supporting URL/s, references that help describe the remediation strategy.

cis_controls.caption: CIS Controls
cis_controls.description: An array of Center for Internet Security (CIS) Controls that can be optionally mapped to provide additional remediation details.

kb_article_list.caption: Knowledgebase Articles
kb_article_list.description: A list of KB articles or patches related to an endpoint. A KB Article contains metadata that describes the patch or an update.

kb_articles.caption: Knowledgebase Articles
kb_articles.description: The KB article/s related to the entity. A KB Article contains metadata that describes the patch or an update.

application.caption: Application
application.name: application
application.description: An Application describes the details for an inventoried application as reported by an Application Security tool or other Developer-centric tooling. Applications can be defined as Kubernetes resources, Containerized resources, or application hosting-specific cloud sources such as AWS Elastic BeanStalk, AWS Lightsail, or Azure Logic Apps.

name.caption: Application Name
name.description: The name of the application.

owner.caption: Owner
owner.description: The identity of the service or user account that owns the application.

type.caption: Application Type
type.description: The type of application as defined by the event source, e.g., GitHub, Azure Logic App, or Amazon Elastic BeanStalk.

version.caption: Application Version
version.description: The semantic version of the application, e.g., 1.7.4.

group.caption: Group
group.description: The name of the related application or associated resource group.

desc.caption: Application Description
desc.description: A description or commentary for an application, usually retrieved from an upstream system.

hostname.caption: Hostname
hostname.description: The fully qualified name of the application.

uid.caption: Application ID
uid.description: The unique identifier for the application.

labels.caption: Labels
labels.description: The list of labels associated to the application.

tags.caption: Tags
tags.description: The list of tags; {key:value} pairs associated to the application.

criticality.caption: Business Criticality
criticality.description: The criticality of the application as defined by the event source.

region.caption: Region
region.description: The cloud region of the resource.

resource_relationship.caption: Application Relationship
resource_relationship.description: A graph representation showing how this application relates to and interacts with other entities in the environment. This can include parent/child relationships, dependencies, or other connections.

risk_level.caption: Risk Level
risk_level.description: The risk level, normalized to the caption of the risk_level_id value.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The risk level is not mapped. See the risk_level attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

risk_score.caption: Risk Score
risk_score.description: The risk score as reported by the event source.

sbom.caption: Related SBOM
sbom.description: The Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) associated with the application

uid_alt.caption: Application Alternative ID
uid_alt.description: An alternative or contextual identifier for the application, such as a configuration, organization, or license UID.

sub_technique.caption: MITRE Sub-technique
sub_technique.name: sub_technique
sub_technique.description: The MITRE Sub-technique object describes the ATT&CK® or ATLAS™ Sub-technique ID and/or name associated to an attack.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the attack sub-technique. For example: Scanning IP Blocks or User Execution: Unsafe ML Artifacts.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the attack sub-technique. For example: T1595.001 or AML.T0011.000.

src_url.caption: Source URL
src_url.description: The versioned permalink of the attack sub-technique. For example: https://attack.mitre.org/versions/v14/techniques/T1595/001/.

sso.caption: SSO
sso.name: sso
sso.description: The Single Sign-On (SSO) object provides a structure for normalizing SSO attributes, configuration, and/or settings from Identity Providers.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the SSO resource.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: A unique identifier for a SSO resource.

protocol_name.caption: Supported Protocol
protocol_name.description: The supported protocol for the SSO resource. E.g., SAML or OIDC.

certificate.caption: SAML Certificate
certificate.description: Digital Signature associated with the SSO resource, e.g., SAML X.509 certificate details.

idle_timeout.caption: SSO Idle Timeout
idle_timeout.description: Duration (in minutes) of allowed inactivity before Single Sign-On (SSO) session expiration.

auth_protocol.caption: Auth Protocol
auth_protocol.description: The authorization protocol as defined by the caption of auth_protocol_id. In the case of Other, it is defined by the event source.

auth_protocol_id.caption: Auth Protocol ID
auth_protocol_id.description: The normalized identifier of the authentication protocol used by the SSO resource.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The authentication protocol is not mapped. See the auth_protocol attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: When the SSO resource was created.

duration_mins.caption: SSO Session Duration
duration_mins.description: The duration (in minutes) for an SSO session, after which re-authentication is required.

login_endpoint.caption: SSO Login Endpoint
login_endpoint.description: URL for initiating an SSO login request.

logout_endpoint.caption: SSO Logout Endpoint
logout_endpoint.description: URL for initiating an SSO logout request, allowing sessions to be terminated across applications.

metadata_endpoint.caption: SSO Metadata Endpoint
metadata_endpoint.description: URL where metadata about the SSO configuration is available (e.g., for SAML configurations).

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The most recent time when the SSO resource was updated.

scopes.caption: Scopes
scopes.description: Scopes define the specific permissions or actions that the client is allowed to perform on behalf of the user. Each scope represents a different set of permissions, and the user can selectively grant or deny access to specific scopes during the authorization process.

vendor_name.caption: Service Provider
vendor_name.description: Name of the vendor or service provider implementing SSO. E.g., Okta, Auth0, Microsoft.

modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time
modified_time_dt.description: The most recent time when the SSO resource was updated.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: When the SSO resource was created.

feature.caption: Feature
feature.name: feature
feature.description: The Feature object provides information about the software product feature that generated a specific event. It encompasses details related to the capabilities, components, user interface (UI) design, and performance upgrades associated with the feature.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the feature.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The version of the feature.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the feature.

domain_contact.caption: Domain Contact
domain_contact.name: domain_contact
domain_contact.description: The contact information related to a domain registration, e.g., registrant, administrator, abuse, billing, or technical contact.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The individual or organization name for the contact.

type.caption: Domain Contact Type
type.description: The Domain Contact type, normalized to the caption of the type_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source

location.caption: Contact Location Information
location.description: Location details for the contract such as the city, state/province, country, etc.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the contact information, typically provided in WHOIS information.

type_id.caption: Domain Contact Type ID
type_id.description: The normalized domain contact type ID.

3.caption: Technical
3.description: The contact information provided is for the domain technical lead.

1.caption: Registrant
1.description: The contact information provided is for the domain registrant.

2.caption: Administrative
2.description: The contact information provided is for the domain administrator.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

4.caption: Billing
4.description: The contact information provided is for the domain billing lead.

5.caption: Abuse
5.description: The contact information provided is for the domain abuse contact.

phone_number.caption: Phone Number
phone_number.description: The number associated with the phone.

network_connection_info.caption: Network Connection Information
network_connection_info.name: network_connection_info
network_connection_info.description: The Network Connection Information object describes characteristics of an OSI Transport Layer communication, including TCP and UDP.

session.caption: Session
session.description: The authenticated user or service session.

uid.caption: Connection UID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the connection.

boundary.caption: Boundary
boundary.description:
The boundary of the connection, normalized to the caption of 'boundary_id'. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

For cloud connections, this translates to the traffic-boundary(same VPC, through IGW, etc.). For traditional networks, this is described as Local, Internal, or External.

protocol_name.caption: Protocol Name
protocol_name.description: The IP protocol name in lowercase, as defined by the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA). For example: tcp or udp.

direction.caption: Direction
direction.description: The direction of the initiated connection, traffic, or email, normalized to the caption of the direction_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

boundary_id.caption: Boundary ID
boundary_id.description:
The normalized identifier of the boundary of the connection.

For cloud connections, this translates to the traffic-boundary (same VPC, through IGW, etc.). For traditional networks, this is described as Local, Internal, or External.

3.caption: External
3.description: External network traffic between two endpoints on the Internet or outside the network.

6.caption: Virtual Private Gateway
6.description: Through a virtual private gateway

1.caption: Localhost
1.description: Local network traffic on the same endpoint.

2.caption: Internal
2.description: Internal network traffic between two endpoints inside network.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The boundary is not mapped. See the boundary attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

4.caption: Same VPC
4.description: Through another resource in the same VPC

5.caption: Internet/VPC Gateway
5.description: Through an Internet gateway or a gateway VPC endpoint

7.caption: Intra-region VPC
7.description: Through an intra-region VPC peering connection

8.caption: Inter-region VPC
8.description: Through an inter-region VPC peering connection

9.caption: Local Gateway
9.description: Through a local gateway

10.caption: Gateway VPC
10.description: Through a gateway VPC endpoint (Nitro-based instances only)

11.caption: Internet Gateway
11.description: Through an Internet gateway (Nitro-based instances only)

community_uid.caption: Community ID
community_uid.description: The Community ID of the network connection.

direction_id.caption: Direction ID
direction_id.description: The normalized identifier of the direction of the initiated connection, traffic, or email.

3.caption: Lateral
3.description: Lateral network connection. The connection was originated from inside the network, destined for services on the inside network.

1.caption: Inbound
1.description: Inbound network connection. The connection was originated from the Internet or outside network, destined for services on the inside network.

2.caption: Outbound
2.description: Outbound network connection. The connection was originated from inside the network, destined for services on the Internet or outside network.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The direction is not mapped. See the direction attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

flag_history.caption: Connection Flag History
flag_history.description: The Connection Flag History summarizes events in a network connection. For example flags ShAD representing SYN, SYN/ACK, ACK and Data exchange.

protocol_num.caption: Protocol Number
protocol_num.description: The IP protocol number, as defined by the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA). For example: 6 for TCP and 17 for UDP.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The protocol version is not mapped. See the protocol_ver attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

tcp_flags.caption: TCP Flags
tcp_flags.description: The network connection TCP header flags (i.e., control bits).

network_proxy.caption: Network Proxy Endpoint
network_proxy.name: network_proxy
network_proxy.description: The network proxy endpoint object describes a proxy server, which acts as an intermediary between a client requesting a resource and the server providing that resource.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The short name of the endpoint.

owner.caption: Owner
owner.description: The identity of the service or user account that owns the endpoint or was last logged into it.

port.caption: Port
port.description: The port used for communication within the network connection.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The network endpoint type. For example: unknown, server, desktop, laptop, tablet, mobile, virtual, browser, or other.

domain.caption: Domain
domain.description: The name of the domain that the endpoint belongs to or that corresponds to the endpoint.

ip.caption: IP Address
ip.description: The IP address of the endpoint, in either IPv4 or IPv6 format.

location.caption: Geo Location
location.description: The geographical location of the endpoint.

hostname.caption: Hostname
hostname.description: The fully qualified name of the endpoint.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the endpoint.

mac.caption: MAC Address
mac.description: The Media Access Control (MAC) address of the endpoint.

3.caption: Laptop
3.description: A laptop computer.

6.caption: Virtual
6.description: A virtual machine.

1.caption: Server
1.description: A server.

2.caption: Desktop
2.description: A desktop computer.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

4.caption: Tablet
4.description: A tablet computer.

5.caption: Mobile
5.description: A mobile phone.

7.caption: IOT
7.description: An IOT (Internet of Things) device.

8.caption: Browser
8.description: A web browser.

9.caption: Firewall
9.description: A networking firewall.

10.caption: Switch
10.description: A networking switch.

11.caption: Hub
11.description: A networking hub.

12.caption: Router
12.description: A networking router.

14.caption: IPS
14.description: An intrusion prevention system.

15.caption: Load Balancer
15.description: A Load Balancer device.

13.caption: IDS
13.description: An intrusion detection system.

agent_list.caption: Agent List
agent_list.description: A list of agent objects associated with a device, endpoint, or resource.

autonomous_system.caption: Autonomous System
autonomous_system.description: The Autonomous System details associated with an IP address.

container.caption: Container
container.description: The information describing an instance of a container. A container is a prepackaged, portable system image that runs isolated on an existing system using a container runtime like containerd.

instance_uid.caption: Instance ID
instance_uid.description: The unique identifier of a VM instance.

interface_name.caption: Network Interface Name
interface_name.description: The name of the network interface (e.g. eth2).

interface_uid.caption: Network Interface ID
interface_uid.description: The unique identifier of the network interface.

intermediate_ips.caption: Intermediate IP Addresses
intermediate_ips.description: The intermediate IP Addresses. For example, the IP addresses in the HTTP X-Forwarded-For header.

isp.caption: ISP Name
isp.description: The name of the Internet Service Provider (ISP).

isp_org.caption: ISP Org
isp_org.description: The organization name of the Internet Service Provider (ISP). This represents the parent organization or company that owns/operates the ISP. For example, Comcast Corporation would be the ISP org for Xfinity internet service. This attribute helps identify the ultimate provider when ISPs operate under different brand names.

namespace_pid.caption: Namespace PID
namespace_pid.description: If running under a process namespace (such as in a container), the process identifier within that process namespace.

proxy_endpoint.caption: Proxy Endpoint
proxy_endpoint.description: The network proxy information pertaining to a specific endpoint. This can be used to describe information pertaining to network address translation (NAT).

subnet_uid.caption: Subnet UID
subnet_uid.description: The unique identifier of a virtual subnet.

svc_name.caption: Service Name
svc_name.description: The service name in service-to-service connections. For example, AWS VPC logs the pkt-src-aws-service and pkt-dst-aws-service fields identify the connection is coming from or going to an AWS service.

vpc_uid.caption: VPC UID
vpc_uid.description: The unique identifier of the Virtual Private Cloud (VPC).

zone.caption: Network Zone
zone.description: The network zone or LAN segment.

user.caption: User
user.name: user
user.description: The User object describes the characteristics of a user/person or a security principal.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The username. For example, janedoe1.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The type of the user. For example, System, AWS IAM User, etc.

domain.caption: Domain
domain.description: The domain where the user is defined. For example: the LDAP or Active Directory domain.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique user identifier. For example, the Windows user SID, ActiveDirectory DN or AWS user ARN.

org.caption: Organization
org.description: Organization and org unit related to the user.

groups.caption: Groups
groups.description: The administrative groups to which the user belongs.

full_name.caption: Full Name
full_name.description: The full name of the user, as reported by the product.

3.caption: System
3.description: System account. For example, Windows computer accounts with a trailing dollar sign ($).

1.caption: User
1.description: Regular user account.

2.caption: Admin
2.description: Admin/root user account.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

account.caption: Account
account.description: The user's account or the account associated with the user.

credential_uid.caption: User Credential ID
credential_uid.description: The unique identifier of the user's credential. For example, AWS Access Key ID.

display_name.caption: Display Name
display_name.description: The display name of the user, as reported by the product.

has_mfa.caption: MFA Assigned
has_mfa.description: The user has a multi-factor or secondary-factor device assigned.

ldap_person.caption: LDAP Person
ldap_person.description: The additional LDAP attributes that describe a person.

phone_number.caption: Telephone Number
phone_number.description: The telephone number of the user.

risk_level.caption: Risk Level
risk_level.description: The risk level, normalized to the caption of the risk_level_id value.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The risk level is not mapped. See the risk_level attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

risk_score.caption: Risk Score
risk_score.description: The risk score as reported by the event source.

uid_alt.caption: Alternate ID
uid_alt.description: The alternate user identifier. For example, the Active Directory user GUID or AWS user Principal ID.

kill_chain_phase.caption: Kill Chain Phase
kill_chain_phase.name: kill_chain_phase
kill_chain_phase.description: The Kill Chain Phase object represents a single phase of a cyber attack, including the initial reconnaissance and planning stages up to the final objective of the attacker. It provides a detailed description of each phase and its associated activities within the broader context of a cyber attack. See Cyber Kill Chain®.

phase_id.caption: Kill Chain Phase ID
phase_id.description: The cyber kill chain phase identifier.

3.caption: Delivery
3.description: The intruders will use various tactics, such as phishing, infected USB drives, etc.

6.caption: Command & Control
6.description: Malware opens a command channel to enable the intruders to remotely manipulate the victim's system.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The kill chain phase is unknown.

1.caption: Reconnaissance
1.description: The attackers pick a target and perform a detailed analysis, start collecting information (email addresses, conferences information, etc.) and evaluate the victim’s vulnerabilities to determine how to exploit them.

2.caption: Weaponization
2.description: The attackers develop a malware weapon and aim to exploit the discovered vulnerabilities.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The kill chain phase is not mapped. See the phase attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

4.caption: Exploitation
4.description: The intruders start leveraging vulnerabilities to executed code on the victim’s system.

5.caption: Installation
5.description: The intruders install malware on the victim’s system.

7.caption: Actions on Objectives
7.description: With hands-on keyboard access, intruders accomplish the mission’s goal.

http_cookie.caption: HTTP Cookie
http_cookie.name: http_cookie
http_cookie.description: The HTTP Cookie object, also known as a web cookie or browser cookie, contains details and values pertaining to a small piece of data that a server sends to a user's web browser. This data is then stored by the browser and sent back to the server with subsequent requests, allowing the server to remember and track certain information about the user's browsing session or preferences.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The HTTP cookie name.

path.caption: Path
path.description: The path of the HTTP cookie.

domain.caption: Domain
domain.description: The domain name for the server from which the http_cookie is served.

secure.caption: Secure
secure.description: The cookie attribute to only send cookies to the server with an encrypted request over the HTTPS protocol.

http_only.caption: HTTP Only
http_only.description: A cookie attribute to make it inaccessible via JavaScript

expiration_time.caption: Expiration Time
expiration_time.description: The expiration time of the HTTP cookie.

is_http_only.caption: HTTP Only
is_http_only.description: This attribute prevents the cookie from being accessed via JavaScript.

is_secure.caption: Secure
is_secure.description: The cookie attribute indicates that cookies are sent to the server only when the request is encrypted using the HTTPS protocol.

samesite.caption: SameSite
samesite.description: The cookie attribute that lets servers specify whether/when cookies are sent with cross-site requests. Values are: Strict, Lax or None

expiration_time_dt.caption: Expiration Time
expiration_time_dt.description: The expiration time of the HTTP cookie.

vendor_attributes.caption: Vendor Attributes
vendor_attributes.name: vendor_attributes
vendor_attributes.description:
The Vendor Attributes object can be used to represent values of attributes populated by the Vendor/Finding Provider. It can help distinguish between the vendor-prodvided values and consumer-updated values, of key attributes like severity_id.
The original finding producer should not populate this object. It should be populated by consuming systems that support data mutability.

severity.caption: Severity
severity.description: The finding severity, as reported by the Vendor (Finding Provider). The value should be normalized to the caption of the severity_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source.

severity_id.caption: Severity ID
severity_id.description: The finding severity ID, as reported by the Vendor (Finding Provider).

3.caption: Medium
3.description: Action is required but the situation is not serious at this time.

6.caption: Fatal
6.description: An error occurred but it is too late to take remedial action.

1.caption: Informational
1.description: Informational message. No action required.

2.caption: Low
2.description: The user decides if action is needed.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event/finding severity is not mapped. See the severity attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

4.caption: High
4.description: Action is required immediately.

5.caption: Critical
5.description: Action is required immediately and the scope is broad.

device_hw_info.caption: Device Hardware Info
device_hw_info.name: device_hw_info
device_hw_info.description: The Device Hardware Information object contains details and specifications of the physical components that make up a device. This information provides an overview of the hardware capabilities, configuration, and characteristics of the device.

uuid.caption: UUID
uuid.description: The device manufacturer assigned universally unique hardware identifier. For SMBIOS compatible devices such as those running Linux and Windows, it is the UUID member of the System Information structure in the SMBIOS information. For macOS devices, it is the Hardware UUID (also known as IOPlatformUUID in the I/O Registry).

bios_ver.caption: BIOS Version
bios_ver.description: The BIOS version. For example: LENOVO G5ETA2WW (2.62).

chassis.caption: Chassis
chassis.description: The chassis type describes the system enclosure or physical form factor. Such as the following examples for Windows Windows Chassis Types

cpu_architecture.caption: CPU Architecture
cpu_architecture.description: The CPU architecture, normalized to the caption of the cpu_architecture_id value. In the case of Other, it is defined by the source.

cpu_architecture_id.caption: CPU Architecture ID
cpu_architecture_id.description: The normalized identifier of the CPU architecture.

3.caption: RISC-V
3.description: CPU uses the RISC-V ISA. For bitness, refer to cpu_bits.

1.caption: x86
1.description: CPU uses the x86 ISA. For bitness, refer to cpu_bits.

2.caption: ARM
2.description: CPU uses the ARM ISA. For bitness, refer to cpu_bits.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The CPU architecture is not mapped. See the cpu_architecture attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

cpu_bits.caption: CPU Bits
cpu_bits.description: The cpu architecture, the number of bits used for addressing in memory. For example: 32 or 64.

cpu_cores.caption: CPU Cores
cpu_cores.description: The number of processor cores in all installed processors. For Example: 42.

cpu_count.caption: CPU Count
cpu_count.description: The number of physical processors on a system. For example: 1.

cpu_speed.caption: Processor Speed
cpu_speed.description: The speed of the processor in Mhz. For Example: 4200.

cpu_type.caption: Processor Type
cpu_type.description: The processor type. For example: x86 Family 6 Model 37 Stepping 5.

desktop_display.caption: Desktop Display
desktop_display.description: The desktop display affiliated with the event

ram_size.caption: RAM Size
ram_size.description: The total amount of installed RAM, in Megabytes. For example: 2048.

location.caption: Geo Location
location.name: location
location.description: The Geo Location object describes a geographical location, usually associated with an IP address.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the geographical location.

long.caption: Longitude
long.description: The geographical Longitude coordinate represented in Decimal Degrees (DD). For example: -71.057083.

country.caption: Country
country.description:
The ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2 country code.

Note: The two letter country code should be capitalized. For example: US or CA.

coordinates.caption: Coordinates
coordinates.description: A two-element array, containing a longitude/latitude pair. The format conforms with GeoJSON. For example: [-73.983, 40.719].

aerial_height.caption: Aerial Height
aerial_height.description: Expressed as either height above takeoff location or height above ground level (AGL) for a UAS current location. This value is provided in meters and must have a minimum resolution of 1 m. Special Values: Invalid, No Value, or Unknown: -1000 m.

geodetic_altitude.caption: Geodetic Altitude
geodetic_altitude.description: The aircraft distance above or below the ellipsoid as measured along a line that passes through the aircraft and is normal to the surface of the WGS-84 ellipsoid. This value is provided in meters and must have a minimum resolution of 1 m. Special Values: Invalid, No Value, or Unknown: -1000 m.

geodetic_vertical_accuracy.caption: Geodetic Vertical Accuracy
geodetic_vertical_accuracy.description: Provides quality/containment on geodetic altitude. This is based on ADS-B Geodetic Vertical Accuracy (GVA). Measured in meters.

geohash.caption: Geohash
geohash.description:
Geohash of the geo-coordinates (latitude and longitude).

Geohashing is a geocoding system used to encode geographic coordinates in decimal degrees, to a single string.

horizontal_accuracy.caption: Horizontal Accuracy
horizontal_accuracy.description: Provides quality/containment on horizontal position. This is based on ADS-B NACp. Measured in meters.

is_on_premises.caption: On Premises
is_on_premises.description: The indication of whether the location is on premises.

isp.caption: ISP Name
isp.description: The name of the Internet Service Provider (ISP).

@deprecated.message: Utilize isp attribute available in network_endpoint, whois objects according to your use-case.

lat.caption: Latitude
lat.description: The geographical Latitude coordinate represented in Decimal Degrees (DD). For example: 42.361145.

postal_code.caption: Postal Code
postal_code.description: The postal code of the location.

pressure_altitude.caption: Pressure Altitude
pressure_altitude.description: The uncorrected barometric pressure altitude (based on reference standard 29.92 inHg, 1013.25 mb) provides a reference for algorithms that utilize 'altitude deltas' between aircraft. This value is provided in meters and must have a minimum resolution of 1 m.. Special Values: Invalid, No Value, or Unknown: -1000 m.

provider.caption: Provider
provider.description: The provider of the geographical location data.

region.caption: Region
region.description: The alphanumeric code that identifies the principal subdivision (e.g. province or state) of the country. For example, 'CH-VD' for the Canton of Vaud, Switzerland

tls_extension.caption: TLS Extension
tls_extension.name: tls_extension
tls_extension.description: The TLS Extension object describes additional attributes that extend the base Transport Layer Security (TLS) object.

data.caption: Data
data.description: The data contains information specific to the particular extension type.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The TLS extension type. For example: Server Name.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The TLS extension type identifier. See The Transport Layer Security (TLS) extension page.

1.caption: maximum_fragment_length
1.description: The Maximum Fragment Length Negotiation extension.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

5.caption: status_request
5.description: The Certificate Status Request extension.

10.caption: supported_groups
10.description: The Supported Groups extension.

14.caption: use_srtp
14.description: The Use SRTP data protection extension.

15.caption: heartbeat
15.description: The Heartbeat extension.

16.caption: application_layer_protocol_negotiation
16.description: The Application-Layer Protocol Negotiation extension.

18.caption: signed_certificate_timestamp
18.description: The Signed Certificate Timestamp extension.

20.caption: server_certificate_type
20.description: The Server Certificate Type extension.

21.caption: padding
21.description: The Padding extension.

45.caption: psk_key_exchange_modes
45.description: The Pre-Shared Key Exchange Modes extension.

13.caption: signature_algorithms
13.description: The Signature Algorithms extension.

19.caption: client_certificate_type
19.description: The Client Certificate Type extension.

container.caption: Container
container.name: container
container.description: The Container object describes an instance of a specific container. A container is a prepackaged, portable system image that runs isolated on an existing system using a container runtime like containerd.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The container name.

runtime.caption: Runtime
runtime.description: The backend running the container, such as containerd or cri-o.

size.caption: Size
size.description: The size of the container image.

tag.caption: Image Tag
tag.description: The tag used by the container. It can indicate version, format, OS.

@deprecated.message: Use the labels or tags attribute instead.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The full container unique identifier for this instantiation of the container. For example: ac2ea168264a08f9aaca0dfc82ff3551418dfd22d02b713142a6843caa2f61bf.

image.caption: Image
image.description: The container image used as a template to run the container.

hash.caption: Hash
hash.description: Commit hash of image created for docker or the SHA256 hash of the container. For example: 13550340a8681c84c861aac2e5b440161c2b33a3e4f302ac680ca5b686de48de.

labels.caption: Labels
labels.description: The list of labels associated to the container.

tags.caption: Tags
tags.description: The list of tags; {key:value} pairs associated to the container.

network_driver.caption: Network Driver
network_driver.description: The network driver used by the container. For example, bridge, overlay, host, none, etc.

orchestrator.caption: Orchestrator
orchestrator.description: The orchestrator managing the container, such as ECS, EKS, K8s, or OpenShift.

pod_uuid.caption: Pod UUID
pod_uuid.description: The unique identifier of the pod (or equivalent) that the container is executing on.

http_header.caption: HTTP Header
http_header.name: http_header
http_header.description: The HTTP Header object represents the headers sent in an HTTP request or response. HTTP headers are key-value pairs that convey additional information about the HTTP message, including details about the content, caching, authentication, encoding, and other aspects of the communication.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the HTTP header.

value.caption: Value
value.description: The value of the HTTP header.

session.caption: Session
session.name: session
session.description: The Session object describes details about an authenticated session. e.g. Session Creation Time, Session Issuer.

count.caption: Count
count.description: The number of identical sessions spawned from the same source IP, destination IP, application, and content/threat type seen over a period of time.

terminal.caption: Terminal
terminal.description: The Pseudo Terminal associated with the session. Ex: the tty or pts value.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the session.

uuid.caption: UUID
uuid.description: The universally unique identifier of the session.

issuer.caption: Issuer Details
issuer.description: The identifier of the session issuer.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the session was created.

credential_uid.caption: User Credential ID
credential_uid.description: The unique identifier of the user's credential. For example, AWS Access Key ID.

expiration_reason.caption: Expiration Reason
expiration_reason.description: The reason which triggered the session expiration.

is_mfa.caption: Multi Factor Authentication
is_mfa.description: Indicates whether Multi Factor Authentication was used during authentication.

is_remote.caption: Remote
is_remote.description: The indication of whether the session is remote.

is_vpn.caption: VPN Session
is_vpn.description: The indication of whether the session is a VPN session.

uid_alt.caption: Alternate ID
uid_alt.description: The alternate unique identifier of the session. e.g. AWS ARN - arn:aws:sts::123344444444:assumed-role/Admin/example-session.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The time when the session was created.

process_entity.caption: Process Entity
process_entity.name: process_entity
process_entity.description: The Process Entity object provides critical fields for referencing a process.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The friendly name of the process, for example: Notepad++.

pid.caption: Process ID
pid.description: The process identifier, as reported by the operating system. Process ID (PID) is a number used by the operating system to uniquely identify an active process.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: A unique identifier for this process assigned by the producer (tool).  Facilitates correlation of a process event with other events for that process.

cmd_line.caption: Command Line
cmd_line.description: The full command line used to launch an application, service, process, or job. For example: ssh user@10.0.0.10. If the command line is unavailable or missing, the empty string '' is to be used.

cpid.caption: Common Process Identifier
cpid.description: A unique process identifier that can be assigned deterministically by multiple system data producers.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the process was created/started.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The time when the process was created/started.

baseline.caption: Baseline
baseline.name: baseline
baseline.description: Describes the baseline or expected behavior of a system, service, or component based on historical observations and measurements. It establishes reference points for comparison to detect anomalies, trends, and deviations from typical patterns.

observation_parameter.caption: Observation Parameter
observation_parameter.description: The specific parameter or property being monitored. Examples include: CPU usage percentage, API response time in milliseconds, HTTP error rate, memory utilization, network latency, transaction volume, etc.

observations.caption: Observations
observations.description: Collection of actual measured values, data points and observations recorded for this baseline.

observation_type.caption: Observation Type
observation_type.description: The type of analysis being performed to establish baseline behavior. Common types include: Frequency Analysis, Time Pattern Analysis, Volume Analysis, Sequence Analysis, Distribution Analysis, etc.

observed_pattern.caption: Observed Pattern
observed_pattern.description: The specific pattern identified within the observation type. For Frequency Analysis, this could be 'FREQUENT', 'INFREQUENT', 'RARE', or 'UNSEEN'. For Time Pattern Analysis, this could be 'BUSINESS_HOURS', 'OFF_HOURS', or 'UNUSUAL_TIME'. For Volume Analysis, this could be 'NORMAL_VOLUME', 'HIGH_VOLUME', or 'SURGE'. The pattern values are specific to each observation type and indicate the baseline behavior.

tactic.caption: MITRE Tactic
tactic.name: tactic
tactic.description: The MITRE Tactic object describes the ATT&CK® or ATLAS™ Tactic ID and/or name that is associated to an attack.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The Tactic name that is associated with the attack technique. For example: Reconnaissance or ML Model Access.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The Tactic ID that is associated with the attack technique. For example: TA0043, or AML.TA0000.

src_url.caption: Source URL
src_url.description: The versioned permalink of the Tactic. For example: https://attack.mitre.org/versions/v14/tactics/TA0043/.

startup_item.caption: Startup Item
startup_item.name: startup_item
startup_item.description: The startup item object describes an application component that has associated startup criteria and configurations.

driver.caption: Kernel Driver
driver.description: The startup item kernel driver resource.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The unique name of the startup item.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The startup item type.

start_type.caption: Start Type
start_type.description: The start type of the startup item.

3.caption: Service
3.description: A background process typically managed by the operating system, e.g., a service process on Windows or a systemd-managed daemon on Linux.

6.caption: System Extension
6.description: System extensions on macOS enables 3rd parties to extend the capabilities of macOS.

1.caption: Kernel Mode Driver
1.description: Kernel mode driver.

2.caption: User Mode Driver
2.description: User mode driver.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The startup item type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains data source specific values.

4.caption: User Mode Application
4.description: An application that runs in the user space.

5.caption: Autoload
5.description: The macOS Autoload Application.

7.caption: Kernel Extension
7.description: Kernel extensions on macOS includes Apple provided pre-installs and 3rd party installs which enables support for specific hardware or software features not natively supported by macOS.

8.caption: Scheduled Job, Task
8.description: A job or task that runs on a configured schedule.

run_mode_ids.caption: Run Mode IDs
run_mode_ids.description: The list of normalized identifiers that describe the startup items' properties when it is running.  Use this field to capture extended information about the process, which may depend on the type of startup item.  E.g., A Windows service that interacts with the desktop.

3.caption: Shared Process
3.description: The startup item runs in a shared process.

1.caption: Interactive
1.description: The startup item interacts with the desktop.

2.caption: Own Process
2.description: The startup item runs in its own process.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The run mode is not mapped. See the run_modes attribute, which contains data source specific values.

run_modes.caption: Run Modes
run_modes.description: The list of run_modes, normalized to the captions of the run_mode_id values.  In the case of 'Other', they are defined by the event source.

run_state.caption: Run State
run_state.description: The run state of the startup item.

run_state_id.caption: Run State ID
run_state_id.description: The run state ID of the startup item.

3.caption: Stop Pending
3.description: The service is stopping.

6.caption: Pause Pending
6.description: The service is pending pause.

1.caption: Stopped
1.description: The service is not running.

2.caption: Start Pending
2.description: The service is starting.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The run state is not mapped. See the run_state attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

4.caption: Running
4.description: The service is running.

5.caption: Continue Pending
5.description: The service is pending continue.

7.caption: Paused
7.description: The service is paused.

8.caption: Restart Pending
8.description: The service is pending restart.

start_type_id.caption: Start Type ID
start_type_id.description: The start type ID of the startup item.

3.caption: On Demand
3.description: Started on demand. For example, by the Windows Service Control Manager when a process calls the StartService function.

6.caption: Specific User Login
6.description: Started on specific user logins.

1.caption: Auto
1.description: Service started automatically during system startup.

2.caption: Boot
2.description: Device driver started by the system loader.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The start type is not mapped. See the start_type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

4.caption: Disabled
4.description: The service is disabled, and cannot be started.

5.caption: All Logins
5.description: Started on all user logins.

7.caption: Scheduled
7.description: Stared according to a schedule.

8.caption: System Changed
8.description: Started when a system item, such as a file or registry key, changes.

win_service.caption: Windows Service
win_service.description: The startup item Windows service resource.

databucket.caption: Databucket
databucket.name: databucket
databucket.description: The databucket object is a basic container that holds data, typically organized through the use of data partitions.

zone.caption: Cloud Availability Zone
zone.description: The specific availability zone within a cloud region where the resource is located.

tags.caption: Tags
tags.description: The list of tags; {key:value} pairs associated to the resource.

encryption_details.caption: Encryption Details
encryption_details.description: The encryption details of the databucket. Should be populated if the databucket is encrypted.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The time when the databucket was known to have been created.

size.caption: Size
size.description: The size of the databucket in bytes.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the databucket was known to have been created.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the databucket.

file.caption: File
file.description: Details about the file/object within a databucket.

data_classification.caption: Data Classification
data_classification.description: The Data Classification object includes information about data classification levels and data category types.

owner.caption: Owner
owner.description: The identity of the service or user account that owns the resource.

cloud_partition.caption: Cloud Partition
cloud_partition.description: The canonical cloud partition name to which the region is assigned (e.g. AWS Partitions: aws, aws-cn, aws-us-gov).

is_backed_up.caption: Back Ups Configured
is_backed_up.description: Indicates whether the device or resource has a backup enabled, such as an automated snapshot or a cloud backup. For example, this is indicated by the cloudBackupEnabled value within JAMF Pro mobile devices or the registration of an AWS ARN with the AWS Backup service.

resource_relationship.caption: Resource Relationship
resource_relationship.description: A graph representation showing how this resource relates to and interacts with other entities in the environment. This can include parent/child relationships, dependencies, or other connections.

group.caption: Group
group.description: The name of the related resource group.

ip.caption: IP Address
ip.description: The IP address of the resource, in either IPv4 or IPv6 format.

is_public.caption: Public
is_public.description: Indicates if the databucket is publicly accessible.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The normalized identifier of the databucket type.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the databucket.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The version of the resource. For example 1.2.3.

region.caption: Region
region.description: The cloud region of the resource.

is_encrypted.caption: Encrypted
is_encrypted.description: Indicates if the databucket is encrypted.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The databucket name.

groups.caption: Groups
groups.description: The group names to which the databucket belongs.

uid_alt.caption: Alternate ID
uid_alt.description: The alternative unique identifier of the resource.

namespace.caption: Namespace
namespace.description: The namespace is useful when similar entities exist that you need to keep separate.

modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time
modified_time_dt.description: The most recent time when any changes, updates, or modifications were made within the databucket.

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The most recent time when any changes, updates, or modifications were made within the databucket.

data_classifications.caption: Data Classification
data_classifications.description: A list of Data Classification objects, that include information about data classification levels and data category types, indentified by a classifier.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The databucket type.

agent_list.caption: Agent List
agent_list.description: A list of agent objects associated with a device, endpoint, or resource.

criticality.caption: Criticality
criticality.description: The criticality of the resource as defined by the event source.

labels.caption: Labels
labels.description: The list of labels associated to the resource.

hostname.caption: Hostname
hostname.description: The fully qualified name of the resource.

rule.caption: Rule
rule.name: rule
rule.description: The Rule object describes characteristics of a rule associated with a policy or an event.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the rule that generated the event.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The rule type.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The rule version. For example: 1.1.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the rule that generated the event.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the rule that generated the event.

managed_entity.caption: Managed Entity
managed_entity.name: managed_entity
managed_entity.description: The Managed Entity object describes the type and version of an entity, such as a user, device, or policy. For types in the type_id enum list, an associated attribute should be populated. If the type of entity is not in the type_id list, information can be put into the data attribute, type_id should be 'Other' and the type attribute should label the entity type.

data.caption: Data
data.description: The managed entity content as a JSON object.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the managed entity. It should match the name of the specific entity object's name if populated, or the name of the managed entity if the type_id is 'Other'.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The managed entity type. For example: Policy, User, Organization, Device.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The version of the managed entity. For example: 1.2.3.

user.caption: User
user.description: The user that pertains to the event or object.

device.caption: Device
device.description: An addressable device, computer system or host.

group.caption: Group
group.description: The group object associated with an entity such as user, policy, or rule.

location.caption: Geo Location
location.description: The detailed geographical location usually associated with an IP address.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The identifier of the managed entity. It should match the uid of the specific entity's object UID if populated, or the source specific ID if the type_id is 'Other'.

org.caption: Organization
org.description: Organization and org unit relevant to the event or object.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The type of the Managed Entity. It is recommended to also populate the type attribute with the associated label, or the source specific name if Other.

3.caption: Group
3.description: A managed Group entity. This item corresponds to population of the group attribute.

6.caption: Email
6.description: A managed Email entity. This item corresponds to population of the email attribute.

1.caption: Device
1.description: A managed Device entity. This item corresponds to population of the device attribute.

2.caption: User
2.description: A managed User entity. This item corresponds to population of the user attribute.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

4.caption: Organization
4.description: A managed Organization entity. This item corresponds to population of the org attribute.

5.caption: Policy
5.description: A managed Policy entity. This item corresponds to population of the policy attribute.

7.caption: Network Zone
7.description: A managed Network Zone entity. Populate the name attribute with the zone name and/or the uid attribute with the zone ID. Additional zone information can be added to the data attribute.

policy.caption: Policy
policy.description: Describes details of a managed policy.

cis_benchmark_result.caption: CIS Benchmark Result
cis_benchmark_result.name: cis_benchmark_result
cis_benchmark_result.description: The CIS Benchmark Result object contains information as defined by the Center for Internet Security (CIS) benchmark result. CIS Benchmarks are a collection of best practices for securely configuring IT systems, software, networks, and cloud infrastructure.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The CIS benchmark name.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The CIS benchmark description.

remediation.caption: Remediation Guidance
remediation.description: Describes the recommended remediation steps to address identified issue(s).

@deprecated.message: Use the Compliance object with Checks object instead.

authorization.caption: Authorization Result
authorization.name: authorization
authorization.description: The Authorization Result object provides details about the authorization outcome and associated policies related to activity.

policy.caption: Policy
policy.description: Details about the Identity/Access management policies that are applicable.

digital_signature.caption: Digital Signature
digital_signature.name: digital_signature
digital_signature.description: The Digital Signature object contains information about the cryptographic mechanism used to verify the authenticity, integrity, and origin of the file or application.

state.caption: State
state.description: The digital signature state defines the signature state, normalized to the caption of 'state_id'. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

digest.caption: Message Digest
digest.description: The message digest attribute contains the fixed length message hash representation and the corresponding hashing algorithm information.

certificate.caption: Certificate
certificate.description: The certificate object containing information about the digital certificate.

algorithm.caption: Algorithm
algorithm.description: The digital signature algorithm used to create the signature, normalized to the caption of 'algorithm_id'. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

algorithm_id.caption: Algorithm ID
algorithm_id.description: The identifier of the normalized digital signature algorithm.

3.caption: ECDSA
3.description: Elliptic Curve Digital Signature Algorithm.

1.caption: DSA
1.description: Digital Signature Algorithm (DSA).

2.caption: RSA
2.description: Rivest-Shamir-Adleman (RSA) Algorithm.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The algorithm is not mapped. See the algorithm attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

4.caption: Authenticode
4.description: Microsoft Authenticode Digital Signature Algorithm.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the digital signature was created.

developer_uid.caption: Developer UID
developer_uid.description: The developer ID on the certificate that signed the file.

state_id.caption: State ID
state_id.description: The normalized identifier of the signature state.

3.caption: Revoked
3.description: The digital signature is invalid due to certificate revocation.

1.caption: Valid
1.description: The digital signature is valid.

2.caption: Expired
2.description: The digital signature is not valid due to expiration of certificate.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The state is not mapped. See the state attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

4.caption: Suspended
4.description: The digital signature is invalid due to certificate suspension.

5.caption: Pending
5.description: The digital signature state is pending.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The time when the digital signature was created.

software_component.caption: Software Component
software_component.name: software_component
software_component.description: The Software Component object describes characteristics of a software component within a software package.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The software component name.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The type of software component, normalized to the caption of the type_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The software component version.

author.caption: Author
author.description: The author(s) who published the software component.

hash.caption: Hash
hash.description: Cryptographic hash to identify the binary instance of a software component.

relationship.caption: Relationship
relationship.description: The relationship between two software components, normalized to the caption of the relationship_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source.

3.caption: Operating System
3.description: An operating system. Useful for SBOMs of container images.

1.caption: Framework
1.description: A software framework.

2.caption: Library
2.description: A software library.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

license.caption: Software License
license.description: The software license applied to this component.

purl.caption: Package URL
purl.description: The Package URL (PURL) to identify the software component. This is a URL that uniquely identifies the component, including the component's name, version, and type. The URL is used to locate and retrieve the component's metadata and content.

related_component.caption: Related Component
related_component.description: The package URL (PURL) of the component that this software component has a relationship with.

relationship_id.caption: Relationship ID
relationship_id.description: The normalized identifier of the relationship between two software components.

1.caption: Depends On
1.description: The component is a dependency of another component. Can be used to define both direct and transitive dependencies.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The relationship is not mapped. See the relationship attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

trait.caption: Trait
trait.name: trait
trait.description: Describes a characteristic or feature of an entity that was observed. For example, this object can be used to represent specific characteristics derived from events or findings that can be surfaced as distinguishing traits of the entity in question.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the trait.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The type of the trait. For example, this can be used to indicate if the trait acts as a contributing factor (increases risk/severity) or a mitigating factor (decreases risk/severity), in the context of the related finding.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the trait.

category.caption: Category
category.description: The high-level grouping or classification this trait belongs to.

d3fend.caption: MITRE D3FEND™
d3fend.name: d3fend
d3fend.description: The MITRE D3FEND™ object describes the tactic & technique associated with a countermeasure.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The D3FEND™ Matrix version.

d3f_tactic.caption: MITRE D3FEND™ Tactic
d3f_tactic.description: The Tactic object describes the tactic ID and/or name that is associated with a countermeasure.

d3f_technique.caption: MITRE D3FEND™ Technique
d3f_technique.description: The Technique object describes the technique ID and/or name associated with a countermeasure.

logger.caption: Logger
logger.name: logger
logger.description: The Logger object represents the device and product where events are stored with times for receipt and transmission.  This may be at the source device where the event occurred, a remote scanning device, intermediate hops, or the ultimate destination.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the logging product instance.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The version of the logging product.

device.caption: Device
device.description: The device where the events are logged.

product.caption: Product
product.description: The product logging the event.  This may be the event source product, a management server product, a scanning product, a SIEM, etc.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the logging product instance.

log_level.caption: Log Level
log_level.description: The audit level at which an event was generated.

event_uid.caption: Event UID
event_uid.description: The unique identifier of the event assigned by the logger.

log_name.caption: Log Name
log_name.description: The event log name. For example, syslog file name or Windows logging subsystem: Security.

log_provider.caption: Log Provider
log_provider.description: The logging provider or logging service that logged the event. For example, Microsoft-Windows-Security-Auditing.

log_version.caption: Log Version
log_version.description: The event log schema version that specifies the format of the original event. For example syslog version or Cisco Log Schema Version.

logged_time.caption: Logged Time
logged_time.description:
The time when the logging system collected and logged the event.

This attribute is distinct from the event time in that event time typically contain the time extracted from the original event. Most of the time, these two times will be different.

transmit_time.caption: Transmission Time
transmit_time.description: The time when the event was transmitted from the logging device to it's next destination.

logged_time_dt.caption: Logged Time
logged_time_dt.description:
The time when the logging system collected and logged the event.

This attribute is distinct from the event time in that event time typically contain the time extracted from the original event. Most of the time, these two times will be different.

transmit_time_dt.caption: Transmission Time
transmit_time_dt.description: The time when the event was transmitted from the logging device to it's next destination.

keyboard_info.caption: Keyboard Information
keyboard_info.name: keyboard_info
keyboard_info.description: The Keyboard Information object contains details and attributes related to a computer or device keyboard. It encompasses information that describes the characteristics, capabilities, and configuration of the keyboard.

function_keys.caption: Function Keys
function_keys.description: The number of function keys on client keyboard.

ime.caption: IME
ime.description: The Input Method Editor (IME) file name.

keyboard_layout.caption: Keyboard Layout
keyboard_layout.description: The keyboard locale identifier name (e.g., en-US).

observation.caption: Observation
observation.name: observation
observation.description: A record of an observed value or event that captures the timing and frequency of its occurrence. Used to track when values/events were first detected, last detected, and their total occurrence count.

count.caption: Count
count.description: Integer representing the total number of times this specific value/event was observed across all occurrences. Helps establish prevalence and patterns.

value.caption: Value
value.description: The specific value, event, indicator or data point that was observed and recorded. This is the core piece of information being tracked.

timespan.caption: Time Span
timespan.description: The time window when the value or event was first observed. It is used to analyze activity patterns, detect trends, or correlate events within a specific timeframe.

d3f_technique.caption: MITRE D3FEND™ Technique
d3f_technique.name: d3f_technique
d3f_technique.description: The MITRE D3FEND™ Technique object describes the leaf defensive technique ID and/or name associated to a countermeasure.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the defensive technique. For example: IO Port Restriction.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the defensive technique. For example: D3-IOPR.

src_url.caption: Source URL
src_url.description: The versioned permalink of the defensive technique. For example: https://d3fend.mitre.org/technique/d3f:IOPortRestriction/.

certificate.caption: Digital Certificate
certificate.name: certificate
certificate.description: The Digital Certificate, also known as a Public Key Certificate, object contains information about the ownership and usage of a public key. It serves as a means to establish trust in the authenticity and integrity of the public key and the associated entity.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The certificate version.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the certificate.

is_self_signed.caption: Certificate Self-Signed
is_self_signed.description: Denotes whether a digital certificate is self-signed or signed by a known certificate authority (CA).

fingerprints.caption: Fingerprints
fingerprints.description: The fingerprint list of the certificate.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the certificate was created.

expiration_time.caption: Expiration Time
expiration_time.description: The expiration time of the certificate.

sans.caption: Subject Alternative Names
sans.description: The list of subject alternative names that are secured by a specific certificate.

serial_number.caption: Certificate Serial Number
serial_number.description: The serial number of the certificate used to create the digital signature.

expiration_time_dt.caption: Expiration Time
expiration_time_dt.description: The expiration time of the certificate.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The time when the certificate was created.

authentication_token.caption: Authentication Token
authentication_token.name: authentication_token
authentication_token.description: The Authentication Token object contains the attributes pertaining to an authentication token, ticket, or assertion e.g. Kerberos, OIDC, SAML.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The type of the authentication token.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The normalized authentication token type identifier.

3.caption: Identity Token
3.description: Identity (ID) Token for OIDC.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The Authentication token type is unknown.

1.caption: Ticket Granting Ticket
1.description: Ticket Granting Ticket (TGT) for Kerberos.

2.caption: Service Ticket
2.description: Service Ticket (ST) for Kerberos.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

4.caption: Refresh Token
4.description: Refresh Token for OIDC.

5.caption: SAML Assertion
5.description: Authentication Assertion for SAML.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time that the authentication token was created.

encryption_details.caption: Encryption Details
encryption_details.description: The encryption details of the authentication token.

expiration_time.caption: Expiration Time
expiration_time.description: The expiration time of the authentication token.

kerberos_flags.caption: Kerberos Flags
kerberos_flags.description: A bitmask, either in hexadecimal or decimal form, which encodes various attributes or permissions associated with a Kerberos ticket. These flags delineate specific characteristics of the ticket, such as its renewability or forwardability.

is_renewable.caption: Renewable
is_renewable.description: Indicates whether the authentication token is renewable.

expiration_time_dt.caption: Expiration Time
expiration_time_dt.description: The expiration time of the authentication token.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The time that the authentication token was created.

technique.caption: MITRE Technique
technique.name: technique
technique.description: The MITRE Technique object describes the ATT&CK® or ATLAS™ Technique ID and/or name associated to an attack.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the attack technique. For example: Active Scanning or AI Model Inference API Access.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the attack technique. For example: T1595 or AML.T0040.

src_url.caption: Source URL
src_url.description: The versioned permalink of the attack technique. For example: https://attack.mitre.org/versions/v14/techniques/T1595/.

threat_actor.caption: Threat Actor
threat_actor.name: threat_actor
threat_actor.description: Threat actor is responsible for the observed malicious activity.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the threat actor.

type.caption: Threat Actor Type
type.description: The classification of the threat actor based on their motivations, capabilities, or affiliations. Common types include nation-state actors, cybercriminal groups, hacktivists, or insider threats.

type_id.caption: Threat Actor Type ID
type_id.description: The normalized datastore resource type identifier.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The threat actor type is unknown.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The threat actor type is not mapped.

transformation_info.caption: Transformation Info
transformation_info.name: transformation_info
transformation_info.description: The transformation_info object represents the mapping or transformation used.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the transformation or mapping.

time.caption: Event Time
time.description: Time of the transformation.

product.caption: Product
product.description: The product or instance used to make the transformation

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the mapping or transformation.

lang.caption: Language
lang.description: The transformation language used to transform the data.

url_string.caption: URL String
url_string.description: The Uniform Resource Locator String where the mapping or transformation exists.

time_dt.caption: Event Time
time_dt.description: Time of the transformation.

organization.caption: Organization
organization.name: organization
organization.description: The Organization object describes characteristics of an organization or company and its division if any. Additionally, it also describes cloud and Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) logical hierarchies such as AWS Organizations, Google Cloud Organizations, Oracle Cloud Tenancies, and similar constructs.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the organization, Oracle Cloud Tenancy, Google Cloud Organization, or AWS Organization. For example, Widget, Inc. or the AWS Organization name .

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the organization, Oracle Cloud Tenancy, Google Cloud Organization, or AWS Organization. For example, an AWS Org ID or Oracle Cloud Domain ID .

ou_name.caption: Org Unit Name
ou_name.description: The name of an organizational unit, Google Cloud Folder, or AWS Org Unit. For example, the GCP Project Name , or Dev_Prod_OU .

ou_uid.caption: Org Unit ID
ou_uid.description: The unique identifier of an organizational unit, Google Cloud Folder, or AWS Org Unit. For example, an Oracle Cloud Tenancy ID , AWS OU ID , or GCP Folder ID .

cis_csc.caption: CIS CSC
cis_csc.name: cis_csc
cis_csc.description: The CIS Critical Security Control (CSC) contains information as defined by the Center for Internet Security Critical Security Control (CIS CSC). Prioritized set of actions to protect your organization and data from cyber-attack vectors.

control.caption: Security Control
control.description: A Control is prescriptive, prioritized, and simplified set of best practices that one can use to strengthen their cybersecurity posture. e.g. AWS SecurityHub Controls, CIS Controls.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The CIS critical security control version.

compliance.caption: Compliance
compliance.name: compliance
compliance.description: The Compliance object contains information about Industry and Regulatory Framework standards, controls and requirements or details about custom assessments utilized in a compliance evaluation. Standards define broad security frameworks, controls represent specific security requirements within those frameworks, and checks are the testable verification points used to determine if controls are properly implemented.

control.caption: Security Control
control.description: A Control is a prescriptive, actionable set of specifications that strengthens device posture. The control specifies required security measures, while the specific implementation values are defined in control_parameters. E.g., CIS AWS Foundations Benchmark 1.2.0 - Control 2.1 - Ensure CloudTrail is enabled in all regions

status.caption: Status
status.description: The resultant status of the compliance check normalized to the caption of the status_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description or criteria of a control.

category.caption: Category
category.description: The category a control framework pertains to, as reported by the source tool, such as Asset Management or Risk Assessment.

assessments.caption: Assessments
assessments.description: A list of assessments associated with the compliance requirements evaluation.

checks.caption: Compliance Checks
checks.description: A list of compliance checks associated with specific industry standards or frameworks. Each check represents an individual rule or requirement that has been evaluated against a target device. Checks typically include details such as the check name (e.g., CIS: 'Ensure mounting of cramfs filesystems is disabled' or DISA STIG descriptive titles), unique identifiers (such as CIS identifier '1.1.1.1' or DISA STIG identifier 'V-230234'), descriptions (detailed explanations of security requirements or vulnerability discussions), and version information.

compliance_references.caption: Compliance Standard References
compliance_references.description: A list of reference KB articles that provide information to help organizations understand, interpret, and implement compliance standards. They provide guidance, best practices, and examples.

@deprecated.message: Use the Compliance object with Check array instead.

compliance_standards.caption: Compliance Standards: Details
compliance_standards.description: A list of established guidelines or criteria that define specific requirements an organization must follow.

@deprecated.message: Use the Compliance object with Check array instead.

control_parameters.caption: Control Parameters
control_parameters.description: The list of control parameters evaluated in a Compliance check. E.g., parameters for CloudTrail configuration might include multiRegionTrailEnabled: true, logFileValidationEnabled: true, and requiredRegions: [us-east-1, us-west-2]

requirements.caption: Compliance Requirements
requirements.description: The specific compliance requirements being evaluated. E.g., PCI DSS Requirement 8.2.3 - Passwords must meet minimum complexity requirements or HIPAA Security Rule 164.312(a)(2)(iv) - Implement encryption and decryption mechanisms

standards.caption: Compliance Standards: List
standards.description: The regulatory or industry standards being evaluated for compliance.

status_code.caption: Status Code
status_code.description: The resultant status code of the compliance check.

status_detail.caption: Status Detail
status_detail.description: The contextual description of the status, status_code values.

status_details.caption: Status Details
status_details.description: A list of contextual descriptions of the status, status_code values.

status_id.caption: Status ID
status_id.description: The normalized status identifier of the compliance check.

3.caption: Fail
3.description: The compliance check failed for at least one of the evaluated resources.

1.caption: Pass
1.description: The compliance check passed for all the evaluated resources.

2.caption: Warning
2.description: The compliance check did not yield a result due to missing information.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event status is not mapped. See the status attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

aircraft.caption: Aircraft
aircraft.name: aircraft
aircraft.description: The Aircraft object represents any aircraft or otherwise airborne asset such as an unmanned system, airplane, balloon, spacecraft, or otherwise. The Aircraft object is intended to normalized data captured or otherwise logged from active radar, passive radar, multi-spectral systems, or the Automatic Dependant Broadcast - Surveillance (ADS-B), and/or Mode S systems.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the aircraft, such as the such as the flight name or callsign.

speed.caption: Speed
speed.description: Ground speed of flight. This value is provided in meters per second with a minimum resolution of 0.25 m/s. Special Values: Invalid, No Value, or Unknown: 255 m/s.

location.caption: Geo Location
location.description: The detailed geographical location usually associated with an IP address.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The primary identification identifier for an aircraft, such as the 24-bit International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO) identifier of the aircraft, as 6 hex digits.

model.caption: Model
model.description: The model name of the aircraft or unmanned system.

serial_number.caption: Serial Number
serial_number.description: The serial number of the aircraft.

speed_accuracy.caption: Speed Accuracy
speed_accuracy.description: Provides quality/containment on horizontal ground speed. Measured in meters/second.

track_direction.caption: Track Direction
track_direction.description: Direction of flight expressed as a “True North-based” ground track angle. This value is provided in clockwise degrees with a minimum resolution of 1 degree. If aircraft is not moving horizontally, use the “Unknown” value

uid_alt.caption: Alternate ID
uid_alt.description: A secondary identification identifier for an aircraft, such as the 4-digit squawk (octal representation).

vertical_speed.caption: Vertical Speed
vertical_speed.description: Vertical speed upward relative to the WGS-84 datum, measured in meters per second. Special Values: Invalid, No Value, or Unknown: 63 m/s.

graph.caption: Graph
graph.name: graph
graph.description: A graph data structure representation with nodes and edges.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The graph name - a human readable identifier for the graph.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The graph type. Typically useful to represent the specifc type of graph that is used.

nodes.caption: Nodes
