nodes.description: The nodes/vertices of the graph - contains the collection of node objects that make up the graph.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The graph description - provides additional details about the graph's purpose and contents.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: Unique identifier of the graph - a unique ID to reference this specific graph.

edges.caption: Edges
edges.description: The edges/connections between nodes in the graph - contains the collection of edge objects defining relationships between nodes.

is_directed.caption: Directed
is_directed.description: Indicates if the graph is directed (true) or undirected (false).

query_language.caption: Query Language
query_language.description: The graph query language, normalized to the caption of the query_language_id value.

query_language_id.caption: Query Language ID
query_language_id.description: The normalized identifier of a graph query language that can be used to interact with the graph.

3.caption: Gremlin
3.description: A graph traversal language and virtual machine developed by Apache TinkerPop that enables graph computing across different graph databases.

6.caption: PGQL
6.description: Property Graph Query Language developed by Oracle that provides SQL-like syntax for querying property graphs.

1.caption: Cypher
1.description: A declarative graph query language developed by Neo4j that allows for expressive and efficient querying of graph databases.

2.caption: GraphQL
2.description: A query language for APIs that enables declarative data fetching and provides a complete description of the data in the API.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The Query Language is not mapped. See the query_language attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

4.caption: GQL
4.description: An ISO standard graph query language designed to provide a unified way to query graph databases.

5.caption: G-CORE
5.description: A graph query language that combines features from existing languages while adding support for paths as first-class citizens.

7.caption: SPARQL
7.description: A semantic query language for databases that enables querying and manipulating data stored in RDF format.

api.caption: API
api.name: api
api.description: The API, or Application Programming Interface, object represents  information pertaining to an API request and response.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The version of the API service.

request.caption: API Request Details
request.description: Details pertaining to the API request.

service.caption: Service
service.description: The information pertaining to the API service.

group.caption: Group
group.description: The information pertaining to the API group.

response.caption: API Response Details
response.description: Details pertaining to the API response.

related_event.caption: Related Event/Finding
related_event.name: related_event
related_event.description: The Related Event object describes an event or another finding related to a finding. It may or may not be an OCSF event.

count.caption: Count
count.description: The number of times that activity in the same logical group occurred, as reported by the related Finding.

type.caption: Type
type.description:
The type of the related event/finding.

Populate if the related event/finding is NOT in OCSF. If it is in OCSF, then utilize type_name, type_uid instead.

title.caption: Title
title.description: A title or a brief phrase summarizing the related event/finding.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: A description of the related event/finding.

product.caption: Product
product.description: Details about the product that reported the related event/finding.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description:
The unique identifier of the related event/finding.

If the related event/finding is in OCSF, then this value must be equal to metadata.uid in the corresponding event.

severity.caption: Severity
severity.description: The event/finding severity, normalized to the caption of the severity_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source.

tags.caption: Tags
tags.description: The list of tags; {key:value} pairs associated with the related event/finding.

attacks.caption: MITRE ATT&CK® and ATLAS™ Details
attacks.description: An array of MITRE ATT&CK® objects describing identified tactics, techniques & sub-techniques. The objects are compatible with MITRE ATLAS™ tactics, techniques & sub-techniques.

type_uid.caption: Type ID
type_uid.description:
The unique identifier of the related OCSF event type.

For example: 100701.

Populate if the related event/finding is in OCSF.

type_name.caption: Type Name
type_name.description:
The type of the related OCSF event, as defined by type_uid.

For example: Process Activity: Launch.

Populate if the related event/finding is in OCSF.

observables.caption: Observables
observables.description: The observables associated with the event or a finding.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the related event/finding was created.

first_seen_time.caption: First Seen
first_seen_time.description:
The time when the finding was first observed. e.g. The time when a vulnerability was first observed.
It can differ from the created_time timestamp, which reflects the time this finding was created.

kill_chain.caption: Kill Chain
kill_chain.description: The Cyber Kill Chain® provides a detailed description of each phase and its associated activities within the broader context of a cyber attack.

last_seen_time.caption: Last Seen
last_seen_time.description:
The time when the finding was most recently observed. e.g. The time when a vulnerability was most recently observed.
It can differ from the modified_time timestamp, which reflects the time this finding was last modified.

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The time when the related event/finding was last modified.

product_uid.caption: Product Identifier
product_uid.description: The unique identifier of the product that reported the related event.

@deprecated.message: Use the uid attribute in the product object instead. See specific usage.

severity_id.caption: Severity ID
severity_id.description:
The normalized identifier of the event/finding severity.

The normalized severity is a measurement the effort and expense required to manage and resolve an event or incident. Smaller numerical values represent lower impact events, and larger numerical values represent higher impact events.

3.caption: Medium
3.description: Action is required but the situation is not serious at this time.

6.caption: Fatal
6.description: An error occurred but it is too late to take remedial action.

1.caption: Informational
1.description: Informational message. No action required.

2.caption: Low
2.description: The user decides if action is needed.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event/finding severity is not mapped. See the severity attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

4.caption: High
4.description: Action is required immediately.

5.caption: Critical
5.description: Action is required immediately and the scope is broad.

traits.caption: Traits
traits.description: The list of key traits or characteristics extracted from the related event/finding that influenced or contributed to the overall finding's outcome.

modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time
modified_time_dt.description: The time when the related event/finding was last modified.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The time when the related event/finding was created.

first_seen_time_dt.caption: First Seen
first_seen_time_dt.description:
The time when the finding was first observed. e.g. The time when a vulnerability was first observed.
It can differ from the created_time timestamp, which reflects the time this finding was created.

last_seen_time_dt.caption: Last Seen
last_seen_time_dt.description:
The time when the finding was most recently observed. e.g. The time when a vulnerability was most recently observed.
It can differ from the modified_time timestamp, which reflects the time this finding was last modified.

product.caption: Product
product.name: product
product.description: The Product object describes characteristics of a software product.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the product.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The version of the product, as defined by the event source. For example: 2013.1.3-beta.

path.caption: Path
path.description: The installation path of the product.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the product.

feature.caption: Feature
feature.description: The feature that reported the event.

lang.caption: Language
lang.description: The two letter lower case language codes, as defined by ISO 639-1. For example: en (English), de (German), or fr (French).

cpe_name.caption: The product CPE identifier
cpe_name.description: The Common Platform Enumeration (CPE) name as described by (NIST) For example: cpe:/a:apple:safari:16.2.

data_classification.caption: Data Classification
data_classification.description: The Data Classification object includes information about data classification levels and data category types.

data_classifications.caption: Data Classification
data_classifications.description: A list of Data Classification objects, that include information about data classification levels and data category types, indentified by a classifier.

url_string.caption: URL String
url_string.description: The URL pointing towards the product.

vendor_name.caption: Vendor Name
vendor_name.description: The name of the vendor of the product.

kb_article.caption: KB Article
kb_article.name: kb_article
kb_article.description: The KB Article object contains metadata that describes the patch or update.

size.caption: Size
size.description: The size in bytes for the kb article.

os.caption: OS
os.description: The operating system the kb article applies.

title.caption: Title
title.description: The title of the kb article.

product.caption: Product
product.description: The product details the kb article applies.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier for the kb article.

severity.caption: Severity
severity.description: The severity of the kb article.

classification.caption: Classification
classification.description: The vendors classification of the kb article.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The date the kb article was released by the vendor.

install_state.caption: Install State
install_state.description: The install state of the kb article.

install_state_id.caption: Install State ID
install_state_id.description: The normalized install state ID of the kb article.

3.caption: Installed Pending Reboot
3.description: The item is installed pending reboot operation.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The normalized install state is unknown.

1.caption: Installed
1.description: The item is installed.

2.caption: Not Installed
2.description: The item is not installed.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The install state is not mapped. See the install_state attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

is_superseded.caption: The patch is superseded.
is_superseded.description: The kb article has been replaced by another.

src_url.caption: Source URL
src_url.description: The kb article link from the source vendor.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The date the kb article was released by the vendor.

timespan.caption: Time Span
timespan.name: timespan
timespan.description:
The Time Span object represents different time period durations. If a timespan is fractional, i.e. crosses one period, e.g. a week and 3 days, more than one may be populated since each member is of integral type. In that case type_id if present should be set to Other.

A timespan may also be defined by its time interval boundaries, start_time and end_time.

type.caption: Time Span Type
type.description: The type of time span duration the object represents.

start_time.caption: Start Time
start_time.description: The start time or beginning of the timespan's interval.

duration.caption: Duration Milliseconds
duration.description: The duration of the time span in milliseconds.

type_id.caption: Time Span Type ID
type_id.description: The normalized identifier for the time span duration type.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

9.caption: Time Interval
9.description: The start_time and end_time should be set.

end_time.caption: End Time
end_time.description: The end time or conclusion of the timespan's interval.

start_time_dt.caption: Start Time
start_time_dt.description: The start time or beginning of the timespan's interval.

end_time_dt.caption: End Time
end_time_dt.description: The end time or conclusion of the timespan's interval.

duration_days.caption: Duration Days
duration_days.description: The duration of the time span in days.

duration_hours.caption: Duration Hours
duration_hours.description: The duration of the time span in hours.

duration_mins.caption: Duration Minutes
duration_mins.description: The duration of the time span in minutes.

duration_months.caption: Duration Months
duration_months.description: The duration of the time span in months.

duration_secs.caption: Duration Seconds
duration_secs.description: The duration of the time span in seconds.

duration_weeks.caption: Duration Weeks
duration_weeks.description: The duration of the time span in weeks.

duration_years.caption: Duration Years
duration_years.description: The duration of the time span in years.

d3f_tactic.caption: MITRE D3FEND™ Tactic
d3f_tactic.name: d3f_tactic
d3f_tactic.description: The MITRE D3FEND™ Tactic object describes the tactic ID and/or name that is associated to an attack.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The tactic name that is associated with the defensive technique. For example: Isolate.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the defensive tactic.

src_url.caption: Source URL
src_url.description: The versioned permalink of the defensive tactic. For example: https://d3fend.mitre.org/tactic/d3f:Isolate/.

email_auth.caption: Email Authentication
email_auth.name: email_auth
email_auth.description: The Email Authentication object describes the Sender Policy Framework (SPF), DomainKeys Identified Mail (DKIM) and Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting and Conformance (DMARC) attributes of an email.

spf.caption: SPF Status
spf.description: The Sender Policy Framework (SPF) status of the email.

dkim.caption: DKIM Status
dkim.description: The DomainKeys Identified Mail (DKIM) status of the email.

dkim_domain.caption: DKIM Domain
dkim_domain.description: The DomainKeys Identified Mail (DKIM) signing domain of the email.

dkim_signature.caption: DKIM Signature
dkim_signature.description: The DomainKeys Identified Mail (DKIM) signature used by the sending/receiving system.

dmarc.caption: DMARC Status
dmarc.description: The Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting and Conformance (DMARC) status of the email.

dmarc_override.caption: DMARC Override
dmarc_override.description: The Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting and Conformance (DMARC) override action.

dmarc_policy.caption: DMARC Policy
dmarc_policy.description: The Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting and Conformance (DMARC) policy status.

request.caption: Request Elements
request.name: request
request.description: The Request Elements object describes characteristics of an API request.

data.caption: Data
data.description: The additional data that is associated with the api request.

flags.caption: Flags
flags.description: The communication flags that are associated with the api request.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique request identifier.

containers.caption: Containers
containers.description: When working with containerized applications, the set of containers which write to the standard the output of a particular logging driver. For example, this may be the set of containers involved in handling api requests and responses for a containerized application.

network_interface.caption: Network Interface
network_interface.name: network_interface
network_interface.description: The Network Interface object describes the type and associated attributes of a physical or virtual network interface.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the network interface.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The type of network interface.

ip.caption: IP Address
ip.description: The IP address associated with the network interface.

hostname.caption: Hostname
hostname.description: The hostname associated with the network interface.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier for the network interface.

mac.caption: MAC Address
mac.description: The MAC address of the network interface.

namespace.caption: Namespace
namespace.description: The namespace is useful in merger or acquisition situations. For example, when similar entities exist that you need to keep separate.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

subnet_prefix.caption: Subnet Prefix Length
subnet_prefix.description: The subnet prefix length determines the number of bits used to represent the network part of the IP address. The remaining bits are reserved for identifying individual hosts within that subnet.

enrichment.caption: Enrichment
enrichment.name: enrichment
enrichment.description: The Enrichment object provides inline enrichment data for specific attributes of interest within an event. It serves as a mechanism to enhance or supplement the information associated with the event by adding additional relevant details or context.

data.caption: Data
data.description: The enrichment data associated with the attribute and value. The meaning of this data depends on the type the enrichment record.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the attribute to which the enriched data pertains.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The enrichment type. For example: location.

value.caption: Value
value.description: The value of the attribute to which the enriched data pertains.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: A long description of the enrichment data.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the enrichment data was generated.

reputation.caption: Reputation Scores
reputation.description: The reputation of the enrichment data.

short_desc.caption: Short Description
short_desc.description: A short description of the enrichment data.

src_url.caption: Source URL
src_url.description: The URL of the source of the enrichment data.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The time when the enrichment data was generated.

agent.caption: Agent
agent.name: agent
agent.description: An Agent (also known as a Sensor) is typically installed on an Operating System (OS) and serves as a specialized software component that can be designed to monitor, detect, collect, archive, or take action. These activities and possible actions are defined by the upstream system controlling the Agent and its intended purpose. For instance, an Agent can include Endpoint Detection & Response (EDR) agents, backup/disaster recovery sensors, Application Performance Monitoring or profiling sensors, and similar software.

name.caption: Agent Name
name.description: The name of the agent or sensor. For example: AWS SSM Agent.

type.caption: Agent Type
type.description: The normalized caption of the type_id value for the agent or sensor. In the case of 'Other' or 'Unknown', it is defined by the event source.

version.caption: Agent Version
version.description: The semantic version of the agent or sensor, e.g., 7.101.50.0.

uid.caption: Agent ID
uid.description: The UID of the agent or sensor, sometimes known as a Sensor ID or aid.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The normalized representation of an agent or sensor. E.g., EDR, vulnerability management, APM, backup & recovery, etc.

3.caption: Backup & Recovery
3.description: Any agent or sensor that provides backups, archival, or recovery capabilities. E.g., Azure Backup, AWS Backint Agent.

6.caption: Log Forwarding
6.description: Any agent or sensor that forwards logs to a 3rd party storage system such as a data lake or SIEM. E.g., Splunk Universal Forwarder, Tenzir, FluentBit, Amazon CloudWatch Agent, Amazon Kinesis Agent.

1.caption: Endpoint Detection and Response
1.description: Any EDR sensor or agent. Or any tool that provides similar threat detection, anti-malware, anti-ransomware, or similar capabilities. E.g., Crowdstrike Falcon, Microsoft Defender for Endpoint, Wazuh.

2.caption: Data Loss Prevention
2.description: Any DLP sensor or agent. Or any tool that provides similar data classification, data loss detection, and/or data loss prevention capabilities. E.g., Forcepoint DLP, Microsoft Purview, Symantec DLP.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

4.caption: Performance Monitoring & Observability
4.description: Any agent or sensor that provides Application Performance Monitoring (APM), active tracing, profiling, or other observability use cases and optionally forwards the logs. E.g., New Relic Agent, Datadog Agent, Azure Monitor Agent.

5.caption: Vulnerability Management
5.description: Any agent or sensor that provides vulnerability management or scanning capabilities. E.g., Qualys VMDR, Microsoft Defender for Endpoint, Crowdstrike Spotlight, Amazon Inspector Agent.

7.caption: Mobile Device Management
7.description: Any agent or sensor responsible for providing Mobile Device Management (MDM) or Mobile Enterprise Management (MEM) capabilities. E.g., JumpCloud Agent, Esper Agent, Jamf Pro binary.

8.caption: Configuration Management
8.description: Any agent or sensor that provides configuration management of a device, such as scanning for software, license management, or applying configurations. E.g., AWS Systems Manager Agent, Flexera, ServiceNow MID Server.

9.caption: Remote Access
9.description: Any agent or sensor that provides remote access capabilities to a device. E.g., BeyondTrust, Amazon Systems Manager Agent, Verkada Agent.

policies.caption: Agent Policies
policies.description: Describes the various policies that may be applied or enforced by an agent or sensor. E.g., Conditional Access, prevention, auto-update, tamper protection, destination configuration, etc.

uid_alt.caption: Alternate Agent ID
uid_alt.description: An alternative or contextual identifier for the agent or sensor, such as a configuration, organization, or license UID.

vendor_name.caption: Vendor Name
vendor_name.description: The company or author who created the agent or sensor. For example: Crowdstrike.

whois.caption: WHOIS
whois.name: whois
whois.description: The resources of a WHOIS record for a given domain. This can include domain names, IP address blocks, autonomous system information, and/or contact and registration information for a domain.

status.caption: Domain Status
status.description: The status of a domain and its ability to be transferred, e.g., clientTransferProhibited.

domain.caption: Domain
domain.description: The domain name corresponding to the WHOIS record.

subdomains.caption: Subdomains
subdomains.description: An array of subdomain strings. Can be used to collect several subdomains such as those from Domain Generation Algorithms (DGAs).

subnet.caption: Subnet Block
subnet.description: The IP address block (CIDR) associated with a domain.

autonomous_system.caption: Autonomous System
autonomous_system.description: The autonomous system information associated with a domain.

created_time.caption: Registered At
created_time.description: When the domain was registered or WHOIS entry was created.

dnssec_status_id.caption: DNSSEC Status ID
dnssec_status_id.description: Describes the normalized status of DNS Security Extensions (DNSSEC) for a domain.

1.caption: Signed
1.description: The related domain enables the signing of DNS records using DNSSEC.

2.caption: Unsigned
2.description: The related domain does not enable the signing of DNS records using DNSSEC.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The DNSSEC status is not mapped. See the dnssec_status attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

email_addr.caption: Registrar Abuse Email Address
email_addr.description: The email address for the registrar's abuse contact

isp.caption: ISP Name
isp.description: The name of the Internet Service Provider (ISP).

isp_org.caption: ISP Org
isp_org.description: The organization name of the Internet Service Provider (ISP). This represents the parent organization or company that owns/operates the ISP. For example, Comcast Corporation would be the ISP org for Xfinity internet service. This attribute helps identify the ultimate provider when ISPs operate under different brand names.

last_seen_time.caption: Last Updated At
last_seen_time.description: When the WHOIS record was last updated or seen at.

name_servers.caption: Name Servers
name_servers.description: A collection of name servers related to a domain registration or other record.

phone_number.caption: Registrar Abuse Phone Number
phone_number.description: The phone number for the registrar's abuse contact

created_time_dt.caption: Registered At
created_time_dt.description: When the domain was registered or WHOIS entry was created.

last_seen_time_dt.caption: Last Updated At
last_seen_time_dt.description: When the WHOIS record was last updated or seen at.

advisory.caption: Advisory
advisory.name: advisory
advisory.description: The Advisory object represents publicly disclosed cybersecurity vulnerabilities defined in a Security advisory. e.g. Microsoft KB Article, Apple Security Advisory, or a GitHub Security Advisory (GHSA)

size.caption: Size
size.description: The size in bytes for the Advisory. Usually populated for a KB Article patch.

os.caption: OS
os.description: The operating system the Advisory applies to.

title.caption: Title
title.description: A title or a brief phrase summarizing the Advisory.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: A brief description of the Advisory Record.

product.caption: Product
product.description: The product where the vulnerability was discovered.

uid.caption: Advisory ID
uid.description: The unique identifier assigned to the advisory or disclosed vulnerability, e.g, GHSA-5mrr-rgp6-x4gr.

references.caption: References
references.description: A list of reference URLs with additional information about the vulnerabilities disclosed in the Advisory.

classification.caption: Classification
classification.description: The vendors classification of the Advisory.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the Advisory record was created.

install_state.caption: Install State
install_state.description: The install state of the Advisory.

install_state_id.caption: Install State ID
install_state_id.description: The normalized install state ID of the Advisory.

3.caption: Installed Pending Reboot
3.description: The item is installed pending reboot operation.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The normalized install state is unknown.

1.caption: Installed
1.description: The item is installed.

2.caption: Not Installed
2.description: The item is not installed.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The install state is not mapped. See the install_state attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

is_superseded.caption: The patch is superseded.
is_superseded.description: The Advisory has been replaced by another.

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The time when the Advisory record was last updated.

related_cves.caption: Related CVEs
related_cves.description: A list of Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) identifiers related to the vulnerabilities disclosed in the Advisory.

related_cwes.caption: Related CWEs
related_cwes.description: A list of Common Weakness Enumeration (CWE) identifiers related to the vulnerabilities disclosed in the Advisory.

src_url.caption: Source URL
src_url.description: The Advisory link from the source vendor.

modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time
modified_time_dt.description: The time when the Advisory record was last updated.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The time when the Advisory record was created.

scan.caption: Scan
scan.name: scan
scan.description: The Scan object describes characteristics of a proactive scan.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The administrator-supplied or application-generated name of the scan. For example: "Home office weekly user database scan", "Scan folders for viruses", "Full system virus scan"

type.caption: Type
type.description: The type of scan.

uid.caption: Scan UID
uid.description: The application-defined unique identifier assigned to an instance of a scan.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The type id of the scan.

3.caption: Updated Content
3.description: The scan was triggered by a content update.

6.caption: User Logon
6.description: The scan was started due to a user logon.

1.caption: Manual
1.description: The scan was manually initiated by the user or administrator.

2.caption: Scheduled
2.description: The scan was started based on scheduler.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The scan type id is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

4.caption: Quarantined Items
4.description: The scan was triggered by newly quarantined items.

5.caption: Attached Media
5.description: The scan was triggered by the attachment of removable media.

7.caption: ELAM
7.description: The scan was triggered by an Early Launch Anti-Malware (ELAM) detection.

display.caption: Display
display.name: display
display.description: The Display object contains information about the physical or virtual display connected to a computer system.

physical_height.caption: Physical Height
physical_height.description: The numeric physical height of display.

physical_orientation.caption: Physical Orientation
physical_orientation.description: The numeric physical orientation of display.

physical_width.caption: Physical Width
physical_width.description: The numeric physical width of display.

scale_factor.caption: Scale Factor
scale_factor.description: The numeric scale factor of display.

discovery_details.caption: Discovery Details
discovery_details.name: discovery_details
discovery_details.description: The Discovery Details object describes results of a discovery task/job.

count.caption: Count
count.description: The number of discovered entities of the specified type.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The specific type of information that was discovered. e.g. name, phone_number, etc.

value.caption: Value
value.description: Optionally, the specific value of discovered information.

occurrence_details.caption: Occurrence Details
occurrence_details.description: Details about where in the target entity, specified information was discovered. Only the attributes, relevant to the target entity type should be populuated.

occurrences.caption: Occurrences
occurrences.description: Details about where in the target entity, specified information was discovered. Only the attributes, relevant to the target entity type should be populuated.

vulnerability.caption: Vulnerability Details
vulnerability.name: vulnerability
vulnerability.description: The vulnerability is an unintended characteristic of a computing component or system configuration that multiplies the risk of an adverse event or a loss occurring either due to accidental exposure, deliberate attack, or conflict with new system components.

title.caption: Title
title.description: A title or a brief phrase summarizing the discovered vulnerability.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the vulnerability.

category.caption: Category
category.description: The category of a vulnerability or weakness, as reported by the source tool, such as Container Security or Open Source Security.

references.caption: References
references.description: A list of reference URLs with additional information about the vulnerability.

severity.caption: Severity
severity.description: The vendor assigned severity of the vulnerability.

remediation.caption: Remediation Guidance
remediation.description: The remediation recommendations on how to mitigate the identified vulnerability.

advisory.caption: Security Advisory
advisory.description: Detail about the security advisory, that is used to publicly disclose cybersecurity vulnerabilities by a vendor.

affected_code.caption: Affected Code
affected_code.description: List of Affected Code objects that describe details about code blocks identified as vulnerable.

affected_packages.caption: Affected Software Packages
affected_packages.description: List of software packages identified as affected by a vulnerability/vulnerabilities.

cve.caption: CVE
cve.description: Describes the Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) details related to the vulnerability.

cwe.caption: CWE
cwe.description: Describes the Common Weakness Enumeration (CWE) details related to the vulnerability.

dependency_chain.caption: Dependency Chain
dependency_chain.description: Information about the chain of dependencies related to the issue as reported by an Application Security or Vulnerability Management tool. E.g., serverless-offline -> @serverless/utils -> memoizee -> es5-ext.

exploit_last_seen_time.caption: Exploit Last Seen Time
exploit_last_seen_time.description: The time when the exploit was most recently observed.

exploit_ref_url.caption: Exploit URL
exploit_ref_url.description: The URL of the exploit code or Proof-of-Concept (PoC).

exploit_requirement.caption: Exploit Requirement
exploit_requirement.description: The requirement description related to any constraints around exploit execution.

exploit_type.caption: Exploit Type
exploit_type.description: The categorization or type of Exploit. E.g., Network or Physical.

first_seen_time.caption: First Seen
first_seen_time.description: The time when the vulnerability was first observed.

fix_available.caption: Fix Availability
fix_available.description: Indicates if a fix is available for the reported vulnerability.

fix_coverage.caption: Fix Coverage
fix_coverage.description: The fix coverage, normalized to the caption of the fix_coverage_id value.

fix_coverage_id.caption: Fix Coverage ID
fix_coverage_id.description: The normalized identifier for fix coverage, applicable to this vulnerability. Typically useful, when there are multiple affected packages but only a subset have available fixes.

3.caption: None
3.description: No fixes or patches are currently available for any of the affected packages and components.

1.caption: Complete
1.description: All affected packages and components have available fixes or patches to remediate the vulnerability.

2.caption: Partial
2.description: Only some of the affected packages and components have available fixes or patches, while others remain vulnerable.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The fix coverage is not mapped. See the fix_coverage attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

is_exploit_available.caption: Exploit Availability
is_exploit_available.description: Indicates if an exploit or a PoC (proof-of-concept) is available for the reported vulnerability.

is_fix_available.caption: Fix Availability
is_fix_available.description: Indicates if a fix is available for the reported vulnerability.

kb_article_list.caption: Knowledgebase Articles
kb_article_list.description: A list of KB articles or patches related to an endpoint. A KB Article contains metadata that describes the patch or an update.

kb_articles.caption: Knowledgebase Articles
kb_articles.description: The KB article/s related to the entity. A KB Article contains metadata that describes the patch or an update.

last_seen_time.caption: Last Seen
last_seen_time.description: The time when the vulnerability was most recently observed.

packages.caption: Software Packages
packages.description: List of vulnerable packages as identified by the security product

related_vulnerabilities.caption: Related Vulnerability IDs
related_vulnerabilities.description: List of vulnerability IDs (e.g. CVE ID) that are related to this vulnerability.

vendor_name.caption: Vendor Name
vendor_name.description: The name of the vendor that identified the vulnerability.

exploit_last_seen_time_dt.caption: Exploit Last Seen Time
exploit_last_seen_time_dt.description: The time when the exploit was most recently observed.

first_seen_time_dt.caption: First Seen
first_seen_time_dt.description: The time when the vulnerability was first observed.

last_seen_time_dt.caption: Last Seen
last_seen_time_dt.description: The time when the vulnerability was most recently observed.

kernel.caption: Kernel Resource
kernel.name: kernel
kernel.description: The Kernel Resource object provides information about a specific kernel resource, including its name and type. It describes essential attributes associated with a resource managed by the kernel of an operating system.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the kernel resource.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The type of the kernel resource.

path.caption: Path
path.description: The full path of the kernel resource.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The type of the kernel resource.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

is_system.caption: System
is_system.description: The indication of whether the object is part of the operating system.

system_call.caption: System Call
system_call.description: The system call that was invoked.

win/win_resource.caption: Windows Resource
win/win_resource.name: win_resource
win/win_resource.description: The Windows resource object describes a resource object managed by Windows, such as mutant or timer.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the resource object.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The type of the Windows resource object.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The Windows provided handle identifier for the resource object

labels.caption: Labels
labels.description: The list of labels associated to the resource.

details.caption: Details
details.description: The string detailing the attributes of the resource object.

tags.caption: Tags
tags.description: The list of tags; {key:value} pairs associated to the resource.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The normalized type identifier of the Windows resource object accessed.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The resource object type is unknown.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The resource object type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which may contain a data source specific value.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the resource was created.

data_classification.caption: Data Classification
data_classification.description: The Data Classification object includes information about data classification levels and data category types.

data_classifications.caption: Data Classification
data_classifications.description: A list of Data Classification objects, that include information about data classification levels and data category types, indentified by a classifier.

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The time when the resource was last modified.

svc_name.caption: Service Name
svc_name.description: The Windows service acting as the object server for the resource object, such as Security or Security Account Manager.

uid_alt.caption: Alternate ID
uid_alt.description: The alternative unique identifier of the resource.

modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time
modified_time_dt.description: The time when the resource was last modified.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The time when the resource was created.

campaign.caption: Campaign
campaign.name: campaign
campaign.description: Campaign represent organized efforts by threat actors to achieve malicious objectives over a period, often characterized by shared tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs).

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of a specific campaign associated with a cyber threat.

database.caption: Database
database.name: database
database.description: The database object is used for databases which are typically datastore services that contain an organized collection of structured and unstructured data or a types of data.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The database name, ordinarily as assigned by a database administrator.

size.caption: Size
size.description: The size of the database in bytes.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The database type.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the database.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the database.

groups.caption: Groups
groups.description: The group names to which the database belongs.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The normalized identifier of the database type.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the database was known to have been created.

data_classification.caption: Data Classification
data_classification.description: The Data Classification object includes information about data classification levels and data category types.

data_classifications.caption: Data Classification
data_classifications.description: A list of Data Classification objects, that include information about data classification levels and data category types, indentified by a classifier.

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The most recent time when any changes, updates, or modifications were made within the database.

modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time
modified_time_dt.description: The most recent time when any changes, updates, or modifications were made within the database.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The time when the database was known to have been created.

analysis_target.caption: Analysis Target
analysis_target.name: analysis_target
analysis_target.description: The analysis target defines the scope of monitored activities, specifying what entity, system or process is analyzed for activity patterns.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The specific name or identifier of the analysis target, such as the username of a User Account, the name of a Kubernetes Cluster, the identifier of a Network Namespace, or the name of an Application Component.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The category of the analysis target, such as User Account, Kubernetes Cluster, Network Namespace, or Application Component.

unmanned_aerial_system.caption: Unmanned Aerial System
unmanned_aerial_system.name: unmanned_aerial_system
unmanned_aerial_system.description: The Unmanned Aerial System object describes the characteristics, Position Location Information (PLI), and other metadata of Unmanned Aerial Systems (UAS) and other unmanned and drone systems used in Remote ID. Remote ID is defined in the Standard Specification for Remote ID and Tracking (ASTM Designation: F3411-22a) ASTM F3411-22a.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the unmanned system as reported by tracking or sensing hardware.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The type of the UAS. For example, Helicopter, Gyroplane, Rocket, etc.

speed.caption: Speed
speed.description: Ground speed of flight. This value is provided in meters per second with a minimum resolution of 0.25 m/s. Special Values: Invalid, No Value, or Unknown: 255 m/s.

location.caption: UAS Position Location Information
location.description: The detailed geographical location usually associated with an IP address.

uid.caption: UAS ID
uid.description: The primary identification identifier for an unmanned system. This can be a Serial Number (in CTA-2063-A format, the Registration ID (provided by the CAA, a UTM, or a unique Session ID.

uuid.caption: UTM UUID
uuid.description: The Unmanned Aircraft System Traffic Management (UTM) provided universal unique ID (UUID) traceable to a non-obfuscated ID where this UTM UUID acts as a 'session id' to protect exposure of operationally sensitive information.

0.caption: Unknown/Undeclared
0.description: The UAS type is empty or not declared.

2.caption: Helicopter
2.description: Can also be a Multi-rotor Unmanned Aircraft (e.g., Quad-copter).

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

4.caption: Hybrid Lift
4.description: Fixed wing aircraft that can take off vertically.

10.caption: Airship
10.description: E.g., a blimp.

11.caption: Free Fall/Parachute
11.description: Parachutes, or objects without any power or propulsion mechanism.

model.caption: Model
model.description: The model name of the aircraft or unmanned system.

serial_number.caption: Serial Number
serial_number.description: The serial number of the unmanned system. This is expressed in CTA-2063-A format.

speed_accuracy.caption: Speed Accuracy
speed_accuracy.description: Provides quality/containment on horizontal ground speed. Measured in meters/second.

track_direction.caption: Track Direction
track_direction.description: Direction of flight expressed as a “True North-based” ground track angle. This value is provided in clockwise degrees with a minimum resolution of 1 degree. If aircraft is not moving horizontally, use the “Unknown” value

uid_alt.caption: UAS Alternate ID
uid_alt.description: A secondary identification identifier for an unmanned system. This can be a Serial Number (in CTA-2063-A format, the Registration ID (provided by the CAA, a UTM, or a unique Session ID.

vertical_speed.caption: Vertical Speed
vertical_speed.description: Vertical speed upward relative to the WGS-84 datum, measured in meters per second. Special Values: Invalid, No Value, or Unknown: 63 m/s.

unmanned_system_operating_area.caption: Unmanned System Operating Area
unmanned_system_operating_area.name: unmanned_system_operating_area
unmanned_system_operating_area.description: The Unmanned System Operating Area object describes details about a precise area of operations for a UAS flight or mission.

count.caption: Count
count.description: Indicates the number of UAS in the operating area.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The type of operating area. For example, Takeoff Location, Fixed Location, Dynamic Location.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the geographical location.

long.caption: Longitude
long.description: The geographical Longitude coordinate represented in Decimal Degrees (DD). For example: -71.057083.

start_time.caption: Start Time
start_time.description: The date and time at which a group or an Intent-Based Network Participant operation starts. (This field is only applicable to Network Remote ID.)

country.caption: Country
country.description:
The ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2 country code.

Note: The two letter country code should be capitalized. For example: US or CA.

coordinates.caption: Coordinates
coordinates.description: A two-element array, containing a longitude/latitude pair. The format conforms with GeoJSON. For example: [-73.983, 40.719].

0.caption: Unknown/Undeclared
0.description: The UA type is empty or not declared.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

end_time.caption: End Time
end_time.description: The date and time at which a group or an Intent-Based Network Participant operation ends. (This field is only applicable to Network Remote ID.)

start_time_dt.caption: Start Time
start_time_dt.description: The date and time at which a group or an Intent-Based Network Participant operation starts. (This field is only applicable to Network Remote ID.)

end_time_dt.caption: End Time
end_time_dt.description: The date and time at which a group or an Intent-Based Network Participant operation ends. (This field is only applicable to Network Remote ID.)

aerial_height.caption: Aerial Height
aerial_height.description: Expressed as either height above takeoff location or height above ground level (AGL) for a UAS current location. This value is provided in meters and must have a minimum resolution of 1 m. Special Values: Invalid, No Value, or Unknown: -1000 m.

altitude_ceiling.caption: Altitude Ceiling
altitude_ceiling.description: Maximum altitude (WGS-84 HAE) for a group or an Intent-Based Network Participant. Measured in meters. Special Values: Invalid, No Value, or Unknown: -1000 m.

altitude_floor.caption: Altitude Floor
altitude_floor.description: Minimum altitude (WGS-84 HAE) for a group or an Intent-Based Network Participant. Measured in meters. Special Values: Invalid, No Value, or Unknown: -1000 m.

geodetic_altitude.caption: Geodetic Altitude
geodetic_altitude.description: The aircraft distance above or below the ellipsoid as measured along a line that passes through the aircraft and is normal to the surface of the WGS-84 ellipsoid. This value is provided in meters and must have a minimum resolution of 1 m. Special Values: Invalid, No Value, or Unknown: -1000 m.

geodetic_vertical_accuracy.caption: Geodetic Vertical Accuracy
geodetic_vertical_accuracy.description: Provides quality/containment on geodetic altitude. This is based on ADS-B Geodetic Vertical Accuracy (GVA). Measured in meters.

geohash.caption: Geohash
geohash.description:
Geohash of the geo-coordinates (latitude and longitude).

Geohashing is a geocoding system used to encode geographic coordinates in decimal degrees, to a single string.

horizontal_accuracy.caption: Horizontal Accuracy
horizontal_accuracy.description: Provides quality/containment on horizontal position. This is based on ADS-B NACp. Measured in meters.

is_on_premises.caption: On Premises
is_on_premises.description: The indication of whether the location is on premises.

isp.caption: ISP Name
isp.description: The name of the Internet Service Provider (ISP).

@deprecated.message: Utilize isp attribute available in network_endpoint, whois objects according to your use-case.

lat.caption: Latitude
lat.description: The geographical Latitude coordinate represented in Decimal Degrees (DD). For example: 42.361145.

locations.caption: Operating Polygon
locations.description: A list of Position Location Information (PLI) (latitude/longitude pairs) defining the area where a group or Intent-Based Network Participant operation is taking place. (This field is only applicable to Network Remote ID.)

postal_code.caption: Postal Code
postal_code.description: The postal code of the location.

pressure_altitude.caption: Pressure Altitude
pressure_altitude.description: The uncorrected barometric pressure altitude (based on reference standard 29.92 inHg, 1013.25 mb) provides a reference for algorithms that utilize 'altitude deltas' between aircraft. This value is provided in meters and must have a minimum resolution of 1 m.. Special Values: Invalid, No Value, or Unknown: -1000 m.

provider.caption: Provider
provider.description: The provider of the geographical location data.

radius.caption: Operating Area Radius
radius.description: Farthest horizontal distance from the reported location at which any UA in a group may be located (meters). Also allows defining the area where an Intent-Based Network Participant operation is taking place. Default: 0 m.

region.caption: Region
region.description: The alphanumeric code that identifies the principal subdivision (e.g. province or state) of the country. For example, 'CH-VD' for the Canton of Vaud, Switzerland

query_evidence.caption: Query Evidence
query_evidence.name: query_evidence
query_evidence.description: The specific resulting evidence information that was queried or discovered. When mapping raw telemetry data users should select the appropriate child object that best matches the evidence type as defined by query_type_id.

module.caption: Module
module.description: The module that pertains to the event when query_type_id indicates a Module query.

process.caption: Process
process.description: The process that pertains to the event when query_type_id indicates a Process query.

session.caption: Session
session.description: The authenticated user or service session when query_type_id indicates a Session query.

file.caption: File
file.description: The file that is the target of the query when query_type_id indicates a File query.

state.caption: Network Connection State
state.description: The state of the socket, normalized to the caption of the state_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

user.caption: User
user.description: The user that pertains to the event when query_type_id indicates a User query.

kernel.caption: Kernel
kernel.description: The kernel object that pertains to the event when query_type_id indicates a Kernel query.

service.caption: Service
service.description: The service that pertains to the event when query_type_id indicates a Service query.

group.caption: Group
group.description: The administrative group that is the target of the query when query_type_id indicates an Admin Group query.

users.caption: Users
users.description: The users that belong to the administrative group when query_type_id indicates a Users query.

connection_info.caption: Connection Info
connection_info.description: The network connection information related to a Network Connection query type.

folder.caption: Folder
folder.description: The folder that is the target of the query when query_type_id indicates a Folder query.

job.caption: Job
job.description: The job object that pertains to the event when query_type_id indicates a Job query.

network_interfaces.caption: Network Interfaces
network_interfaces.description: The physical or virtual network interfaces that are associated with the device when query_type_id indicates a Network Interfaces query.

peripheral_device.caption: Peripheral Device
peripheral_device.description: The peripheral device that triggered the event when query_type_id indicates a Peripheral Device query.

query_type.caption: Query Type
query_type.description: The normalized caption of query_type_id or the source-specific query type.

query_type_id.caption: Query Type ID
query_type_id.description: The normalized type of system query performed against a device or system component.

3.caption: Folder
3.description: A query about folder attributes, metadata, content, or structure.

6.caption: Module
6.description: A query about loaded modules, their base addresses, load types, or function entry points.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The query type was unknown or not specified.

1.caption: Kernel
1.description: A query about kernel resources including system calls, shared mutex, or other kernel components.

2.caption: File
2.description: A query about file attributes, metadata, content, hash values, or properties.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The query type was not mapped to a standard category. See the query_type attribute for source-specific value.

4.caption: Admin Group
4.description: A query about group membership, privileges, domain, or group properties.

5.caption: Job
5.description: A query about scheduled jobs, their command lines, run states, or execution times.

7.caption: Network Connection
7.description: A query about active network connections, boundaries, protocols, or TCP states.

8.caption: Network Interfaces
8.description: A query about physical or virtual network interfaces, their IP/MAC addresses, or types.

9.caption: Peripheral Device
9.description: A query about attached peripheral devices, their classes, models, or vendor information.

10.caption: Process
10.description: A query about running processes, command lines, ancestry, loaded modules, or execution context.

11.caption: Service
11.description: A query about system services, their names, versions, labels, or properties.

12.caption: Session
12.description: A query about authenticated user or service sessions, their creation times, or issuer details.

14.caption: Users
14.description: A query about multiple users belonging to an administrative group.

15.caption: Startup Item
15.description: A query about startup configuration items, their run modes, start types, or current states.

16.caption: Registry Key
16.description: A Windows-specific query about registry keys, their paths, security descriptors, or modification times.

17.caption: Registry Value
17.description: A Windows-specific query about registry values, their data types, content, or names.

18.caption: Prefetch
18.description: A Windows-specific query about prefetch files, their run counts, last execution times, or existence.

13.caption: User
13.description: A query about user accounts, their properties, credentials, or domain information.

startup_item.caption: Startup Item
startup_item.description: The startup item object that pertains to the event when query_type_id indicates a Startup Item query.

tcp_state_id.caption: TCP State ID
tcp_state_id.description: The state of the TCP socket for the network connection.

3.caption: SYN-RECEIVED
3.description: The socket has passively received a connection request from a remote peer.

6.caption: TIME-WAIT
6.description: The socket connection has been closed by the local application, the remote peer has closed its half of the connection, and the system is waiting to be sure that the remote peer received the last acknowledgement.

1.caption: ESTABLISHED
1.description: The socket has an established connection between a local application and a remote peer.

2.caption: SYN-SENT
2.description: The socket is actively trying to establish a connection to a remote peer.

4.caption: FIN-WAIT-1
4.description: The socket connection has been closed by the local application, the remote peer has not yet acknowledged the close, and the system is waiting for it to close its half of the connection.

5.caption: FIN-WAIT-2
5.description: The socket connection has been closed by the local application, the remote peer has acknowledged the close, and the system is waiting for it to close its half of the connection.

7.caption: CLOSED
7.description: The socket is not in use.

8.caption: CLOSE-WAIT
8.description: The socket connection has been closed by the remote peer, and the system is waiting for the local application to close its half of the connection.

9.caption: LAST-ACK
9.description: The socket connection has been closed by the remote peer, the local application has closed its half of the connection, and the system is waiting for the remote peer to acknowledge the close.

10.caption: LISTEN
10.description: The socket is listening for incoming connections.

11.caption: CLOSING
11.description: The socket connection has been closed by the local application and the remote peer simultaneously, and the remote peer has not yet acknowledged the close attempt of the local application.

reg_key.caption: Registry Key
reg_key.description: The registry key object describes a Windows registry key.

reg_value.caption: Registry Value
reg_value.description: The registry key object describes a Windows registry value.

classifier_details.caption: Classifier Details
classifier_details.name: classifier_details
classifier_details.description: The Classifier Details object describes details about the classifier used for data classification.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the classifier.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The type of the classifier.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the classifier.

osint.caption: OSINT
osint.name: osint
osint.description: The OSINT (Open Source Intelligence) object contains details related to an indicator such as the indicator itself, related indicators, geolocation, registrar information, subdomains, analyst commentary, and other contextual information. This information can be used to further enrich a detection or finding by providing decisioning support to other analysts and engineers.

answers.caption: Related DNS Answers
answers.description: Any pertinent DNS answers information related to an indicator or OSINT analysis.

references.caption: References
references.description: Provides a reference to an external source of information related to the CTI being represented. This may include a URL, a document, or some other type of reference that provides additional context or information about the CTI.

confidence.caption: Confidence
confidence.description: The confidence of an indicator being malicious and/or pertinent, normalized to the caption of the confidence_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source or analyst.

severity.caption: Severity
severity.description: Represents the severity level of the threat indicator, typically reflecting its potential impact or damage.

uploaded_time.caption: Uploaded Time
uploaded_time.description: The timestamp indicating when the associated indicator or intelligence was added to the system or repository.

risk_score.caption: Risk Score
risk_score.description: A numerical representation of the threat indicator’s risk level.

category.caption: Category
category.description: Categorizes the threat indicator based on its functional or operational role.

intrusion_sets.caption: Intrusion Sets
intrusion_sets.description: A grouping of adversarial behaviors and resources believed to be associated with specific threat actors or campaigns. Intrusion sets often encompass multiple campaigns and are used to organize related activities under a common label.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The timestamp when the indicator was initially created or identified.

attacks.caption: MITRE ATT&CK® and ATLAS™ Details
attacks.description: MITRE ATT&CK Tactics, Techniques, and/or Procedures (TTPs) pertinent to an indicator or OSINT analysis.

autonomous_system.caption: Autonomous System
autonomous_system.description: Any pertinent autonomous system information related to an indicator or OSINT analysis.

reputation.caption: Reputation Scores
reputation.description: Related reputational analysis from third-party engines and analysts for a given indicator or OSINT analysis.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The timestamp when the indicator was initially created or identified.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: A detailed explanation of the indicator, including its context, purpose, and relevance.

signatures.caption: Related Digital Signatures
signatures.description: Any digital signatures or hashes related to an indicator or OSINT analysis.

script.caption: Related Script Data
script.description: Any pertinent script information related to an indicator or OSINT analysis.

file.caption: Related File
file.description: Any pertinent file information related to an indicator or OSINT analysis.

value.caption: Indicator
value.description: The actual indicator value in scope, e.g., a SHA-256 hash hexdigest or a domain name.

malware.caption: Malware
malware.description: A list of Malware objects, describing details about the identified malware.

kill_chain.caption: Kill Chain
kill_chain.description: Lockheed Martin Kill Chain Phases pertinent to an indicator or OSINT analysis.

expiration_time_dt.caption: Expiration Time
expiration_time_dt.description: The expiration date of the indicator, after which it is no longer considered reliable.

related_analytics.caption: Related Analytics
related_analytics.description: Any analytics related to an indicator or OSINT analysis.

creator.caption: Creator
creator.description: The identifier of the user, system, or organization that contributed the indicator.

tlp.caption: Traffic Light Protocol
tlp.description: The Traffic Light Protocol was created to facilitate greater sharing of potentially sensitive information and more effective collaboration. TLP provides a simple and intuitive schema for indicating with whom potentially sensitive information can be shared.

AMBER.caption: TLP:AMBER
AMBER.description: TLP:AMBER is for limited disclosure, recipients can only spread this on a need-to-know basis within their organization and its clients. Note that TLP:AMBER+STRICT restricts sharing to the organization only. Sources may use TLP:AMBER when information requires support to be effectively acted upon, yet carries risk to privacy, reputation, or operations if shared outside of the organizations involved. Recipients may share TLP:AMBER information with members of their own organization and its clients, but only on a need-to-know basis to protect their organization and its clients and prevent further harm. Note: if the source wants to restrict sharing to the organization only, they must specify TLP:AMBER+STRICT.

AMBER STRICT.caption: TLP:AMBER+STRICT
AMBER STRICT.description: TLP:AMBER is for limited disclosure, recipients can only spread this on a need-to-know basis within their organization and its clients. Note that TLP:AMBER+STRICT restricts sharing to the organization only. Sources may use TLP:AMBER when information requires support to be effectively acted upon, yet carries risk to privacy, reputation, or operations if shared outside of the organizations involved. Recipients may share TLP:AMBER information with members of their own organization and its clients, but only on a need-to-know basis to protect their organization and its clients and prevent further harm. Note: if the source wants to restrict sharing to the organization only, they must specify TLP:AMBER+STRICT.

CLEAR.caption: TLP:CLEAR
CLEAR.description: TLP:CLEAR denotes that recipients can spread this to the world, there is no limit on disclosure. Sources may use TLP:CLEAR when information carries minimal or no foreseeable risk of misuse, in accordance with applicable rules and procedures for public release. Subject to standard copyright rules, TLP:CLEAR information may be shared without restriction.

GREEN.caption: TLP:GREEN
GREEN.description: TLP:GREEN is for limited disclosure, recipients can spread this within their community. Sources may use TLP:GREEN when information is useful to increase awareness within their wider community. Recipients may share TLP:GREEN information with peers and partner organizations within their community, but not via publicly accessible channels. TLP:GREEN information may not be shared outside of the community. Note: when “community” is not defined, assume the cybersecurity/defense community.

RED.caption: TLP:RED
RED.description: TLP:RED is for the eyes and ears of individual recipients only, no further disclosure. Sources may use TLP:RED when information cannot be effectively acted upon without significant risk for the privacy, reputation, or operations of the organizations involved. Recipients may therefore not share TLP:RED information with anyone else. In the context of a meeting, for example, TLP:RED information is limited to those present at the meeting.

WHITE.caption: TLP:WHITE
WHITE.description: TLP:WHITE and TLP:CLEAR may be used interchangeably, TLP:WHITE is the most up to date (as of TLP 2.0) usage.

subdomains.caption: Related Subdomains
subdomains.description: Any pertinent subdomain information - such as those generated by a Domain Generation Algorithm - related to an indicator or OSINT analysis.

location.caption: Geo Location
location.description: Any pertinent geolocation information related to an indicator or OSINT analysis.

severity_id.caption: Severity ID
severity_id.description: The normalized severity level of the threat indicator, typically reflecting its potential impact or damage.

3.caption: Medium
3.description: Action is required but the situation is not serious at this time.

6.caption: Fatal
6.description: An error occurred but it is too late to take remedial action.

1.caption: Informational
1.description: Informational message. No action required.

2.caption: Low
2.description: The user decides if action is needed.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event/finding severity is not mapped. See the severity attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

4.caption: High
4.description: Action is required immediately.

5.caption: Critical
5.description: Action is required immediately and the scope is broad.

comment.caption: Analyst Comments
comment.description: Analyst commentary or source commentary about an indicator or OSINT analysis.

uploaded_time_dt.caption: Uploaded Time
uploaded_time_dt.description: The timestamp indicating when the associated indicator or intelligence was added to the system or repository.

src_url.caption: Source URL
src_url.description: The source URL of an indicator or OSINT analysis, e.g., a URL back to a TIP, report, or otherwise.

3.caption: Hostname
3.description: A hostname or computer name.

6.caption: User Agent
6.description: A User Agent typically seen in HTTP request headers.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The indicator type is ambiguous or there is not a related indicator for the OSINT object.

1.caption: IP Address
1.description: An IPv4 or IPv6 address.

2.caption: Domain
2.description: A full-qualified domain name (FQDN), subdomain, or partial domain.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The indicator type is not directly listed.

4.caption: Hash
4.description: Any type of hash e.g., MD5, SHA1, SHA2, BLAKE, BLAKE2, SSDEEP, VHASH, etc. generated from a file, malware sample, request header, or otherwise used to identify a pertinent artifact.

5.caption: URL
5.description: A Uniform Resource Locator (URL) or Uniform Resource Indicator (URI).

7.caption: Digital Certificate
7.description: The serial number, fingerprint, or full content of an X.509 digital certificate.

8.caption: Email
8.description: The contents of an email or any related information to an email object.

9.caption: Email Address
9.description: An email address.

10.caption: Vulnerability
10.description: A CVE ID, CWE ID, or other identifier for a weakness, exploit, bug, or misconfiguration.

11.caption: File
11.description: A file or metadata about a file.

12.caption: Registry Key
12.description: A Windows Registry Key.

14.caption: Command Line
14.description: A partial or full Command Line used to invoke scripts or other remote commands.

13.caption: Registry Value
13.description: A Windows Registry Value.

subnet.caption: Related Subnet
subnet.description: A CIDR or network block related to an indicator or OSINT analysis.

detection_pattern_type_id.caption: Detection Pattern Type ID
detection_pattern_type_id.description: Specifies the type of detection pattern used to identify the associated threat indicator.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The detection pattern type is not mapped. See the detection_pattern_type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier for the OSINT object.

vulnerabilities.caption: Related Vulnerabilities
vulnerabilities.description: Any vulnerabilities related to an indicator or OSINT analysis.

threat_actor.caption: Threat Actor
threat_actor.description: A threat actor is an individual or group that conducts malicious cyber activities, often with financial, political, or ideological motives.

detection_pattern_type.caption: Detection Pattern
detection_pattern_type.description: The detection pattern type, normalized to the caption of the detection_pattern_type_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name is a pointer/reference to an attribute within the OCSF event data. For example: file.name.

email_auth.caption: Related Email Authentication
email_auth.description: Any email authentication information pertinent to an indicator or OSINT analysis.

whois.caption: WHOIS
whois.description: Any pertinent WHOIS information related to an indicator or OSINT analysis.

campaign.caption: Campaign
campaign.description: The campaign object describes details about the campaign that was the source of the activity.

modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time
modified_time_dt.description: The timestamp of the last modification or update to the indicator.

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The timestamp of the last modification or update to the indicator.

detection_pattern.caption: Detection Pattern
detection_pattern.description: The specific detection pattern or signature associated with the indicator.

vendor_name.caption: Vendor Name
vendor_name.description: The vendor name of a tool which generates intelligence or provides indicators.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The OSINT indicator type.

confidence_id.caption: Confidence ID
confidence_id.description: The normalized confidence refers to the accuracy of collected information related to the OSINT or how pertinent an indicator or analysis is to a specific event or finding. A low confidence means that the information collected or analysis conducted lacked detail or is not accurate enough to qualify an indicator as fully malicious.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The confidence is not mapped to the defined enum values. See the confidence attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

expiration_time.caption: Expiration Time
expiration_time.description: The expiration date of the indicator, after which it is no longer considered reliable.

email.caption: Related Email
email.description: Any email information pertinent to an indicator or OSINT analysis.

external_uid.caption: External ID
external_uid.description: A unique identifier assigned by an external system for cross-referencing.

labels.caption: Labels
labels.description: Tags or keywords associated with the indicator to enhance searchability.

package.caption: Software Package
package.name: package
package.description: The Software Package object describes details about a software package.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The software package name.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The type of software package, normalized to the caption of the type_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The software package version.

uid.caption: Package UID
uid.description: A unique identifier for the package or library reported by the source tool. E.g., the libId within the sbom field of an OX Security Issue or the SPDX components.*.bom-ref.

hash.caption: Hash
hash.description: Cryptographic hash to identify the binary instance of a software component. This can include any component such file, package, or library.

release.caption: Software Release Details
release.description: Release is the number of times a version of the software has been packaged.

epoch.caption: Epoch
epoch.description: The software package epoch. Epoch is a way to define weighted dependencies based on version numbers.

1.caption: Application
1.description: An application software package.

2.caption: Operating System
2.description: An operating system software package.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

license.caption: Software License
license.description: The software license applied to this package.

architecture.caption: Architecture
architecture.description: Architecture is a shorthand name describing the type of computer hardware the packaged software is meant to run on.

cpe_name.caption: The product CPE identifier
cpe_name.description: The Common Platform Enumeration (CPE) name as described by (NIST) For example: cpe:/a:apple:safari:16.2.

license_url.caption: Software License URL
license_url.description: The URL pointing to the license applied on package or software. This is typically a LICENSE.md file within a repository.

package_manager.caption: Package Manager
package_manager.description: The software packager manager utilized to manage a package on a system, e.g. npm, yum, dpkg etc.

package_manager_url.caption: Package Manager URL
package_manager_url.description: The URL of the package or library at the package manager, or the specific URL or URI of an internal package manager link such as AWS CodeArtifact or Artifactory.

purl.caption: Package URL
purl.description: A purl is a URL string used to identify and locate a software package in a mostly universal and uniform way across programming languages, package managers, packaging conventions, tools, APIs and databases.

src_url.caption: Source URL
src_url.description: The link to the specific library or package such as within GitHub, this is different from the link to the package manager where the library or package is hosted.

vendor_name.caption: Vendor Name
vendor_name.description: The name of the vendor who published the software package.

extension.caption: Schema Extension
extension.name: extension
extension.description: The OCSF Schema Extension object provides detailed information about the schema extension used to construct the event. The schema extensions are registered in the extensions.md file.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The schema extension name. For example: dev.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The schema extension version. For example: 1.0.0-alpha.2.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The schema extension unique identifier. For example: 999.

long_string.caption: Long String
long_string.name: long_string
long_string.description: This object is a used to capture strings which may be truncated by a security product due to their length.

value.caption: Value
value.description: The string value, truncated if is_truncated is true.

is_truncated.caption: Is Truncated
is_truncated.description: Indicates that value has been truncated. May be omitted if truncation has not occurred.

untruncated_size.caption: Untruncated Size
untruncated_size.description: The size in bytes of the string represented by value before truncation. Should be omitted if truncation has not occurred.

data_security.caption: Data Security
data_security.name: data_security
data_security.description: The Data Security object describes the characteristics, techniques and content of a Data Loss Prevention (DLP), Data Loss Detection (DLD), Data Classification, or similar tools' finding, alert, or detection mechanism(s).

status.caption: Status
status.description: The resultant status of the classification job normalized to the caption of the status_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

total.caption: Total
total.description: The total count of discovered entities, by the classification job.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the classification job.

category.caption: Category
category.description: The name of the data classification category that data matched into, e.g. Financial, Personal, Governmental, etc.

pattern_match.caption: Pattern Match
pattern_match.description: A text, binary, file name, or datastore that matched against a detection rule.

category_id.caption: Category ID
category_id.description: The normalized identifier of the data classification category.
